context.name: XS_CLI
context.description: This is the server root context.

context.name: Applications
context.description: This level is used to view and modify applications entries.

context.name: ExecutionDataless
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Execution Server application.

context.name: Bcct
context.description: This level is used to view and modify BroadWorks Common Communication Transport ports in the system.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the BCCT-related attributes for the XS.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the BCCT-related attributes for the XS.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Attribute(s) to modify.

parameter.name: nbOfWorkerThreads
parameter.description: Number of worker threads.

parameter.name: backlogQueueSize
parameter.description: Backlog queue size.

parameter.name: keepAlivePeriod
parameter.description: Kill Alive Period.

context.name: Database
context.description: This level is used to configure the database

context.name: DBS
context.description: This level is used to configure the DBS database.

context.name: Databases
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the databases-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Oracle persistency databases configured in the application.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add Oracle persistency databases to the application configuration. It should match the base name of the centralized database specified during the Database Server installation.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the label to identify the database.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the database schema password.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Oracle Persistency databases attributes in the application configuration.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the label to identify the database.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the database schema password.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove Oracle persistency databases from the application configuration.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the label to identify the database.

context.name: Sites
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the sites-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Database Server Observer sites configured in the application.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the label to identify the database.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add the Oracle persistency database sites to the application configuration.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the label to identify the database.

parameter.name: hostName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the database site host name.

parameter.name: portNumber
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the database site port number.

parameter.name: preferred
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether this is the preferred database site for this application.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Oracle persistency databases attributes in the application configuration.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the label to identify the database.

parameter.name: hostName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the database site host name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: portNumber
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the database site port number.

parameter.name: preferred
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether this is the preferred database site for this application.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove Database Server Observer site from the application configuration.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the label to identify the database.

parameter.name: hostName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the database site host name.

command.name: validate
command.description:
This command is used to validate the configuration of the sites and the connection to the Database Server. In addition, it is used to display the status of the sites.
A description of the site status follows: Primary: The primary database resides on this site. Physical Standby: The physical standby database resides on this site. Logical Standby: The logical standby database resides on this site. Not Available: A database is not available on this site or is not running. To troubleshoot, verify that the database is installed and working properly and that BroadWorks is running on the site's node(s). Unreachable: This site or the database listener is unreachable. To troubleshoot, check the network connection to the site and make sure that BroadWorks is running on the site's node(s). Password Mismatch: The password set in the CLI does not match the password set for the database. To troubleshoot, reset the password for the database in the CLI.

context.name: Notifications
context.description: This level is used to view and set the notifications-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the notifications-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the notifications-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: address
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the IP address that is used for real-time notifications over BroadWorks Common Communication Transport (BCCT).

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port the application listens to for real-time notifications over BroadWorks Common Communication Transport (BCCT).

parameter.name: secure
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether the BroadWorks Common Communication Transport (BCCT) connection is secure.

parameter.name: notificationDuration
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the length of time that notifications are persisted in the database (in minutes).

parameter.name: subscriptionDuration
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the length of time that subscriptions are persisted in the database (in minutes).

context.name: Schemas
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the schema-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Oracle persistency schemas configured in the application.

context.name: Instances
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the schemas instances-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Oracle persistency schemas instances configured in the application.

parameter.name: schemaType
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the schema type.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add Oracle persistency schemas instances in the application configuration.

parameter.name: schemaType
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the schema type.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the database schema name. Only letters, numbers and the underscore are allowed in name.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the database schema password.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: database
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the database schema.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Oracle persistency schemas instances in the application configuration.

parameter.name: schemaType
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the schema type.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the database schema name. Only letters, numbers and the underscore are allowed in name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the database schema password.

parameter.name: database
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the database schema.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete Oracle persistency schemas instances in the application.

parameter.name: schemaType
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the schema type.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the database schema name. Only letters, numbers and the underscore are allowed in name.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear Oracle persistency schemas instances attributes in the application.

parameter.name: schemaType
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the schema type.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the database schema name. Only letters, numbers and the underscore are allowed in name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

command.name: validate
command.description:
This command is used to validate the configuration of the schemas and the connection to the Database Server. In addition, it is used to display the status of the schema.
A description of the schema status follows: Read/Write: Read and write access is provided for the schema. Read Only: Read-only access is provided for the schema. Not Available: The schema is not available. To troubleshoot: * Check the status of the site. If the status of the site is "Not Available", "Password Mismatch", or "Unreachable", address the corresponding issues until the status displays "Primary" or "Physical Standby" or "Logical Standby" indicating that the site is available. * When the site is available, use the get command at the Database Server CLI Applications/DbManagement/ DbManager/Schemas level to verify if the schema exists. * If the schema does not exist, use the deploy command to deploy the schema to the database. Password Mismatch: The password set in the CLI does not match the password set for the schema. To troubleshoot, reset the password for the schema in the CLI. Account Locked: The schema account is locked. To troubleshoot, unlock the schema account at the Database Server.

context.description: This level is used to configure the NDS database.

parameter.name: hostName

parameter.name: portNumber

parameter.name: cost

parameter.name: useSSL
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether the connections between the application and the database node are secured.

parameter.name: routingAdminState
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether the database node is allowed to be part of the database route list.

command.name: set

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the label to identify the database.

parameter.name: hostName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the database node host name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: portNumber
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the database node port number.

parameter.name: cost
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the relative cost of using this database node compared to other nodes.

parameter.name: useSSL
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether the connections between the application and the database node are secured.

parameter.name: routingAdminState
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether the database node is allowed to be part of the database route list.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove NDS nodes from the application configuration.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the label to identify the database.

parameter.name: hostName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the database node host name.

command.name: validate
command.description:
This command is used to validate the configuration of the nodes and the connection to the Network Database Server. In addition, it is used to display the status of the nodes.
A description of the node status follows: Read/Write: The node has read and write access. Read Only: The node has read-only access. Not Available: The node is not available or is not running. To troubleshoot, verify that the database is installed and working properly and that BroadWorks is running on the node. Invalid user name or password: The password set in the CLI does not match the password set for the database. To troubleshoot, reset the password for the database in the CLI. Unreachable: This node or the database client listener is unreachable. To troubleshoot, check the network connection to the node and make sure that BroadWorks is running on the node.

context.name: Instances

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view MariaDB persistency schemas instances configured in the application.

parameter.name: schemaType
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the schema type.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify MariaDB persistency schemas instances in the application configuration.

parameter.name: schemaType
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the schema type.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the database schema instance name. Only letters, numbers, and the underscore (_) are allowed in a name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the database schema instance password.

parameter.name: database

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear MariaDB persistency schemas instances attributes in the application.

parameter.name: schemaType
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the schema type.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the database schema instance name. Only letters, numbers, and the underscore (_) are allowed in a name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

command.name: validate
command.description:
This command is used to validate the configuration of the schemas and the connection to the Network Database Server. In addition, it is used to display the status of the schema.
A description of the schema status follows: Read/Write: Read and write access is provided for the schema. Read Only: Read-only access is provided for the schema. Not Available: The schema is not available. To troubleshoot: * Check the status of the nodes. * When the node is available, use the get command at the Network Database Server CLI Applications/DbManagement/ DbManager/Schemas level to verify if the schema exists. * If the schema does not exist, use the deploy command to deploy the schema to the database. Not Configured: The schema instance has no configured database. Associate the schema instance to a database using the CLI. Invalid user name or password: The password set in the CLI does not match the password set for the schema. To troubleshoot, reset the password for the schema in the CLI.

parameter.name: maxQueueSize

parameter.name: showThreadName
parameter.description: This parameter enables thread name logging.

context.name: OutputChannels
context.description: This level is used to view, modify, or clear output channels.

command.name: get

command.name: set

context.name: NameService
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the attributes of the Naming service. The Naming service defines the interaction of the application with a Domain Name System (DNS) or local naming solution.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Naming Service Peers.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Naming Service related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Identifies an attribute to be modified.

parameter.name: cachePolicy
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Cache policy. When this parameter value is set to "HONOR_DNS", the Domain Name System (DNS) client uses the response's ''Time To Live'' (TTL) value.

parameter.name: cacheTTLSecs
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the amount of time (in seconds) a successfully looked-up record is cached if the Cache policy is set to "Configured".

parameter.name: negativeCachePolicy
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the negative Cache policy. When this parameter value is set to "HONOR_DNS", the Domain Name System (DNS) client uses the minimum value of the response's Start of Authority (SOA) record.

parameter.name: negativeCacheTTLSecs
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the amount of time (in seconds) a looked-up record with a negative response is kept in the negative cache if the negative Cache policy is set to "Configured".

parameter.name: unreachableServerLingerSecs
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minimum time interval (in seconds) during which no Domain Name System (DNS) request is sent to a server that is detected as unreachable.

parameter.name: useAdditionalSrvRrs
parameter.description: This parameter controls the use of additional Resource Record (RR) sections of the Service Locator (SRV) lookup response. When the value is set to "true", it indicates that an A lookup resulting from SRV lookups uses the pre-resolved A resource records from the additional RR section of the SRV lookup response. Local caching must be enabled for this setting to have an effect.

parameter.name: denyTimeBoundedDuplicateLookups
parameter.description: This parameter controls the use of duplicate lookups with the same name and type from two time-bounded threads.

parameter.name: timeBoundedPoolSize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of threads assigned to time-bounded Name Service queries.

context.name: SubscriberAgent
context.description: This level is used to configure the subscriber agent.

context.name: Bcct
context.description: This level is used to view and modify BroadWorks Common Communication Transport ports in the system.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the BCCT-related attributes for the Subscriber Agent.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the BCCT-related attributes for the Subscriber Agent.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Identifies an attribute to be modified.

parameter.name: unsecured
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the unsecured port.

parameter.name: secured
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Transport Layer Security (TLS) secured port.

context.name: Cache
context.description: This level is used to configure the Cache

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Cache-related attributes for the Subscriber Agent.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Cache-related attributes for the Subscriber Agent.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Identifies an attribute to be modified.

parameter.name: inMemoryCapacity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of user profiles that are held in the in-memory cache.

parameter.name: diskCapacity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the disk cache capacity. This is an advisory limit only. An alarm is generated when the cache size exceeds this limit. To turn off the alarm, set the value to "nil".

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear the Cache-related attributes for the Subscriber Agent.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: GeneralSettings
context.description: This level is used to configure the general settings of the Subscriber Agent.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Subscriber Agent General Settings.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Subscriber Agent General Settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Identifies an attribute to be modified.

parameter.name: processingThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of threads dedicated to profile modifications.

parameter.name: queueCapacity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the capacity of the profile update request queue. Requests are queued while waiting for available profile update threads.

parameter.name: schemaValidation
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether Home Subscriber Server (HSS) data are validated using schemas.

parameter.name: externallyConfiguredMmtel
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether the MMTel-Services document is written to the Home Subscriber Server (HSS). When the value is set to "true" and the userProfileStorageMode is "hss" or "hssdbs", the MMTel-Services document is not written to the HSS during provisioning. However, BroadWorks uses the content from the document (OIP, OIR, TIP, TIR, CW, CCBS, CDIV) to configure the corresponding BroadWorks services for call processing.

context.name: Hss
context.description: This level is used to configure the HSS configuration for the Subscriber Agent.

context.name: Diameter
context.description: This level is used to configure the diameter configuration for the Subscriber Agent.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view diameter parameters.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify diameter parameters.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Identifies an attribute to be modified.

parameter.name: diameterIdentity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Diameter identity associated with the node (included in origin host Attribute Value Pair [AVP] of outgoing Diameter messages). '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period (.).

parameter.name: realm
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Diameter realm associated with the node (the value of the origin realm Attribute Value Pair (AVP) in outgoing Diameter messages). '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period (.).

parameter.name: listeningAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the address on which the Diameter stack binds a server socket for incoming connections.

parameter.name: listeningPort
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) port on which the Diameter stack binds a server socket for incoming connections.

parameter.name: tcTimerSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Total Calls (TC) timer that controls the delay after which the Diameter stack attempts to reconnect with a peer after detecting a connection failure.

parameter.name: twTimerSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Total Wait (TW) timer that controls the frequency of device watchdog messages (when no other messages are exchanged on the peer connection) and is used in the connection failure detection algorithm.

parameter.name: requestTimerSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the default request timer (in seconds). Once this threshold is reached, the Diameter stack reports a time-out to applications and removes the request from its request queue.

parameter.name: busyPeerDetectionOutstandingTxnCount
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of concurrent outstanding transactions allowed on a single peer connection. Once this threshold is reached, the Diameter stack reports a busy peer to applications. The Diameter stack no longer sends requests to the peer until the number of concurrent outstanding transactions has been lowered below the set value.

parameter.name: busyPeerRestoreOutstandingTxnCount
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of concurrent outstanding transactions. Once the threshold is reached, the Diameter stack starts sending requests again after having detected a busy peer condition.

parameter.name: dynamicEntryInactivityTimerInHours
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the idle time allowed for a dynamic entry (either the Realm Routing table entry or Peer table entry) before it is removed from the table. Dynamic Peer table entries are not removed if they are referenced by at least one Realm Routing table entry.

parameter.name: redirectMaxDepth
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of times a Sh request can be redirected (both explicit and cached redirections combined).

parameter.name: redirectUserMaxCacheSize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of redirect cache entries associated with users. Redirect cache entries are associated with users upon reception of a Diameter redirection answer with redirect host usage Attribute Value Pair (AVP) set to "ALL_USER (6)".

parameter.name: workerThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of Diameter worker threads.

parameter.name: customDiameterVendorId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a vendor ID that identifies a vendor that BroadSoft has created custom development for. When a supported vendor ID is specified, the custom development is triggered.

parameter.name: firmwareRevision
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the content of the Firmware-Revision Attribute Value Pair (AVP) exchanged in Capabilities-Exchange-Request (CER) and Capabilities-Exchange-Answer (CEA) messages. When not set, the Attribute Value Pair (AVP) is not populated.

parameter.name: productName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the product-name value to set (AVP 2619) for a diameter peer connection. The default value is "BroadWorks".

command.name: clear
command.description: ERROR *** UNKNOWN COMMAND ***

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: ERROR *** UNKNOWN PARAMETER ***

context.name: Peers
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the peer table's static entries.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the peer table's static entries.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add new peer static entries.

parameter.name: identity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Diameter identity of the peer. '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period (.).

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) port on which the peer is listening for Diameter connections.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns connections to the peer on and off. If this value is set to "false", the Diameter stack does not attempt to connect to the peer and rejects incoming connection attempts from the peer.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the peer. This parameter is optional. If it is not specified, the actual Internet Protocol (IP) address is resolved on the Domain Name System (DNS).

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify attributes of existing peer static entries.

parameter.name: identity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Diameter identity of the peer. '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period (.).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the peer. This parameter is optional. If it is not specified, the actual Internet Protocol (IP) address is resolved on the Domain Name System (DNS).

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) port on which the peer is listening for Diameter connections.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns connections to the peer on and off. If this value is set to "false", the Diameter stack does not attempt to connect to the peer and rejects incoming connection attempts from the peer.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete existing peer static entries.

parameter.name: identity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Diameter identity of the peer. '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period (.).

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) attributes of existing peer static entries.

parameter.name: identity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Diameter identity of the peer. '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period (.).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: Realms
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the realm routing table's static entries.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the realm routing table's static entries.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add new realm routing static entries.

parameter.name: realm
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the realm name. '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period.

parameter.name: applicationId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ID of the application associated with the Realm Routing table entry. The value "All" is a wildcard character indicating that the entry applies to all supported Diameter applications.

parameter.name: default
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the entry to be used as a default Realm Routing table entry for the specified application ID. There is, at most, one default entry per application ID. Only one entry per application ID can be set to "true" in the whole Realm Routing table.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify attributes of existing realm routing static entries.

parameter.name: realm
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the realm name. '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period.

parameter.name: applicationId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ID of the application associated with the Realm Routing table entry. The value "All" is a wildcard character indicating that the entry applies to all supported Diameter applications.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: default
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the entry to be used as a default Realm Routing table entry for the specified application ID. There is, at most, one default entry per application ID. Only one entry per application ID can be set to "true" in the whole Realm Routing table.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete existing realm routing static entries.

parameter.name: realm
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the realm name. '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period.

parameter.name: applicationId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ID of the application associated with the Realm Routing table entry. The value "All" is a wildcard character indicating that the entry applies to all supported Diameter applications.

context.name: RoutingPeers
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the routing diameter peers associated to the realm.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the routing diameter peers associated to the realm.

parameter.name: realm
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the realm name. '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period.

parameter.name: applicationId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ID of the application associated with the Realm Routing table entry. The value "All" is a wildcard character indicating that the entry applies to all supported Diameter applications.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a new routing diameter peer associated to the realm.

parameter.name: realm
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the realm name. '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period.

parameter.name: applicationId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ID of the application associated with the Realm Routing table entry. The value "All" is a wildcard character indicating that the entry applies to all supported Diameter applications.

parameter.name: identity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Peer identity and must match an entry in the Peer table. A routing peer appears only once for a given Realm Routing table entry.

parameter.name: priority
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the priority of this peer against other routing peers associated with the same Realm Routing table entry.

parameter.name: weight
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the weight used for ordering peers with the same priority.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify attributes of an existing routing diameter peer.

parameter.name: realm
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the realm name. '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period.

parameter.name: applicationId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ID of the application associated with the Realm Routing table entry. The value "All" is a wildcard character indicating that the entry applies to all supported Diameter applications.

parameter.name: identity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Peer identity and must match an entry in the Peer table. A routing peer appears only once for a given Realm Routing table entry.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: priority
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the priority of this peer against other routing peers associated with the same Realm Routing table entry.

parameter.name: weight
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the weight used for ordering peers with the same priority.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing routing diameter peer.

parameter.name: realm
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the realm name. '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period.

parameter.name: applicationId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ID of the application associated with the Realm Routing table entry. The value "All" is a wildcard character indicating that the entry applies to all supported Diameter applications.

parameter.name: identity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Peer identity and must match an entry in the Peer table. A routing peer appears only once for a given Realm Routing table entry.

context.name: GeneralSettings
context.description: This level is used to configure the general settings for the Home Subscriber Server (HSS).

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view HSS General Settings.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify HSS General Settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Identifies an attribute to be modified.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter enables Home Subscriber Server (HSS) support.

parameter.name: useDiameterRelay
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether the relay of Sh traffic through the local Diameter server is used instead of using a direct link.

context.name: Sh
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the SH parameters.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view SH parameters.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify SH parameters.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Identifies an attribute to be modified.

parameter.name: dynamicNotifEffSupportDiscovery
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether BroadWorks tries to dynamically discover Notif-Eff support by the Home Subscriber Server(s) (HSS).

parameter.name: supportsSendDataIndication
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether BroadWorks includes the send data indication Attribute Value Pair (AVP) in Subscribe-Notifications-Requests (SNRs). BroadWorks handles scenarios where the send data indication AVP is inserted in Subscribe-Notifications-Requests (SNRs) but ignored by the Home Subscriber Server (HSS).

parameter.name: supportsExpiryTime
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether BroadWorks includes the expiry time Attribute Value Pair (AVP) in Subscribe-Notifications-Requests (SNRs). BroadWorks handles scenarios where the expiry time AVP is inserted in SNRs but ignored by the Home Subscriber Server (HSS).

parameter.name: expiryTimeDelay
parameter.description: This parameter is used to compute expiry time Attribute Value Pair (AVP) in Subscribe-Notifications-Requests (SNRs). This parameter also acts as upper-bound for received expiry time AVP and to compute internal expiration when supportsExpiryTime is set to "false".

parameter.name: supportsChargingInformationSubscriptions
parameter.description: This parameter controls whether BroadWorks attempts to subscribe for chargingInformation change notifications. When Subscribe-Notifications-Requests (SNRs) are generated with the Notif-Eff feature, it is assumed that chargingInformation subscription is allowed.

parameter.name: realm
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the destination Home Subscriber Server (HSS) realm.

parameter.name: reloadOnExpiration
parameter.description: This parameter controls automatic reloading of user data when the subscriptions expire. Automatic reloading allows the system to recover from cases where change notifications were not received.

context.name: Monitoring
context.description: This level is used to view and modify monitoring entries to check the status of the system, troubleshoot issues using logs and audit trails, and review performance and reports.

context.name: Alarm
context.description: This level is used to view and modify alarms. BroadWorks servers trigger alarms and include the ability to obtain and view these alarms. A BroadWorks server alarm can be informational, low severity, medium severity, high severity, or critical severity. Please refer to the application specific fault and alarms Management Information Base (MIB) for a detailed list of alarms.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to get and search for system alarms. These are alarms are located in the local CLI buffer.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: A type of alarm sub-component to filter on.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter as a trap type.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: TrapType
parameter.description: This nester parameter determines the trap type. *Use ''notification'' to display the traps at informational purposes. *Use ''alarm'' to display the reporting alarms. *Use ''software error'' to display the software errors.

parameter.name: trapName
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter as a trap name.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the trap name.

parameter.name: problem
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter as problem text.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: ProblemText
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies a text element that may represent an actual trap text (partially or entirely).

parameter.name: subcomp
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter as a BroadWorks software component or area.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: Subcomponent
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the software component within the BroadWorks entity that is reporting the alarm: "SIP", "database", and so on. Refer to the BroadWorks fault MIBs for a list valid sub-components.

parameter.name: recommendation
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter as recommendation text.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: RecommendationText
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies a text element that may represent an actual trap recommended action text (partially or entirely).

parameter.name: state
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter is based on the state of an alarm.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: AlarmState
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the state of an alarm.

parameter.name: time
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter based on the trap generation time. The acceptable time formats are as follow: * MM/DD/YY hh:mm AM|PM * MM/DD/YY

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: TimeStamp
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the date and time the alarm was generated.

parameter.name: comp
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter as an entity reporting the alarm.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: Component
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the BroadWorks entity reporting the alarm. Refer to the BroadWorks fault MIBs for a list valid entities.

parameter.name: sysname
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter as the system name.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: SystemName
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the host name of the system running the BroadWorks software.

parameter.name: trapSeverity
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter based on alarm severity.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: Severity
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the severity. *"Informational Warning": no immediate problems. *"Low": minor problem with a possible service impact. *"Medium": minor problem with a minor service impact. *"High": major problem with a major service impact. *"Critical": emergency system outage.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter based on alarm ID.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: Identifier
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies a sequentially generated number that is used to uniquely identify the alarm.

parameter.name: back
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a report based on the last N alarms.

parameter.name: numAlarms
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of alarms to move back.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to view and modify the size of the CLI buffer for alarms. The recommended buffer size is "1,000" alarms.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: localsize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the local alarms backlog size (in number of alarms). Note that , alarms are searched and displayed by accessing the local backlog and not the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) agent's backlog. This parameter returns to its default value ("1000") for each new CLI session.

parameter.name: size
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the SNMP agent alarms backlog size (in number of alarms). The SNMP agent backlog size determines how many alarms are stored in memory and (optionally) on disk and represents the maximum number of alarms that can be retrieved by CLI clients. When the actual number of historical alarms overflows the ''size''parameter, the oldest alarms are deleted. The''localsize''is limited by the ''size''.

parameter.name: logging
parameter.description: This parameter turns logging on and off. When the values is "false", logging to disk is turned off. Logging to disk allows alarms to be persisted across SNMP agent restarts. When the value is "true", logging to disk is turned on. Logging to disk allows alarms to be persisted across SNMP agent restarts.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to delete alarms from the local CLI backlog buffer, from the SNMP agent backlog buffer, and from disk.

command.name: ShowConfig
command.description: This command is used to display the alarm-related configuration.

command.name: close
command.description: This command is used to close the connection with the SNMP agent, which is used to obtain system alarms and event logs generated by the BroadWorks Server.

command.name: open
command.description: This command is used to open a connection with the SNMP agent to obtain system alarms and event logs generated by the BroadWorks Server. When opening system alarms, the port to be used is specified. If a port is not specified the agent default is used.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port used to communicate with the SNMP agent. When not specified the agent default is used.

command.name: show
command.description: This command is used to enable or disable real-time alarm echoing. When real-time alarm echoing is enabled, alarms display at the CLI as they occur. When alarms occur, they appear in the window from which this command was invoked. To avoid interrupting other BroadWorks Server CLI commands, open a separate window.

parameter.name: onoff
parameter.description: This parameter enables the alarm show funtion. The ''on'' option enables the alarm show function. The ''off'' option disables the alarm show function.

context.name: AlarmsTable
context.description: This level is used to clear a specific active alarm, clear all active alarms, list currently active alarms, resend an active alarm, and resend all active alarms. When an alarm is raised, its state is set to "On". When an alarm is resolved and cleared by the server, its state is set to "Off". When an alarm is manually cleared, its state is set to "Cleared". "Off" and "Cleared" alarms are equivalent; however, a "Cleared" alarm indicates that the alarm was cleared manually.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear an alarm.

parameter.name: identifier
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the identifier of the alarm to resend.

command.name: clearAll
command.description: This command is used to clear all active alarms.

command.name: list
command.description: This command is used to display the list of currently active alarms.

command.name: resend
command.description: This command is used to resend a currently active alarm to a remote host.

parameter.name: identifier
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the identifier of the alarm to be resent.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the remote host that the alarm is sent to.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number of the remote host.

command.name: resendAll
command.description: This command is used to resend all currently active alarms to a remote host.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the remote host that the alarm is sent to.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number of the remote host.

context.name: Threshold
context.description: This level is used to define thresholds against alarms defined for the BroadWorks Server.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view a list of the alarm thresholds defined on the BroadWorks server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: alarmName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the alarm name.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a new threshold against an alarm defined in the BroadWorks server.

parameter.name: alarmName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the alarm name.

parameter.name: maxNumTrapsPerTimePeriod
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of traps for the time period.

parameter.name: timePeriodInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time period (in seconds).

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the alarm is active or inactive.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify. Note that problem text variables can be defined.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable1
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable2
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable3
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable4
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable5
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify a threshold against an alarm defined in the BroadWorks server.

parameter.name: alarmName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the alarm name.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the index number.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify. Note that problem text variables can be defined.

parameter.name: maxNumTrapsPerTimePeriod
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of traps for the time period.

parameter.name: timePeriodInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time period (in seconds).

parameter.name: problemTextVariable1
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable2
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable3
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable4
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable5
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the alarm is active or inactive.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing alarm threshold.

parameter.name: alarmName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the alarm name.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the index number.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear all alarm threshold attributes.

parameter.name: alarmName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the alarm name.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the index number.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify. Note that problem text variables can be defined.

context.name: Default
context.description: This level is used to set the system default alarm threshold attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the system default alarm threshold attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the system default alarm threshold attributes defined on the BroadWorks server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: maxNumTrapsPerTimePeriod
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of traps for the time period.

parameter.name: timePeriodInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time period (in seconds).

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the attribute is active or inactive.

parameter.name: minSeverity
parameter.description: This parameter determines the severity level. Valid values include: "informational", "low", "medium", "high", and "critical".

context.name: PM
context.description: This level is used to navigate and view the values of the Management Information Base (MIB) nodes. Performance Measurements (PMs) are used to monitor the BroadWorks server performance, as well as, the operating system and hardware performance. To simplify navigation, PMs are organized in a tree structure.

context.name: ConfigurationManagement
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Performance Measurements (PMs) of the ConfigurationManagement

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Management Information Base (MIB) node values. MIB node values can be viewed in the following ways: All performance measurements throughout the MIB nodes tree structure. Performance measurements related to the current node. Performance measurements of a specified path.

parameter.name: option
parameter.description: This parameter displays Performance Measurements (PMs). Use the "-r" option to display all PMs for the current tree structure of the Management Information Base (MIB) nodes. Use the "-f" option to display a full description of PMs.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the path of the node of the Performance Measurements (PMs) to view.

parameter.name: tableKey
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the value of a row key for a node (to display as a table).

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify a Management Information Base (MIB) node values.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify. Use the ''counter'' option to set a scalar entry in a MIB (outside of a table). Use the ''table'' option to set a value in a table.

parameter.name: counter
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the value of an individual counter.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of a node in the Management Information Base (MIB).

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the value of a counter.

parameter.name: table
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the value of the table, column, row, or table entry.

parameter.name: tableName
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of a table in the Management Information Base (MIB).

parameter.name: option
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the options. Use the "all" option to set all writable values in a table at once. Use the "column" option to set all the writable values of a specific column in a table. Use the "row" option to set all the writable values of a specific row in a table. Use the "entry" option to set a specific entry in a table; specifying the row and column.

parameter.name: all
parameter.description: This parameter specifies all of the values in a table.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the value of a counter.

parameter.name: column
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the values of a specific column in a table.

parameter.name: columnName
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of a column.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the value of a counter.

parameter.name: row

command.description: This command is used to navigate through the BroadWorks server Management Information Base (MIB) nodes in a manner similar to the standard''cd''(change directory) command. Use the ''/''parameter to navigate back to the root. Use the ''..''parameter to go back one level.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: A CLI context path.

command.name: ls
command.description: This command is used to view the next BroadWorks server Management Information Base (MIB) nodes in a manner similar to the standard''ls''(list) command.

parameter.name: option
parameter.description: This parameter determines the options. Use the "-r" option to show the tree structure of the Management Information Base (MIB) nodes. Use the "-n" option to show the name of the nodes containing values.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the path to the node.

command.name: pwd
command.description: This command is used to view the current position in the BroadWorks server Management Information Base (MIB) in a manner similar to the standard''pwd''(present working directory) command.

context.name: Report
context.description: This level is used to generate reports from the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Management Information Base (MIB). The BroadWorks server has a performance reporting tool used to view a node's historical data, as well as the current load, and system health.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to display report-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify report-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: pollingIntervalInMin
parameter.description: The number of minutes between reporting checks of the system.

parameter.name: numberOfReportingDays
parameter.description: The number of days to report when polling.

command.name: current
command.description: This command is used to display current (real-time) server statistics such as the number of active OSS and sync sessions.

command.name: historyStats
command.description: This command is used to display server history statistics stored in the recent statistics file, which can be displayed for the last month or a specific day in the last month.

parameter.name: day
parameter.description: Date of reporting information to view.

command.name: recent
command.description: This command is used to display recent server statistics. The Recent Statistics Report displays data for the last 24 hours and includes totals.

context.name: Threshold
context.description: The level is used to define thresholds against counters and gauges as defined in the BroadWorks server Management Information Base (MIB).

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to list thresholds defined on the BroadWorks server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Type of Management Information Base (MIB) node to monitor, can either be a "counter" or a "gauge". Refer to the application specific performance MIB for a list or counters and gauges.

parameter.name: option
parameter.description: Option to filter on for the get operation.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The gauge of a counter in the Management Information Base (MIB).If used, the Get command applies a case-sensitive prefix match on all counter names.

parameter.name: severity
parameter.description: "inactive": The threshold is inactive."active": The threshold is active.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: An operator-defined description of this threshold.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a new threshold against a counter or gauge defined in the BroadWorks server Management Information Base (MIB).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Type of Management Information Base (MIB) node to monitor, can either be a "counter" or a "gauge". Refer to the application specific performance MIB for a list or counters and gauges.

parameter.name: counter
parameter.description: Counter based threshold.

parameter.name: counterDescription
parameter.description: An operator-defined description of this threshold.

parameter.name: counterName
parameter.description: The name of a counter in the Management Information Base (MIB).

parameter.name: initialValue
parameter.description: When the counter is reset to 0, the current comparison level is set to this value.

parameter.name: offsetValue
parameter.description: The increment added to the current comparison value whenever the counter crosses the current comparison value; may be set to 0.

parameter.name: severity
parameter.description: "inactive": The threshold is inactive."active": The threshold is active.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: Inactive: The threshold is inactive.

parameter.name: gauge
parameter.description: Gauge based threshold.

parameter.name: gaugeDescription
parameter.description: An operator defined description of this threshold.

parameter.name: gaugeName
parameter.description: The name of a gauge in the MIB.

parameter.name: notifyLow
parameter.description: The gauge value at which an alarm is generated when the gauge value reaches or crosses the NotifyLow level in a falling direction. Subsequent similar crossings of the NotifyLow level do not generate an alarm until the gauge has reached or crossed the corresponding NotifyHigh level.

parameter.name: notifyHigh
parameter.description: The gauge value at which an alarm is generated when the gauge value reaches or crosses the NotifyHigh level in a rising direction. Subsequent similar crossings of the NotifyHigh level do not generate an alarm until the gauge has reached or crossed the corresponding NotifyLow level.

parameter.name: severity
parameter.description: "inactive": The threshold is inactive."active": The threshold is active.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: Inactive: The threshold is inactive.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify threshold attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Type of MIB node to monitor, can either be a "counter" or a "gauge". Refer to the application specific performance MIB for a list or counters and gauges.

parameter.name: counter
parameter.description: Counter based threshold.

parameter.name: counterName
parameter.description: The name of a counter in the MIB.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Type of MIB node to monitor, can either be a "counter" or a "gauge". Refer to the application specific performance MIB for a list or counters and gauges.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: An operator-defined description of this threshold.

parameter.name: initialValue
parameter.description: When the counter is reset to 0, the current comparison level is set to this value.

parameter.name: offsetValue
parameter.description: The increment added to the current comparison value whenever the counter crosses the current comparison value; may be set to 0.

parameter.name: severity
parameter.description: "inactive": The threshold is inactive."active": The threshold is active.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: Inactive: The threshold is inactive.

parameter.name: rowIndex
parameter.description: Optional parameter used to reference a specific threshold when two thresholds for the same counter name are defined.

parameter.name: gauge
parameter.description: Gauge based threshold.

parameter.name: gaugeName
parameter.description: The name of a gauge in the Management Information Base (MIB).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Type of MIB node to monitor, can either be a "counter" or a "gauge". Refer to the application specific performance MIB for a list or counters and gauges.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: An operator-defined description of this threshold.

parameter.name: notifyLow
parameter.description: The gauge value at which an alarm is generated when the gauge value reaches or crosses the NotifyLow level in a falling direction. Subsequent similar crossings of the NotifyLow level do not generate an alarm until the gauge has reached or crossed the corresponding NotifyHigh level.

parameter.name: notifyHigh
parameter.description: The gauge value at which an alarm is generated when the gauge value reaches or crosses the NotifyHigh level in a rising direction. Subsequent similar crossings of the NotifyHigh level do not generate an alarm until the gauge has reached or crossed the corresponding NotifyLow level.

parameter.name: severity
parameter.description: "inactive": The threshold is inactive."active": The threshold is active.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: Inactive: The threshold is inactive.

parameter.name: rowIndex
parameter.description: Optional parameter used to reference a specific threshold when two thresholds for the same counter name are defined.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete defined thresholds.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Type of Management Information Base (MIB) node to monitor, can either be a "counter" or a "gauge". Refer to the application specific performance MIB for a list or counters and gauges.

parameter.name: counter
parameter.description: Counter based threshold.

parameter.name: counterName
parameter.description: The name of a counter in the Management Information Base (MIB).

parameter.name: rowIndex
parameter.description: Optional parameter used to reference a specific threshold when two thresholds for the same counter name are defined.

parameter.name: gauge
parameter.description: Gauge based threshold.

parameter.name: gaugeName
parameter.description: The name of a gauge in the Management Information Base (MIB).

parameter.name: rowIndex
parameter.description: Optional parameter used to reference a specific threshold when two thresholds for the same counter name are defined.

context.name: Maintenance
context.description: This level is used to view and modify maintenance entries to check the general status of the system and the software that is currently running.

context.name: ContainerOptions
context.description: This level is used to view and modify special configuration options for Java containers. These options are typically used to control specific behaviors introduced by patches.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the list of container options and their values.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a new container option.

parameter.name: container
parameter.description: This parameter determines the type of container.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the option name.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the option value.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify an existing container option.

parameter.name: container
parameter.description: This parameter determines the type of container.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the option name.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the option value.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a container option.

parameter.name: container
parameter.description: This parameter determines the type of container.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the option name.

command.name: removeObsolete
command.description: This command is used to remove the container options that are documented as obsolete.

command.name: showOption
command.description: This command is used to view information about a specific container option.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of a container option. The container option specified will be searched across all available containers.

command.name: showOptions
command.description: This command is used to view a list of container options or display information about a specific container.

parameter.name: criteria
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the criteria of the container options and the name of the container to search.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.description: This parameter filters the output of the container option definitions to contain the definitions currently available or the obsolete definitions. When omitted, it displays all container options.

parameter.name: content
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the filter should match available or obsolete container options.

parameter.name: container
parameter.description: This parameter is used to view the container options that apply to the specified container. If omitted, all the container options currently available for this server are listed.

parameter.name: containerName
parameter.description: Specifies the name of a specific container.

context.name: ManagedObjects
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Managed Objects (MOs).

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Managed Object (MO)-related information.

parameter.name: option
parameter.description: This parameter determines the option. *Use the "broadworks" option to view information about the BroadWorks component installed on the current host. *Use the "devices" option to view information about the devices configured for use with the current host. *Use the "versions" option to view information about the version of the BroadWorks component installed on the current host.

parameter.name: broadworks
parameter.description: This parameter displays information on the active BroadWorks server: identity, version, applications, web container, and third-party software.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute. Use the ''full'' option to get an extended view of the status of the BroadWorks server.

parameter.name: devices
parameter.description: This parameter displays device information.

parameter.name: filters
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the filter to use to narrow the result of the get command.

parameter.name: deviceName
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of a device. When it is used, the GET command applies a case-sensitive prefix match on all device names.

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the protocol supported by the device.

parameter.name: deviceType
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the type of the device to display.

parameter.name: adminState
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the administrative state of the device.

parameter.name: opState
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the operating state of the device.

parameter.name: versions
parameter.description: This parameter displays information on the installed software on this server.

command.name: detail
command.description: This command is used to display detailed information about an application. Data presented in the output includes the application name, version, install date, upgrade mode, status, and description.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the type of element.

parameter.name: application
parameter.description: This parameter displays information of a BroadWorks application.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of the application.

parameter.name: version
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the version of the application.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Managed Object (MO)-related attributes.

parameter.name: forceOption
parameter.description: This parameter determines the force option. Use the "force" option to apply the change immediately. Otherwise, a restart of the application is required for the changes to apply.

parameter.name: option
parameter.description: This parameter determines the options.

parameter.name: activeSoftwareVersion
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the active software version.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the version of the server. Use this option when a different version of the server needs to be activated. The software automatically determines if it needs to upgrade or rollback.

parameter.name: server
parameter.description: This parameter specifies server-related information.

parameter.name: identity
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of the server identity to set to "active". It is usually the short name of a BroadWorks server (for example, Profile Server, Network Server, and so on).

parameter.name: version
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the version of the software to activate.

parameter.name: revert
parameter.description: This parameter provides the ability to revert to a previous release. Use the "revert" option to perform a revert to the specified previous release. Otherwise, a rollback to the specified previous release is performed.

parameter.name: revert
parameter.description: This parameter provides the ability to revert to a previous release. Use the "revert" option to perform a revert to the specified previous release. Otherwise, a rollback to the specified previous release is performed.

parameter.name: backupLocation
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the full path of the database backup file to use when performing a revert.

command.name: activate
command.description: This command is used to activate an application. Active applications can be configured, deployed, and started.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter determines the type. Use the "application" option to activate a BroadWorks application.

parameter.name: application
parameter.description: This parameter determines the "application" option to activate a BroadWorks application.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of the application.

parameter.name: version
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the application version.

parameter.name: contextPath
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the context path.

command.name: deactivate
command.description: This command is used to deactivate an application.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter determines which software is deactivated.

parameter.name: application
parameter.description: This parameter determines the "application" option to deactivate a BroadWorks application.

parameter.name: nameOrContextPath
parameter.description: The name or context path of the application.

command.name: deploy
command.description: This command is used to deploy an application.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter determines which software type is deployed.

parameter.name: application
parameter.description: This parameter determines the "application" option to deploy a BroadWorks application.

parameter.name: nameOrContextPath
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name or context path of the application.

command.name: lock
command.description: This command is used to lock the server. Upon normal completion, the server goes into the ''Lock'' state. During the stop process, the server temporarily goes into the ''Locking'' state. This command can be run when the server is in the ''Unlock'' state. Refer to the BroadWorks Software Management Guide for further details on server state management.

parameter.name: option
parameter.description: This parameter determines the option. Use the "force" option if the lock must be enforced even if the lock target is not ready to go into the ''Lock'' state.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the type.

parameter.name: application
