parameter.description: This parameter determines the "application" option to lock a BroadWorks application. If a specific application must be locked individually, this parameter must be set. This is an optional parameter and, if not set, the lock applies to the whole server.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of an application.

command.name: start
command.description: This command is used to start the server. Upon normal completion, the server goes into an ''Unlock'' state. Note that this command can only be run when the server is in a ''Shutdown'' state.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the type. If a specific application or the web container must be started individually, this parameter must be set. This is an optional parameter and, if not set, the start applies to the whole server.

parameter.name: application
parameter.description: This parameter determines the "application" option to start a BroadWorks application. If a specific application must be started individually, this parameter must be set. This is an optional parameter and, if not set, the start applies to the whole server.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of an application.

command.name: stop
command.description: This command is used to stop the server. Upon normal completion, the server goes into a ''Shutdown'' state. During the stop process, the server temporarily goes into the ''Shuttingdown '' state. This command can be run from any state.

parameter.name: option
parameter.description: This parameter determines the option. Use the "force" option if the stop must be enforced even if the target is not ready to go into the ''Stopped'' state.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the type. If a specific application or the web container must be started individually, this parameter must be set. This is an optional parameter and, if not set, the start applies to the whole server.

parameter.name: application
parameter.description: This parameter determines the "application" option to stop a BroadWorks application. If a specific application must be started individually, this parameter must be set. This is an optional parameter and, if not set, the start applies to the whole server.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of an application.

command.name: undeploy
command.description: This command is used to undeploy an application.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the type. If a specific application or the web container must be started individually, this parameter must be set. This is an optional parameter and, if not set, the start applies to the whole server.

parameter.name: application
parameter.description: This parameter determines the "application" option to undeploy a BroadWorks application. Use the "application" option to undeploy a BroadWorks application.

parameter.name: nameOrContextPath
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name or context path of the application.

command.name: unlock
command.description: This command is used to unlock the BroadWorks server. Once the command is executed, the server goes into the Unlock state. This command is executed when the server is in the Lock state.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the type. If a specific application or the web container must be started individually, this parameter must be set. This is an optional parameter and, if not set, the start applies to the whole server.

parameter.name: application
parameter.description: This parameter determines the "application" option to unlock a BroadWorks application.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of an application.

context.name: Patching
context.description: This level is used to display detailed information about patches or patch bundles. It is also used to apply patches, check peers, execute operations, modify files, list patches or patch bundles, display the history of a patch, refresh the patch database or remove a patch. This level provides additional services for patches such as showing more details and performing batch operations based on a given filter (for example, apply or remove installed patches and delete inactive patches).

command.name: detail
command.description: This command is used to display detailed information for the requested patch or patch bundle. Data presented in the output for a patch includes the patch name, the current state of the patch, and the date since it reached this current state. It also shows the first level of patches on which it depends (dependencies), the patches directly depending on it (dependents) and the name of the patch bundle(s) in which it is found. Data presented in the output for a patch bundle displays a list of the bundled patches and their states.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the patch or patch bundle.

command.name: apply
command.description: This command is used to change the state of installed patches to "active". When an error occurs, all patches are brought back to their initial state.

parameter.name: names
parameter.description: This parameter specifies names of the patches or bundles to apply delimited by colons.

command.name: checkPeer
command.description: This command is used to verify (on a redundant system) that all servers have the same active patches. The command scans all peers and compiles a list of all active patches on all servers. It then compares the list of each individual server with the full list and displays any missing patches for a particular server. This command is exclusive meaning that requests for any other command, invoked by any client, are rejected while this command is executing.

command.name: execute
command.description:
This command is used to commit patch operations and make them effective.
This command commits all changes since the last time the "execute" was called, and makes them effective. Modifications to patches states are not active until this call is made. This command is exclusive meaning that requests for any other command, invoked by any client, are rejected while this command is executing.

parameter.name: force
parameter.description: This parameter commits the patch operations and makes them effective.

command.name: getModifiedFile
command.description: This command is used to list the patches that modified the file requested in the query.

parameter.name: fileNameContains
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a pattern that is contained in one or more file names.

command.name: listBundle
command.description: This command is used to display a list of patch bundles or one or more specific patch bundles.

parameter.name: criteria
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the criteria. Enter the name of the desired patch bundle or a given pattern that matches a pattern found in one or more patch bundle names.

parameter.name: bundleNameContains
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the filtering option. Use ''bundleNameContains'' to filter based on the bundle name.

parameter.name: bundleName
parameter.description: Specifies a pattern that is contained in a number of patch bundle names.

command.name: listPatch
command.description: This command is used to display a list of patches along with their states. All patches appear no matter if they were installed or applied individually or as part of a patch bundle. Data presented in the output of this command includes the patch name, the current state of the patch, and the date since the patch reached the indicated state. Search criteria can be used to narrow the output of results. The patchNameContains is used to list patches matching a given pattern in their name, whereas the currentState is used to list patches with a specified state.

parameter.name: criteria
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the criteria. Enter the name of the desired patch bundle or a given pattern that matches a pattern found in one or more patch bundle names.

parameter.name: patchNameContains
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a filter based on the content of the patch name.

parameter.name: patchName
parameter.description: Specifies a pattern that is contained in a number of patch names.

parameter.name: currentState
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a filter based on the current state of a patch.

parameter.name: state
parameter.description: The state of the patch.

command.name: listRelation
command.description: This command displays all dependencies or dependents of a given patch along with their states.

parameter.name: option
parameter.description: This parameter determines the type of relation to display. Values include "dependencies" and "dependencyOf". Use the "dependencies" option to view all patches which are required to be applied before the given patch. Use the "dependencyOf" option to view all patches which are required to be removed before the given patch.

parameter.name: patchName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the patch.

command.name: patchHistory
command.description: This command is used to display the history of one or more patches. Data presented in the output of this command includes the patch name, the date of an event for the patch, and the state of the patch at that time. Search criteria can be used to narrow the output of results. The "dateStartsAt" criterion is used to set a starting date so that the results do not include events prior to this date. It is also possible to retrieve the history of patches matching a given pattern in their name, or a combination of both criteria.

parameter.name: criteria
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the desired patch bundle or a given pattern that matches a pattern found in one or more patch bundle names.

parameter.name: patchNameContains
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a filter based on the content of the patch name.

parameter.name: patchName
parameter.description: Specifies a pattern that is contained in a number of patch names.

parameter.name: dateStartsAt
parameter.description: Filter based start at date.

parameter.name: month
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the the month of starting date so that the results do not include events prior to this date.

parameter.name: day
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the day of starting date so that the results do not include events prior to this date.

parameter.name: year
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the year of starting date so that the results do not include events prior to this date.

command.name: refresh
command.description: This command is used to refresh the patch database. This command is exclusive, which means that requests for any other command, invoked by any client, are rejected while the refresh command is executing. This command analyzes the patches installed on the system. From the gathered data, it updates the internal database and processes dependencies.

command.name: remove
command.description: This command is used to change the state of active patches to "installed." When an error occurs, all patches are brought back to their initial state.

parameter.name: names
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the names of the patches or bundles to remove delimited by colons.

context.name: Scheduler
context.description: This level is used to view and modify scheduler entries in the system.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the list of scheduled tasks.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a new scheduled task. You can configure a task to execute on a minute, day, or date basis. Any given task can have multiple-scheduled entries. Following are examples: * The command "taskx minute 2" means execute the task "x" every two minutes. * The command "taskx day monday 0 30" means execute task "x" every Monday at 0h30. * The command "taskx date 15 2 15" means execute task "x" on the 15th of each month at 2h15.'''NOTE''': To minimize the impact of running concurrent scheduled tasks, use minutes that are different between tasks and that do not match the hour (when applicable).

parameter.name: tasks
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the BroadWorks maintenance task type.

parameter.name: frequency
minute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minute.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the frequency in minutes. For example, "1" means every minute, "2" means every two minutes and so on.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the start of the hour offset value in minutes. It is important that not all tasks are executed at the same time. The different offset for each task manages the execution of tasks.

parameter.name: daily
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the daily option.

parameter.name: hour
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies a day in the week.

parameter.name: minute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minute.

parameter.name: day
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a specific day in the week.

parameter.name: day
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a specific day in the week.

parameter.name: hour
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies a day in the week.

parameter.name: minute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minute.

parameter.name: date
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a specific day in the month.

parameter.name: date
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a specific day in the month.

parameter.name: hour
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies a day in the week.

parameter.name: minute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minute.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove a scheduled task from the list. Scheduled tasks must be deleted using their corresponding ID number.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ID for the scheduled task.

context.name: FileCollector
context.description: This level is used to view and modify file collector task attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the file collector task attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the file collector task attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the URI to identify the remote log repository.

parameter.name: keepFileAfterTransfer
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the files are preserved after transfer.

parameter.name: user
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user to connect to the log repository web application.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear the user attribute of the file collector task.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to clear.

context.name: SrcDestPathsContext
context.description: This level is used to add and modify file collector task source and destination paths.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the file collector task source and destination paths.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add the source and destination paths to the file collector task.

parameter.name: sourcePath
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the source path of the logs on the local machine. This source path can contain wildcards.

parameter.name: destinationPath
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the destination path of the remote machine.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove the source and destination paths from the file collector task.

parameter.name: sourcePath
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the source path of the logs on the local machine. This source path can contain wildcards.

context.name: Ticket
context.description: This level is used to interact with ticket system (BroadSoft's problem reporting system). It is used to upload a file as an attachment to an existing ticket.

command.name: upload
command.description: This command is used to upload a document from the local server to an existing ticket.

parameter.name: UserId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ticket system user ID.

parameter.name: TicketId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ticket ID number. TicketId pattern is <String {1 to 10 characters}>-<Integer {1 to 9999999999}> or <Integer {10000 to 999999}>.

parameter.name: FileName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the file name of the file to be uploaded.

parameter.name: FileDescription
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the description of the file to be uploaded.

parameter.name: Password
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ticket system user password.

context.name: Tools
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the tools entries.

command.name: healthmon
command.description: This command is used to report the status.

command.name: tech-support
command.description: This command is used to capture the status of the system.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify. Tech-support includes some information extracted from log files on disk. Use the ''day'' option to get this information for a specific day in the month.

parameter.name: day
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the date of a day in the month.

command.name: upgradeCheck
command.description: This command is used to perform a software activation dry run during which a system validation is performed to determine if the upgrade will be successful.

parameter.name: version to switch to
parameter.description: Specifies the version to which the system is upgraded.

context.name: Interface
context.description: This level is used to configure and view the system-wide interfaces available from the Execution Server. Examples of interfaces include Accounting, Internet mail, Session Initiation Protocol, and Simple Network Management Protocol.

context.name: ASR
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Application Server Registration (ASR)-related parameters. The ASR works in conjunction with the redundancy functionality for primary and backup servers in a cluster to ensure on-going service during a primary Execution Server failure condition. Each subscriber's active Execution Server is known throughout the network so that in the event that a subscriber's primary Execution Server is unavailable, a backup Execution Server can take over the ownership of the subscribers' directory number. Once the primary Execution Server is available again, the subscriber's directory number ownership reverts to its primary Execution Server. The ASR protocol ensures that the Execution Server's active status is synchronized with the other Execution Servers and the Network Servers on the network.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Application Server Registration (ASR)-related attributes, such as the listening port, the maximum number of retries, and the retransmission timer.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Application Server Registration (ASR)-related attributes, such as the listening port, the maximum number of retries, and the retransmission timer.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: sourceNetAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the address of the Application Server Registration (ASR) protocol.

parameter.name: maxTransmissions
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of times the Execution Server sends an active indicator to the other servers (usually the primary Network Server) on the network.

parameter.name: retransmissionDelay
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time (in seconds) the Execution Server waits to resend an active indicator to the other servers (usually the primary Network Server) on the network when the sending Execution Server has not received a response.

parameter.name: listeningPort
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the listening port.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) Application Server Registration (ASR)-related attributes, such as the listening port, the maximum number of retries, and the retransmission timer.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: Accounting
context.description: This level is used to manage billing information that is delivered to the service provider's billing system by a third party. This billing information pertains to the use of all chargeable services that are configured for groups. Billing files are located in the''/var/broadworks/billing''directory.

context.name: BroadWorksCDRInterface
context.description: The BroadWorks call detail record (CDR) interface is a billing format implemented to meet the requirements of VoIP systems. The CDR format provides the same information that is currently provided in the PacketCable event messages in a single CDR.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Call Detail Record (CDR) configuration information.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Call Detail Record (CDR) configuration information.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: numThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of threads dedicated to accounting-related tasks.

parameter.name: useUUIDforLinuxSystemId
parameter.description: This parameter enables the Execution Server to use the Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) for the system ID in accounting for Linux installs. When the value is set to "false", BroadWorks uses the MAC address as system ID in accounting for Linux installs.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the accounting interface on and off.

parameter.name: enableCodecChanges
parameter.description: When set to false, Call Codec Changes are off. When set to true, Call Codec changes are on.

parameter.name: enableFailover
parameter.description: Controls if Failover call detail record generation is on or off.

parameter.name: enableInternalConference
parameter.description: Controls if CDR Internal Conference is on or off.

parameter.name: enableIntraGroup
parameter.description: Controls if Intra-group call detail records are on or off.

parameter.name: enableStartEnd
parameter.description: Controls if Call detail record start and end are on or off.

parameter.name: enableTerminating
parameter.description: Controls if Terminating call detail record is on or off.

parameter.name: enableLocationChanges
parameter.description: Controls if location changes records are on or off.

parameter.name: enableAccessNetworkChanges
parameter.description: The parameter controls whether an interim call detail record (CDR) for Access Network Information is updated.

parameter.name: enableCentrex
parameter.description: Controls if Centrex module is on or off.

parameter.name: enableIP
parameter.description: Controls if IP module is on or off.

parameter.name: enable3GPP
parameter.description: Controls if Module 3GPP is on or off.

parameter.name: longCallDurationRecordControl
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the status of the Long Call Duration Record Control feature.

parameter.name: longCallDurationTimerInMinutes
parameter.description: This parameter specifies (in minutes) how long a call is up before a long duration billing event is generated.

parameter.name: use3xxAsRouteConfirmation
parameter.description: This parameter enables the 3xx route confirmation. When it is set to "false", the system does not to use the 3xx as route confirmation for accounting. When it is set to "true", the system uses the 3xx as route confirmation for accounting.

parameter.name: customSchemaVersion
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the string that appears in the Call Detail Record (CDR) for a configurable accounting schema version.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) BroadWorks Call Detail Record (CDR) interface attributes. A Custom Schema Version change does not take effect until a restart is performed.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: Diameter
context.description: This level is used to manage Diameter attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Diameter-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Diameter-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: defaultDestinationRealm
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the default destination realm.

parameter.name: useRealmFromCapabilitiesExchange
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the use realm from capabilities exchange. When this parameter value is set to "true", all Accounting Requests (ACRs) sent by the Execution Server have the destination realm Attribute Value Pair (AVP) set to the value obtained from the peer on the latest Capabilities-Exchange when rfRoutingMode is "direct" or "dynamic" on the Rf interface. '''NOTE 1 ''': This comes from the "Origin-Realm" AVP in the Capabilities-Exchange-Request (CER) or Capabilities-Exchange-Answer (CEA) received by the Execution Server from the billing system. This does not apply when rfRoutingMode is set to "realm". Similarly, on the Ro interface when roRoutingMode is set to "direct" or "dynamic", all Credit Control Requests (CCRs) sent by the Execution Server have the destination realm AVP set to the one obtained from the peer on the latest Capabilities-Exchange. ''' NOTE 2 ''': This comes from the "Origin-Realm" AVP in the CER or CEA received by the Execution Server from the billing system. This does not apply when roRoutingMode is set to "realm". When the value is set to "false": the destination realm AVP is taken from the host part of the user name AVP and the user name itself is taken from the primaryDeviceLinePort CDR field.

parameter.name: callingPartyAddressStrictCompliance
parameter.description: When true: BroadWorks populates the Calling-Party-Address 3GPP vendor specific AVP (code 831, vendor-id 10415) in Diameter messages with the value from the BroadWorks CDR field callingPartyAddress of the 3GPP module. If the callingPartyAddress field contains multiple entries, each is encoded as a separate Calling-Party-Address AVP in the Diameter messages, as specified in the 3GPP specification TS 32.299. When false: BroadWorks populates the Calling-Party-Address 3GPP vendor specific AVP (code 831, vendor-id 10415) in Diameter messages with the value derived from the content of BroadWorks CDR fields callingNumber, callingNumberContext and callingPresentationIndicator.

parameter.name: includeRoutingNumberInCallingPartyAddress
parameter.description: This parameter has no effect on the Diameter message when callingPartyAddressStrictCompliance parameter is enabled. When callingPartyAddressStrictCompliance is disabled and When true: BroadWorks populates the Calling-Party-Address 3GPP vendor-specific AVP (code 831, vendor-id 10415) in Diameter messages with the value derived from the content of BroadWorks callingNumber, callingNumberContext, and callingPresentationIndicator and rounting number taken from callingPartyAddress (only if TEL URI) CDR fields. When false: BroadWorks populates the Calling-Party-Address 3GPP vendor-specific AVP (code 831, vendor-id 10415) in Diameter messages with the value derived from the content of BroadWorks callingNumber, callingNumberContext, and callingPresentationIndicator CDR fields.

parameter.name: userNameIdentity
parameter.description: This parameter controls the content of the User-Name Attribute Value Pair (AVP) for the Rf and Ro interfaces. When the value is set to "public", the user (and primary device) public user identity is used. When the value is set to "private", the device private identity is used to populate the User-Name AVP. This is the private identity of the specific device involved in the call. If the private identity is not known, the User-Name AVP is not sent.

parameter.name: userSessionIdSource
parameter.description: This parameter controls the content of the Session-Id Attribute Value Pair (AVP). When the value is set to "access", BroadWorks populates the User-Session-Id AVP with the access-side SIP call ID: from the incoming SIP INVITE for originating calls and from the outgoing INVITE for terminating calls. When the value is set to "incoming", the AVP is set to the call ID of the incoming SIP INVITE request.

parameter.name: defaultFixedDevicePrivateUserIdentity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the value used to populate the User-Name Attribute Value Pair (AVP) for Fixed devices when no other value is available.

parameter.name: defaultMobileDevicePrivateUserIdentity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the value used to populate the User-Name Attribute Value Pair (AVP) for Mobile devices when no other value is available.

parameter.name: subscriptionIdType
parameter.description: This parameter controls the content of the Subscription-ID group AVP (AVP code 443) for Ro and Rf interfaces. When the value is set to sipUri, the user's primary device Public User Identity (PUI) is used. When the value is set to e164, the user's primary DN in the E164 format is used. When the value is set to sipUriAndE164, multiple Subscription-ID Attribute-Value Pairs (AVP) are provided in the Credit Control Request (CCR). The first Subscription-ID group AVP is the user's primary DN and the second is the user's primary PUI.

parameter.name: supportNetworkProvidedPANI
parameter.description: This parameter controls whether the Execution Server stops to send an ANI AVP in a Credit Control Request (CCR)[update] when it receives a P-Access-Network-Info (PANI) header with the Network-Provided tag.

parameter.name: use3rdPartyRegistrationForLocation
parameter.description: This parameter controls whether the P-Access-Network-Info (PANI) SIP header from the third party registration is stored in the user profile. This value is used to populate the Access-Networks-Information AVP (AVP 1263) P-Access-Network-Info (PANI) header is not available in the initial INVITE.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) Diameter-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: ChargingFunctionElement
context.description: BroadWorks uses the system configured default charging servers when the charging server address is not received in time from the SIP signaling or when the system is not in IMS mode. This level is used to manage default charging servers information.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view charging servers-related attributes.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add new charging servers to the system.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the address of a default charging server.

parameter.name: extendedNetAddress
parameter.description: This parameter indicates whether the charging server address is a network address (that is, 192.1.1.1) or a free-form string that may contain ports, protocols, and transports (that is, aaa://192.1.1.4:6666).

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the type of the charging function. The Charging Collection Function ("CCF") signifies off-line charging, for example postpaid account [[charging.Event]] and the Charging Function ("ECF") signifies on-line charging, for example pre-paid account charging.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the description of the charging function element.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify online attributes.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the address of a default charging server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: extendedNetAddress
parameter.description: This parameter indicates whether the charging server address is a network address (that is, 192.1.1.1) or a free-form string that may contain ports, protocols, and transports (that is, aaa://192.1.1.4:6666).

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the type of the charging function. The Charging Collection Function ("CCF") signifies off-line charging, for example postpaid account [[charging.Event]] and the Charging Function ("ECF") signifies on-line charging, for example pre-paid account charging.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the description of the charging function element.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a charging server.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the address of a default charging server.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) charging server attributes.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the address of a default charging server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

command.name: reorder
command.description: This command is used to reorder the charging servers. The charging server entries are either ordered in ascending or descending order, or by their Internet Protocol (IP) address.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the address of a default charging server.

parameter.name: action
parameter.description: Specifies whether the charging server's entries should be ordered in ascending or descending order by their IP address.

context.name: InhibitedAVPCodeList
context.description: This level specifies the list of inhibited element(s). The list element includes an Attribute Value Pair (AVP) code and a vendor ID. The element(s) present in the list are absent from the billing data.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the list of disabled elements.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add an Attribute Value Pair (AVP) combination to disable. The AVP combination includes a diameter AVP and a vendor ID.

parameter.name: avpCode
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Attribute Value Pair (AVP) code.

parameter.name: vendorId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the vendor ID.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a Attribute Value Pair (AVP) combination to disable. The AVP combination includes a diameter AVP and a vendor ID.

parameter.name: avpCode
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Attribute Value Pair (AVP) code.

parameter.name: vendorId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the vendor ID.

context.name: Offline
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Diameter offline attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Offline-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Offline-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the sending offline charging information to the billing servers on and off.

parameter.name: sendBroadWorksInfo
parameter.description: Specifies whether BroadWorks information should be sent.

parameter.name: send3GPPInfo
parameter.description: Specifies whether 3GPP information should be sent.

parameter.name: enableFileQueuing
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether file queuing is enabled.

parameter.name: fileRetentionInHours
parameter.description: This parameter specifies how long the file is kept in the system.

parameter.name: routingMode
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the routing mode. When this parameter value is set to "Direct", the Execution Server has a direct connection to the Charging Data Functions (CDFs) specified in the ''P-CFA'' header. For a given Rf accounting session, the CDFs are tried in the order received in the ''P-CFA''; if no Diameter connection exists for a given CDF, the next CDF from the ''P-CFA'' is tried. When this parameter value is set to "Dynamic", the behavior is similar to the "Direct" value, except that if no direct connection exists to a given CDF, the Execution Server tries to dynamically establish a diameter connection to the CDF using the information available in the P-CFA. This results in a dynamic entry to in the Peer table (this does not impact the Realm Routing table). '''NOTE''': The entry is added even if the connection fails. In such cases, the procedures related to incoming peer connections are applied. When this parameter value is set to "Realm", the realm routing procedures are applied in case the Execution Server does not have direct connections to the CDF. The realm is extracted from the user name AVP present in the Accounting Request (ACR). '''NOTE''': Using realm routing for Rf implies that the destination host AVP is present in the ACRs, which is not compliant with the ACR ABNF as defined in 3GPP TS 32.299. The destination host must be inserted in realm-based routing for a request to reach a specific server, which is in this case a given Charging Collection Function (CCF).

parameter.name: enableACREvent
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether Accounting Requests (ACRs) of type Event (ACR[Event]) are generated for unanswered calls.

parameter.name: limitRepeatedAVP
parameter.description: This parameter controls how many instances of a given Attribute Value Pair (AVP) are allowed. When the value is set to "unlimited", an unlimited number of instances of a given AVP are allowed to be included in an Accounting Request (ACR). When the value is set to "drop", a maximum of maxAVPLimit instances of a given AVP are included in ACR messages. Extra instances are not added to the ACR. When the value is set to "sendInSeparateACR", extra AVP instances are sent in one (or more) separate ACR[Interim], up to a maximum of maxAVPLimit AVP instances per ACR.

parameter.name: maxAVPLimit
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of instances allowed in an Accounting Request (ACR) message for a given AVP. This parameter is only used when limitRepeatedAVP is set to "drop" or "sendInSeparateACR" and has no effect when limitRepeatedAVP is set to "unlimited".

parameter.name: serviceContextID
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Service-Context-ID value to set (AVP 461) for an offline (Rf) request.

parameter.name: useACAOriginHostForACRDestinationHost
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether the Destination-Host Attribute Value Pair (AVP) sent in Accounting Request (ACR) of types ACR[Interim] and ACR[Stop] is present and populated with the content of the Origin-Host AVP of the previous Accounting Answer (ACA).

context.name: Online
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Online-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Online-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Online attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the Ro Online interface on and off.

parameter.name: simultaneousOnlineOfflineBilling
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the type of billing. When this parameter value is set to "true" the Ro billing is on. When this parameter value is set to "false", both the Ro and Rf billing are on.

parameter.name: defaultTimeQuotaThresholdInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time margin at which the Execution Server requests new credits before the current credits are exhausted or the validity is reached.

parameter.name: defaultCreditControlFailureHandling
parameter.description: This parameter controls the retryAndTerminate function which determines the behavior of handling a credit failure.

parameter.name: unitDetermination
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the method of credits (in seconds) to allocate.

parameter.name: timeSliceInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of credits to allocate. When [[unitDetermination]] is set to "Decentralized", this parameter specifies the number of credits to allocate.

parameter.name: warningToneThresholdInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter enables ("true") or disables ("false") the inclusion of BroadSoft vendor-specific Attribute Value Pair (AVPs).

parameter.name: enableBroadSoftAVPs
parameter.description: This parameter enables ("true") or disables ("false") the inclusion of BroadSoft vendor-specific Attribute Value Pair (AVPs).

parameter.name: routingMode
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the routing mode. When this parameter value is set to "Direct", the Execution Server has a direct connection to the Charging Data Functions (CDFs) specified in the ''P-CFA'' header. For a given Rf accounting session, the CDFs are tried in the order received in the ''P-CFA''; if no Diameter connection exists for a given CDF, the next CDF from the ''P-CFA'' is tried. When this parameter value is set to "Dynamic", this parameter is similar to "Direct", except that if no direct connection exists to a given CDF, the Execution Server tries to dynamically establish a diameter connection to the CDF using the information available in the ''P-CFA''. This results in a dynamic entry to be created in the Peer table (this does not impact the Realm Routing table). '''NOTE 1''': The entry is added even if the connection fails. In such cases, the procedures related to incoming peer connections are applied. When this parameter value is set to "Realm", this parameter indicates that realm routing procedures are applied in case the Execution Server does not have direct connections to the CDF. The realm is extracted from the user name AVP present in the ACR. '''NOTE 2''': Using realm routing for Rf implies that the destination host AVP is present in the ACRs, which is not compliant with the ACR ABNF as defined in 3GPP TS 32.299. The destination host must be inserted in realm-based routing for a request to reach a specific server, in this case a given CCF.

parameter.name: txTimerInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the length of time call setup is suspended. It is not the actual time allocated to the Open Client Server (OCS) to answer a Credit Control Request (CCR).

parameter.name: serviceContextID
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Service-Context-ID value to set (AVP 461) for an online (Ro) request.

parameter.name: bypassPrepaidForFinalUnitRedirection
parameter.description: This parameter controls whether online billing is bypassed on a final unit redirection.

parameter.name: ratingGroup
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the rating-group value to set (AVP 432) for an online (Ro) request. When the calue is set to nil, the Attribute-Value Pair (AVP) is omitted.

parameter.name: enableWarningTone
parameter.description: This parameter controls whether a warning tone plays before credits run out.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) Online attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to clear.

context.name: File
context.description: These commands are used to determine the creation parameters of a billing file.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the BroadWorks CDR file-specific interface configuration.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the configuration for the BroadWorks CDR interface.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the billing configuration on and off.

parameter.name: format
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the format of the output. When this parameter value is set to "CSV", the output format for accounting record is .csv (comma separated values file). When this parameter value is set to "XML", the output format for the accounting record is in the extensible markup language (XML).

parameter.name: bufferSize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of buffered Call Detail Records (CDRs). As CDRs are generated, they are buffered in Random Access Memory (RAM) before being written to disk. The number of buffered call detail records ranges from 1 through 100, and is set to "10" by default.

parameter.name: holdTime
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the amount of time the billing file is stored on the system (in days).

parameter.name: rotationTimeHour
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the hour at which the accounting files are rotated.

parameter.name: rotationTimeMinutes
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minutes at which the accounting files are rotated.

parameter.name: rotationsPerDay
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of rotations per day for the billing file.

context.name: FTP
context.description: A single mode of transmission is supported: batch-mode FTP. In this mode, the call detail records are written to a file and transferred periodically to the system provider's billing system or mediation device. The call detail records are written to disk before being sent by FTP. They have the option of being archived for a configurable number of days. This level of the CLI provides options for determining the location of the billing file sent by FTP.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the BroadWorks Call Detail Record (CDR) File Transfer Protocol (FTP)-specific interface configuration.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the BroadWorks Call Detail Record (CDR) File Transfer Protocol (FTP)-specific interface configuration.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the billing File Transfer Process (FTP) delivery feature on and off.

parameter.name: directory
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the remote directory to which the billing files are copied, assuming they are not empty. The name is terminated with a forward slash (/) character or a backslash (\) character, depending on the target platform).

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the host name of the machine to which the billing files are copied.

parameter.name: userId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user ID that is used for authentication to the remote FTP server.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the password that is used for authentication to the remote File Transfer Protocol (FTP) server.

parameter.name: usePassiveMode
parameter.description: This parameter turns passive mode on or off. When this parameter value is set to "true", the passive mode is turned on. When this parameter value is set to "false", the passive mode is turned off. This parameter is used when the Execution Server is behind a firewall that blocks usual FTP data connections with the billing or mediation device.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) the BroadWorks Call Detail Record (CDR) File Transfer Protocol (FTP)-specific interface configuration.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: Radius
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Radius accounting attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view all Radius accounting attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Radius accounting attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the sending of Call Detail Records (CDRs) in real-time on and off.

parameter.name: sendCallStartCDR
parameter.description: Specifies whether or not a CDR is to be sent upon originations or terminations.

parameter.name: sendCallAnswerCDR
parameter.description: Specifies whether or not a CDR is to be sent upon answer.

parameter.name: sharedSecret
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the secret used for validating the authenticator in accounting requests and responses. This entry is case sensitive. It needs to match the configuration of the Radius servers. If two Radius servers are used, both servers must use the same ''sharedSecret'' attribute with respect to this Execution Server.

parameter.name: retransmissionDelayInMilliseconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the delay (in milliseconds) before the Execution Server considers a Call Detail Record (CDR) request failed and retransmits the message to the next Radius server in the pool.

parameter.name: maxTransmissions
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of transmissions for the same accounting request to any Radius server. New accounting requests are kept in a holding queue.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) the Radius accounting attribute(s).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to clear.

context.name: Device
context.description: This level is used to view and add new Radius servers to the system. You can also modify or remove attributes related to the Radius servers.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Radius server-related attributes.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a new Radius server.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the Radius server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Radius server port.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the description of the Radius server.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Radius server-related attributes.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the Radius server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Radius server port.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the description of the Radius server.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing Radius server.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the Radius server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Radius server port.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) specific attributes from an existing Radius server.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the Radius server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Radius server port.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: FieldIdMapping
context.description: Use this level to display and modify accounting field Id values mapping internal account field Ids to external accounting field Ids.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the internal accounting field ID to external accounting field ID mappings.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the account external field Id mapping attributes. A restart is required for the change to take effect.

parameter.name: internalId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies an internal accounting field ID.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: externalId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies an external accounting field ID. This is the ID output to accounting records.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) the account external field ID mapping attributes. A restart is required for the change to take effect.

parameter.name: internalId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies an internal accounting field ID.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to clear.

context.name: CAP
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Client Application Protocol (CAP)-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Client Application Protocol (CAP)-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Client Application Protocol (CAP)-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: decoderNumThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of decoder threads for the Client Application Protocol (CAP). This parameter is automatically configured at the time of server installation based on the number of core Central Processing Units (CPUs) installed.

parameter.name: encoderNumThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of encoder threads for the Client Application Protocol (CAP). This parameter is automatically configured at the time of the server installation based on the number of core Central Processing Units (CPUs) installed.

parameter.name: serverPort
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the server port number.

parameter.name: maxClientConnections
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of client connections allowed.

parameter.name: enableConnectionPing
parameter.description: This parameter enables ("true") and disables ("false") the connection ping function. This parameter is used to keep or verify that the connection is still active.

parameter.name: connectionPingIntervalInMinutes
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the connection ping time interval (in minutes).

context.name: CommonCommunicationTransport
context.description: Use this interface level to configure the BroadWorks Common Communication Transport. The Common Communication Transport protocol is a TCP-based transport method that is protocol-independent, that is it can be used to send and receive messages concurrently using multiple protocols using a generic set of message wrappers. It increases performance and security by reducing the need for open ports on the network, supporting Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) security, and supporting per-protocol access control lists.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the BroadWorks Common Communication Transport attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the BroadWorks Common Communication Transport attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: unsecured
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port used by the Common Communication Transport (CCT) for communication with the Execution Server on the current host.

parameter.name: secured
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port used by the Common Communication Transport (CCT) for secure communication with the Execution Server on the current host.

context.name: OCI
context.description: This level is used to configure Open Client Interface (OCI)-related attributes of the BroadWorks Common Communication Transport.

context.name: Provisioning
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Open Client Interface-Provisioning (OCI-P) attributes of the BroadWorks Common Communication Transport.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Open Client Interface-Provisioning (OCI-P) attributes of the BroadWorks Common Communication Transport.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Open Client Interface-Provisioning (OCI-P) attributes of the BroadWorks Common Communication Transport.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: reconnectInterval
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time (in seconds) between reconnection attempts when the Execution Server-Open Client Interface (OCI) connection between the Execution Server and the Provisioning Server is down.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the timeout value for a given request. When a request is made to the Provisioning Server through the Execution Server-OCI link, the Execution Server stops waiting for a response.

context.name: XSI
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Xtended Service Interface (XSI)-related attributes for the BroadWorks Common Communication Transport.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Xtended Service Interface (XSI)-related attributes for the BroadWorks Common Communication Transport.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Xtended Service Interface (XSI)-related attributes for the BroadWorks Common Communication Transport.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: unlimitedConnections
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether to allow unlimited connections on the current host. If you select "false", you must also specify the maximum number of connections (integers from 1 through 65535).

parameter.name: false
parameter.description: Indicate that the number of connections is limited.

parameter.name: maxNumberOfConnections
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether to allow unlimited connections on the current host. If you select "false", you must also specify the maximum number of connections (integers from 1 through 65535).

parameter.name: restrictInterfaces
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether the Execution Server restricts the local Internet Protocol (IP) interfaces allowed to receive messages using the Open Client Interface (OCI) protocol. If the value is set to "true", you must configure the list of remote hosts allowed to use Operations Support System (OSS).

context.name: Interfaces
context.description: Use this level to configure the list of local IP interfaces allowed to receive messages using the OCI protocol over the BroadWorks Common Communications Transport.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the list of local Internet Protocol (IP) interfaces allowed to receive messages using the Open Client Interface (OCI) protocol.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add an interface address to the list of local Internet Protocol (IP) interfaces allowed to receive messages using the Open Client Interface (OCI) protocol.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interface Internet Protocol (IP) address.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove an interface address from the list of local Internet Protocol (IP) interfaces allowed to receive messages using the Open Client Interface (OCI) protocol in thesystem.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interface Internet Protocol (IP) address.

context.name: Diameter
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Diameter-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Diameter-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Diameter-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: diameterIdentity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Diameter identity associated with the node (included in origin host Attribute Value Pair [AVP] of outgoing Diameter messages). '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period (.).

parameter.name: realm
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Diameter realm associated with the node (the value of the origin realm Attribute Value Pair (AVP) in outgoing Diameter messages). '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period (.).

parameter.name: listeningAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the address on which the Diameter stack binds a server socket for incoming connections.

parameter.name: listeningPort
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) port on which the Diameter stack binds a server socket for incoming connections.

parameter.name: tcTimerSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Total Calls (TC) timer that controls the delay after which the Diameter stack attempts to reconnect with a peer after detecting a connection failure.

parameter.name: twTimerSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Total Wait (TW) timer that controls the frequency of device watchdog messages (when no other messages are exchanged on the peer connection) and is used in the connection failure detection algorithm.

parameter.name: requestTimerSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the default request timer (in seconds). Once this threshold is reached, the Diameter stack reports a time-out to applications and removes the request from its request queue.

parameter.name: busyPeerDetectionOutstandingTxnCount
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of concurrent outstanding transactions allowed on a single peer connection. Once this threshold is reached, the Diameter stack reports a busy peer to applications. The Diameter stack no longer sends requests to the peer until the number of concurrent outstanding transactions has been lowered below the set value.

parameter.name: busyPeerRestoreOutstandingTxnCount
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of concurrent outstanding transactions. Once the threshold is reached, the Diameter stack starts sending requests again after having detected a busy peer condition.

parameter.name: dynamicEntryInactivityTimerInHours
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the idle time allowed for a dynamic entry (either the Realm Routing table entry or Peer table entry) before it is removed from the table. Dynamic Peer table entries are not removed if they are referenced by at least one Realm Routing table entry.

parameter.name: redirectMaxDepth
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of times a Sh request can be redirected (both explicit and cached redirections combined).

parameter.name: redirectUserMaxCacheSize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of redirect cache entries associated with users. Redirect cache entries are associated with users upon reception of a Diameter redirection answer with redirect host usage Attribute Value Pair (AVP) set to "ALL_USER (6)".

parameter.name: workerThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of Diameter worker threads.

parameter.name: customDiameterVendorId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a vendor ID that identifies a vendor that BroadSoft has created custom development for. When a supported vendor ID is specified, the custom development is triggered.

parameter.name: firmwareRevision
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the content of the Firmware-Revision Attribute Value Pair (AVP) exchanged in Capabilities-Exchange-Request (CER) and Capabilities-Exchange-Answer (CEA) messages. When not set, the Attribute Value Pair (AVP) is not populated.

parameter.name: productName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the product-name value to set (AVP 2619) for a diameter peer connection. The default value is "BroadWorks".

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear a Diameter-related attribute.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: ExecutionSettings
context.description: This level defines the execution dataless diameter configuration settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the current diameter specific configurations for the Execution Dataless application.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to configure the diameter specific configurations for the Execution Dataless application.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: advertisedOfflineBillingApplication
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the application ID advertised for offline billing during the Diameter capability exchange. When "Base" is selected, Acct-Application-Id=3 is advertised. When "3gpp" is selected, Vendor-Specific-Application-Id(Acct-Application-Id=3; Vendor-Id=10415) is advertised.

parameter.name: advertisedOnlineBillingApplication
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the application ID advertised for online billing during the Diameter capability exchange. When "Base" is selected, Auth-Application-Id=4 is advertised. When "3gpp" is selected, Vendor-Specific-Application-Id(Auth-Application-Id=4; Vendor-Id=10415) is advertised.

context.name: Peers
context.description: This level is used to manage the Peer Table's static entries for Diameter. Aggregated view of static and dynamic entries along with actual connection statuses is available under the XS_CLI/XSDiagnostic/Diameter context.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Diameter Peers-related entries.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add Diameter Peers-related entries.

parameter.name: identity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Diameter identity of the peer. '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period (.).

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) port on which the peer is listening for Diameter connections.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns connections to the peer on and off. If this value is set to "false", the Diameter stack does not attempt to connect to the peer and rejects incoming connection attempts from the peer.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the peer. This parameter is optional. If it is not specified, the actual Internet Protocol (IP) address is resolved on the Domain Name System (DNS).

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Diameter Peers-related entries.

parameter.name: identity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Diameter identity of the peer. '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period (.).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the peer. This parameter is optional. If it is not specified, the actual Internet Protocol (IP) address is resolved on the Domain Name System (DNS).

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) port on which the peer is listening for Diameter connections.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns connections to the peer on and off. If this value is set to "false", the Diameter stack does not attempt to connect to the peer and rejects incoming connection attempts from the peer.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove Diameter Peers-related entries.

parameter.name: identity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Diameter identity of the peer. '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period (.).

command.name: clear
command.description: Use this command is clear (set to no value) or view Diameter Peers-related entries attributes.

parameter.name: identity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Diameter identity of the peer. '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period (.).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: Realms
context.description: This level is used to manage Realm Routing Table's static for the Diameter interface.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Realm Routing Table's static entries.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add Realm Routing Table's static entries.

parameter.name: realm
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the realm name. '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period.

parameter.name: applicationId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ID of the application associated with the Realm Routing table entry. The value "All" is a wildcard character indicating that the entry applies to all supported Diameter applications.

parameter.name: default
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the entry to be used as a default Realm Routing table entry for the specified application ID. There is, at most, one default entry per application ID. Only one entry per application ID can be set to "true" in the whole Realm Routing table.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Realm Routing Table's static entries.

parameter.name: realm
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the realm name. '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period.

parameter.name: applicationId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ID of the application associated with the Realm Routing table entry. The value "All" is a wildcard character indicating that the entry applies to all supported Diameter applications.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: default
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the entry to be used as a default Realm Routing table entry for the specified application ID. There is, at most, one default entry per application ID. Only one entry per application ID can be set to "true" in the whole Realm Routing table.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete Realm Routing Table's static entries.

parameter.name: realm
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the realm name. '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period.

parameter.name: applicationId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ID of the application associated with the Realm Routing table entry. The value "All" is a wildcard character indicating that the entry applies to all supported Diameter applications.

context.name: RoutingPeers
context.description: This level is used to manage Routing Peers associated to a static Realm Routing Table entry.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view all Routing Peers associated to a static Realm Routing Table entry.

parameter.name: realm
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the realm name. '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period.

parameter.name: applicationId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ID of the application associated with the Realm Routing table entry. The value "All" is a wildcard character indicating that the entry applies to all supported Diameter applications.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a Routing Peer associated to a static Realm Routing Table entry. The Routing Peer's instance and identity must correspond to a Static Peer with the same instance and identity.

parameter.name: realm
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the realm name. '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period.

parameter.name: applicationId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ID of the application associated with the Realm Routing table entry. The value "All" is a wildcard character indicating that the entry applies to all supported Diameter applications.

parameter.name: identity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Peer identity and must match an entry in the Peer table. A routing peer appears only once for a given Realm Routing table entry.

parameter.name: priority
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the priority of this peer against other routing peers associated with the same Realm Routing table entry.

parameter.name: weight
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the weight used for ordering peers with the same priority.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify a Routing Peer associated to a static Realm Routing Table entry. The Routing Peer's instance and identity must correspond to a Static Peer with the same instance and identity.

parameter.name: realm
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the realm name. '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period.

parameter.name: applicationId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ID of the application associated with the Realm Routing table entry. The value "All" is a wildcard character indicating that the entry applies to all supported Diameter applications.

parameter.name: identity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Peer identity and must match an entry in the Peer table. A routing peer appears only once for a given Realm Routing table entry.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: priority
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the priority of this peer against other routing peers associated with the same Realm Routing table entry.

parameter.name: weight
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the weight used for ordering peers with the same priority.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a Routing Peer associated to a static Realm Routing Table entry. The Routing Peer's instance and identity must correspond to a Static Peer with the same instance and identity.

parameter.name: realm
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the realm name. '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period.

parameter.name: applicationId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ID of the application associated with the Realm Routing table entry. The value "All" is a wildcard character indicating that the entry applies to all supported Diameter applications.

parameter.name: identity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Peer identity and must match an entry in the Peer table. A routing peer appears only once for a given Realm Routing table entry.

context.name: FTP
context.description: This level is used to manage general FTP system level attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the File Transfer Protocol (FTP) -related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the File Transfer Protocol (FTP) -related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: maxConnectionAttemptDurationInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the amount of time to try to establish a connection.

parameter.name: maxTransferDurationInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the amount of time for a connection to stay open.

context.name: IMS
context.description: This level is used to view and modify IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS)-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS)-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS)-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: setPriorityHeaderForEmergency
parameter.description: This parameter provides configurable support for adding or modifying the ''Priority'' header for emergency calls. When this parameter value is set to "false", the Execution Server does not add or modify the ''Priority'' header for emergency calls. When this parameter value is set to "true", the ''Priority'' header is added/modified with the value of "emergency" for emergency calls.

parameter.name: addNoServicesParameterForOOTB
parameter.description: This parameter defines whether the Execution Server adds this parameter to the ''Route'' header when the Execution Server sends an Out-of-the-Blue (OOTB) request to a Serving Call Session Control Function (S-CSCF).

parameter.name: supportImplicitIdentities
parameter.description: This parameter changes the Request-URI from an implicit identity into the user's primary Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) Public User Identity (PUI) for termination attempts. This parameter does not affect origination attempts. When this parameter value is set to "true", the Request-URI is unchanged for a termination attempt to an implicit identity. When this parameter value is set to "false", the Request-URI is changed to the user's primary SIP URI PUI, for a termination attempt to an implicit identity.

parameter.name: routingMode
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the routing mode. When this parameter value is set to "routingB2BUA", the ''Route'' header received from the Serving Call Session Control Function (S-CSCF) is reused for all non-Out-of-the-Blue (OOTB) originating requests sent to the S-CSCF. When this parameter value is set to "asRoute", the OOTB ''Route'' header is always built using the Sh interface/system parameter data stored in the Execution Server.
