When this parameter value is set to "receivedRouteLocation", the OOTB ''Route'' header is built using the S-CSCF location (host, optional port, and optional transport) from the ''Route'' header entry received from an S-CSCF in many scenarios.

parameter.name: useEnhancedNetworkTranslations
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether the Execution Server queries the Network Server for network translations.

parameter.name: userPhoneErrorCorrection
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the type of user=phone error correction performed for originations. When this parameter value is set to "Full", full error correction is performed. When this parameter value is set to "IdentityDomain", the following error correction is performed: for a user origination to a Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) without user=phone present, user=phone is added prior to translations if the user portion of the URI is all digits and the host portion of the URI matches the originating SIP URI Public User Identity (PUI)'s domain. When this parameter value is set to "None", no error correction is performed. The default value for an upgrade is "Full" to maintain the previous behavior. The default value for a new installation is "IdentityDomain".

parameter.name: supportPrivacyNone
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether the Execution Server respects the "None" value in the ''Privacy'' header for a user origination. When this parameter value is set to "true" and a user origination is received with the ''Privacy'' header set to "None", then the user's Calling Line ID (CLID) Delivery Blocking service setting is ignored. However, if the user dials the CLID Delivery Blocking per Call Feature Access Code (FAC), then the privacy restrictions are enabled since the user explicitly requested privacy in the origination. When this parameter value is set to "false" and a user origination is received with the ''Privacy'' header set to "None", the user's CLID Delivery Blocking service setting is applied, privacy restrictions are enabled, and the user has the service enabled.

parameter.name: usePAIForPrivateCLID
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether the Execution Server uses the PAI header for the Calling Line ID (CLID) of a network originator when privacy is requested. When this parameter value is set to "true" and a network origination is received with privacy requested, the tel Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) entry in the PAI header is used as the originator's CLID. If no such URI entry is present, then the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) URI entry in the PAI header is used as the originator's CLID. The Call Detail Records (CDRs), services such as Malicious Call Trace and Call Forwarding Selective, and the From header in the INVITE are sent back to the Serving - Call Session Control Function (S-CSCF) using this CLID from the PAI header. When this parameter value is set to "false" and a network origination is received with privacy requested, the From header is used as the originator's CLID.

parameter.name: support3rdPartyRegistration
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether registrations are successfully processed and it also allows the registered and static contacts to be used for Out-of-the-Blue (OOTB) situations. When this parameter value is set to "Enabled", the Execution Server accepts received REGISTER requests with 200 OK responses and allows the registered and static contacts to be used for Out-of-the-Blue (OOTB) situations. When this parameter value is set to "Disabled", the Execution Server rejects received REGISTER requests with 403 Forbidden responses. When this parameter value is set to "EnableRegistrarOnly", the Execution Server allows registrations to be successfully processed. However, "EnableRegistrarOnly" does not enable the use of the registered or static contact.

parameter.name: supportShSCSCFName
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether the Sh-provided Call Session Control Function (S-CSCF) name is used. If this parameter is set to "false", the S-CSCF name is not used even if it is present. If this parameter is set to "true", the S-CSCF name is used. If this parameter is set to "true" and no S-CSCF name is present, the [[cscfAddressHost]] parameter is no longer used as a default for Out-of-the-Blue (OOTB) except for non-trunk group virtual subscribers.

parameter.name: includeCscfParameterInToHeader
parameter.description: This parameter lets the Execution determine whether it includes the ''cscf'' parameter in the ''To'' header for an Out-of-the-Blue (OOTB) terminating INVITE request. If the INVITE received by Execution Server contains the ''cscf'' parameter in the ''To'' header, the Execution Server does not invoke Terminating services. This parameter applies only for the OOTB terminating requests. When this parameter value is set to "true", the OOTB terminating INVITE request from the Execution Server to S-CSCF contains the ''cscf'' parameter in the ''To'' header. When this parameter value is set to "false", the OOTB terminating INVITE request from the Execution Server to S-CSCF does not contain the ''cscf'' parameter in the ''To'' header.

parameter.name: includeDirectoryNumberInPAI
parameter.description: This parameter enables ("true") and disables ("false") the directory number in a ''P-Asserted-Identity'' header.

parameter.name: connectedOriginationRouteHandling
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the connected origination route handling. The value is set to either "Default" or "OOTB" (Out-of-the-Blue).

parameter.name: pServedUserSyntax
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the syntax that BroadWorks uses to carry the served user information.

parameter.name: enableOIPCompliance
parameter.description: This parameter enables Originating Identity Presentation (OIP) compliance. When this parameter value is set to "true", the ''P-Asserted-Identity'' and ''Privacy'' headers are stripped from the access-side invitations based on the relevant Calling Line Identity Delivery (CLID) service.

parameter.name: forceDeflectedCallBeforeAnswerAsOOTB
parameter.description: This parameter controls the forcing of all deflected calls before answer as Out-of-the-Blue (OOTB) requests.

parameter.name: rejectCallsToUnregisteredUsers
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether calls to unregistered IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS) users (as indicated by the "regstate" parameter of the P-Served-User header of a terminating SIP INVITE) are rejected.

context.name: CscfRoute
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Call Session Control Function (CSCF)-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Call Session Control Function (CSCF)-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Call Session Control Function (CSCF)-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) for a Call Session Control Function (CSCF) cluster. This is the address that the Execution Server uses to send unusual requests. The Execution Server also includes a pre-loaded ROUTE for these requests with the value of the ''cscfAddressHost'' parameter. The default value for this parameter is blank (that is, it is not set).

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the listening port for the Call Session Control Function (CSCF) cluster. If the ''cscfAddressPort'' parameter is not set, the Execution Server uses Domain Name Server (DNS) Service Locator (SRV) lookup, if enabled. If the ''cscfAddressPort'' parameter is set, DNS SRV is not used. The default value for this parameter is blank (that is, it is not set).

parameter.name: transportProtocol
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the transport protocol used by the Call Session Control Function (CSCF) cluster.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) Call Session Control Function (CSCF)-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: LDAP
context.description: This level is used to view and modify attributes related to the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP).

context.name: Client
context.description: This level is used to view and modify attributes related to the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) client.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) client options.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) client options.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: baseDistinguishedName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the distinguished name of the search base(for example, dc=broadsoft,dc=com).

parameter.name: bindPassword
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the credentials to bind to the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether the BroadWorks Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) client is enabled.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) client options.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

context.name: LocalUsers
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) local users.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view local users.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add local user.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the local user name for which the group membership lookups are not performed to the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server. This can be useful in case of unavailability of the LDAP server.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete local user.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the local user name for which the group membership lookups are not performed to the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server. This can be useful in case of unavailability of the LDAP server.

context.name: Servers
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) servers.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) servers.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number.

parameter.name: secured
parameter.description: This parameter specifies if secure communication is enabled.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server options.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number.

parameter.name: secured
parameter.description: This parameter specifies if secure communication is enabled.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server.

context.name: LocationApi
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the location Application Programming Interface (API)-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the location Application Programming Interface (API)-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the location Application Programming Interface (API)-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: minNumberOfThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minimum number of location Application Programming Interface (API) threads.

parameter.name: maxNumberOfThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of location Application Programming Interface (API) threads.

parameter.name: maxQueueSize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of requests to queue up before allocating more than the minimum number of threads in this pool.

context.name: Mail
context.description: The Internet Mail Facility is an interface that permits users to receive e-mail messages via the system.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view mail-related attributes, such as the default From address, default Subject heading, and the primary and secondary Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) servers.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify mail-related attributes, such as the default From address, default Subject heading, and the primary and secondary Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) servers.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: primaryServerNetAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the primary Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) server address to provide e-mail to users.

parameter.name: secondaryServerNetAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the secondary Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) server address to provide e-mail to users.

parameter.name: defaultFromAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the default ''From'' address to be used when BroadWorks sends an e-mail for Customer Premises Equipment (CPE) configuration errors, Service Pack Migration messages, and web password lockout messages. '''NOTE''': For services that generate e-mails, such as Call Center, Emergency Zones, Inventory Report, Conferencing, Voice Messaging, and Call Notify, the [[defaultFromAddress]] is defined at the service level.

parameter.name: defaultSubject
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the default subject heading to use when the sender's e-mail subject is not available, for example, ''Subject Not Available''.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) mail-related attributes, such as the default From address, default Subject heading, and the primary and secondary Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) servers.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: ProvisioningValidation
context.description: The provisioning validation framework is used to validate forwarding numbers provisioned against the Outgoing Calling Plan. It also provides network translation support, thus enabling complete validation of the destination numbers. When the destination number is determined to be a network destination, the Network Server is queried. The number is then validated by AAC and OCP, taking into account the Network Server results. Note that for network destinations, the Network Server is queried even if the validity of the destination could be determined without the network translations. A trivial example of this is a user who has neither AAC nor OCP services. Adding Network Server queries allows proper resolution of City Wide Centrex and toll calls.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Provisioning Validation-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Provisioning Validation-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: networkServerQueryActive
parameter.description: This parameter turns provisioning validation on and off. When this parameter value is set to "true", provisioning validation queries the Network Server for all network destinations and is able to fully validate the destination number. When this parameter value is set to "false", the Execution Server does not query the Network Server and is unable to completely screen out invalid destination addresses for City Wide Centrex users, or when the toll status is available only in the Network Server results.

context.name: SIP
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) attributes. Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) information is required to establish communication between the network elements (NEs). The SIP interface supports call completion. The Execution Server supports two SIP timer values: t1: the initial SIP message retransmission time interval to wait before re-transmitting messages. t2: the maximum time interval between retransmission of non-INVITE requests retry interval. If the initial attempt to transmit a SIP request fails, the system will retry after the interval specified by t1. This interval will then double for each subsequent retransmission attempt unless restricted by t2. If the maximum interval specified by t2 is exceeded, then each subsequent transmission will occur at the t2 interval instead. Note that only non-INVITE requests can be restricted by t2. These timers correspond to the T1 and T2 timers described in RFC 3261. Retransmission attempts continue until one of the following conditions is met:Interval exceeds 64*t1. For access-side INVITEs, the interval exceeds the terminationAttemptTimeoutSeconds value specified under the XS_CLI/System/CallP/AccessRouting> context and the terminationAttemptTimeoutActive parameter is set to true. For network-side INVITEs, the interval exceeds the routeTimerLength value specified under the XS_CLI/System/CallP/Routing/RouteParms> context. This level is also used to configure an Execution Server to interwork with a Call Session Control Function (CSCF).

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Session Initiation Protocol (SIP)-related attributes, such as the default port and t1 and t2 timer values.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Session Initiation Protocol (SIP)-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: t1
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) t1 timer (in milliseconds).

parameter.name: t2
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) t2 timer (in milliseconds).

parameter.name: maxForwards
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of hops allowed before a call is rejected due to the number of forward hops. The Execution Server keeps track of the number of forwarding hops to detect forwarding loops.

parameter.name: inviteAuthenticationRatio
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ratio, expressed in decimals (0, 1 and 0.000000001 through 0.999999999) of Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) INVITE messages that are challenged for authentication out of those that are destined for users who have the Authentication service assigned.

parameter.name: encryptFromHeader
parameter.description: This parameter enables encryption in the ''From'' header. When this parameter value is set to "true", the ''From'' header is encrypted in the INVITEs sent to network devices when the caller requests privacy. When this parameter value is set to "false", the ''From'' header is not encrypted in INVITEs sent to network devices irrespective of whether or not the caller requests privacy.

parameter.name: reliable1xx
parameter.description: This parameter enables the delivery of provisional responses in accordance with RFC 3262. When this parameter value is set to "true", the 100rel is supported by BroadWorks. When this parameter value is set to "false", the 100rel is not supported by BroadWorks. Set the 100rel to "false" to improve capacity by preventing the PRACK message flow during call setup. However, this can degrade the user experience during Program Update Information (UPD) packet loss situations, when provisional responses such as 180 Ringing are not successfully delivered.

parameter.name: sendE164
parameter.description: This parameter enables the sending of E164 formatted strings digits. When this parameter value is set to "false", BroadWorks uses all digits in the user portion of Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) URLs when it sends INVITE messages for digit-dialed calls. When this parameter value is set to "true", BroadWorks uses E.164 formatted strings digits in the user portion of SIP URLs when sending INVITE messages for digit-dialed calls.

parameter.name: suspiciousAddressTryThreshold
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of unacknowledged attempts to an Internet Protocol (IP) address associated with a fully qualified domain name (FQDN) before another IP address associated with the FQDN is tried. A value of zero ("0") indicates that only one IP address from the DNS query is tried. During call-setup when the routing tables are involved, ''/System/CallP/Routing/RouteParms/ routeTimerLength'' is used instead of suspicious ''AddressThreshold'' to advance among hostnames multiple IP addresses.

parameter.name: listeningPort
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port upon which the messages are received.

parameter.name: supportDNSSRV
parameter.description: This parameter enables the support of Domain Name Server (DNS) Service Locator (SRV) records. When this parameter value is set to "false", DNS Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) SRV queries are deactivated. If BroadWorks is deployed in a network that has been provisioned without DNS SIP SRV records, setting the value to "false" avoids useless DNS SIP SRV queries. When this parameter value is set to "true", DNS SIP SRV queries are activated.

parameter.name: maxAddressesPerHostname
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of addresses from a Domain Name Server (DNS) query that are attempted. The value includes both SRV queries and A record queries. Thus, if a Service Locator (SRV) host name query results in multiple host names, the address count crosses multiple host names.

parameter.name: maxAddressesPerHostnameInDialog
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of addresses from a Domain Name Server (DNS) query, which are attempted once a dialog has been established. The value includes both Service Locator (SRV) queries and A record queries. If an SRV host name query results in multiple host names, the address count crosses multiple host names.

parameter.name: includeT38CapabilityInfo
parameter.description: This parameter enables the T38 capability information. When this parameter value is set to "false", T38 capability information is not included for Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) devices. When this parameter value is set to "true", T38 capability information is included for Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) devices.

parameter.name: reInviteAuthentication
parameter.description: This parameter enables the authentication of Re-INVITES. When this parameter value is set to "false", Re-INVITES are not authenticated. When this parameter value is set to "true", Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Re-INVITES are authenticated.

parameter.name: enableHoldNormalization
parameter.description: This parameter enables ("true") and disables ("false") RFC 3264 hold Session Description Protocol (SDP) sending support. This controls how BroadWorks sends hold SDP on the network and access-side interfaces.

parameter.name: symmetricSignaling
parameter.description: This parameter enables symmetric signaling. When this parameter value is set to "true", the Execution Server sends Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) messages on the same source tuple (protocol, IP address, port) as it uses to receive. NOTE: The system must be restarted for this change to be implemented.

parameter.name: supportTCP
parameter.description: This parameter enables support for the Transmission Control Protocol (TCP). When this parameter value is set to "true", support to transport Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) signaling through TCP is enabled. When this parameter value is set to "false", support to transport Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) signaling through TCP is disabled.

parameter.name: supportDNSNAPTR
parameter.description: This parameter enables support for the use of DNS Naming Authority Pointer (NAPTR). When this parameter value is set to "true", support for the use of DNS Naming Authority Pointer (NAPTR) records is enabled. When this parameter value is set to "false", support for the use of DNS Naming Authority Pointer (NAPTR) records is disabled.

parameter.name: supportRFC3398
parameter.description: This parameter enables support for RFC 3398. When this parameter value is set to "false", the Execution Server allows remote to local ringback transitions. When this parameter value is set to "true", the Execution Server does not allow remote to local ringback transitions unless it determines that the remote side is another BroadWorks server.

parameter.name: restrictedDisplayName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the system-wide Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) restricted display name.

parameter.name: maxTCPSocketsPerSystem
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) sockets for each system

parameter.name: maxTCPSocketsPerPeer
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) sockets for each peer.

parameter.name: discardStaleConnections
parameter.description: This parameter specifies how long a stale connection is kept before it is discarded.

parameter.name: staleConnectionTimerInMinutes
parameter.description: This parameter enables the treatment of Dual-Tone Multi-Frequency (DTMF) pound as a flash.

parameter.name: treatDTMFPoundAsFlash
parameter.description: This parameter enables the treatment of Dual-Tone Multi-Frequency (DTMF) pound as a flash.

parameter.name: supportPEarlyMediaHeader
parameter.description: This parameter enables the Execution Server proxies and generates the ''P-Early-Media'' header.

parameter.name: sendDiversionInhibitor
parameter.description: This parameter provides the ability to send a diversion inhibitor.

parameter.name: supportRFC3966PhoneContext
parameter.description: This parameter provides support for the RFC 3966 phone context. When this parameter value is set to "true", the phone-context (if any) is used.

parameter.name: includePrivacyUser
parameter.description: This parameter includes the "user" value in the ''Privacy'' header when privacy is restricted when the value is set to "true".

parameter.name: INFO
parameter.description: When set to true, indicates that the INFO header is proxied.

parameter.name: UPDATE
parameter.description: When set to true, indicates that the UPDATE header is proxied.

parameter.name: useSessionCompletionTimer
parameter.description: This parameter enables ("true") the use of the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) session completion timer set by the administrator. If this parameter is set to "false", the SIP session completion timer from t2 is used.

parameter.name: sessionCompletionTimer
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the session completion timer (in milliseconds).

parameter.name: errorCorrectionOnSDPChange
parameter.description: This parameter enables the generation of a new ''To'' tag on Session Description Protocol (SDP) changes within a dialog.

parameter.name: send181Response
parameter.description: This parameter enables proxying and generating a Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) "181 Call is being forwarded" response.

parameter.name: clusterAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the host part of BroadWorks user when identified by a phone number. If this parameter not set and the publicIPAddress is set, the publicIPAddress is used. Otherwise, the ipAddress from the resolving "localhost" is used.

parameter.name: disabledCLIDNumberValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user portion of the calling line identity when no calling line identity is enabled for a user.

parameter.name: nonCallNumThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of threads affected to non-call-related processing.

parameter.name: callNumThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of threads affected to call-related processing.

parameter.name: encoderNumThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of threads affected to encoder-related processing.

parameter.name: maxCallInvitingPerSipUACalled
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of SipCall occurrences in INVITING state remembered for each SipUA instance when acting as called party (SipUA received INVITE). This property helps reduce the impact of forking that causes a large number of SipCall occurrences to be stored for each SipUA instance. When exceeded, the Execution Server releases the call instead of sending another INVITE provisional response to create another early dialog for the INVITE.

parameter.name: maxCallInvitingPerSipUACaller
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of [[SipCall]] occurrences in INVITING state remembered for each [[SipUA]] instance when acting as caller ([[SipUA]] sent INVITE). This property reduces the impact of forking that causes a large number of [[SipCall]] occurrences to be stored for each [[SipUA]] instance. When exceeded, the Execution Server cancels the INVITE.

parameter.name: maxCallPerSipUA
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of SipCall occurrences remembered for each SipUA instance. This property helps reduce the impact (or log occurrences) of forking and resubmit loops that cause a large number of SipCall occurrences to be stored for each SipUA instance.

parameter.name: tcpSendBufferSize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) send buffer size (in bytes) for the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP). When specified with a value other than "0", it replaces the [[OS]] value.

parameter.name: udpReceiveBufferSize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the size (in bytes) of the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) User Datagram Protocol (UDP) receive buffer.

parameter.name: send100ForNonInvite
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether the Execution Server sends a 100 Trying response to non-INVITE requests when the value is set to "true".

parameter.name: addServiceNameToCLIDinPAI
parameter.description: This determines whether the Execution Server prefixes the ''P-Asserted-Identity'' content with the service name in conjunction with the [[addServiceNameToCLID]] parameter when the value is set to "true".

parameter.name: sipIpVersion
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the IP version used for the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP).

parameter.name: reportAltcSupported
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether the Alternative Connectivity (ALTC) option is included in the SIP Supported header.

parameter.name: networkHoldNormalization
parameter.description: This parameter specifies how the Application Server will perform Session Description Protocol (SDP) normalization on the network side when attempting to hold the device media.

parameter.name: proxyRoutingNumberFromPAssertedIdentity
parameter.description: This parameter enables the proxy of the routing number parameter of P-Asserted-Identity (only if TEL URI) receives in the incoming originating SIP INVITE.

parameter.name: suppressImplicitReferSubscription
parameter.description: This parameter specifies how the Execution Server suppresses the implicit REFER subscription. When set to withoutNOTIFY, the Execution Server suppresses the implicit REFER subscription without sending a NOTIFY. When set to perRFC3515, the Execution Server sends a NOTIFY per RFC 3515 to suppress the implicit REFER subscription.

parameter.name: sendCallerNameInfoForNetworkCalls
parameter.description: This parameter controls whether or not Caller Name Information is sent in network calls.

parameter.name: includeAcceptContactExplicit
parameter.description: This parameter controls whether or not the 'explicit' parameter is added to the Accept-Contact header generated for outgoing requests when a '+sip.instance' parameter is present.

parameter.name: includeAcceptContactRequire
parameter.description: This parameter controls whether or not the 'require' parameter is added to the Accept-Contact header generated for outgoing requests when a '+sip.instance' parameter is present.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) SIP Session Initiation Protocol (SIP)-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: Access
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Access-related system attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Access-related system attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Access-related system attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: accessControl
parameter.description: This parameter enables access control. When this parameter value is set to "false", BroadWorks accepts an INVITE event if the domain name of the originator's location does not resolve to the same Internet Protocol (IP) address of the User Datagram Protocol (UDP) socket on which the message was received. When this parameter value is set to "true", BroadWorks rejects an INVITE event if the domain name of the originator's location does not resolve to the same IP address of the UDP socket on which the message was received.

parameter.name: callTypeQuerySupported
parameter.description: This parameter enables basic precall translation to a mobile soft switch through a Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) INFO request with a Require options tag of [[broadworkscalltypequery]] when the value is set to "true".

parameter.name: disallowCallsFromUnregisteredUsers
parameter.description: This parameter enables the denial of calls from unregistered users.

parameter.name: disallowHoldingEmergencyCall
parameter.description: This parameter enables users to place emergency calls on hold.

parameter.name: enableMinRegistrationExpiration
parameter.description: This parameter enables ("true") and disables ("false") a minimum registration interval for the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP).

parameter.name: enforceMinRegistrationExpiration
parameter.description: This parameter returns a Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) 423 message response when a REGISTER message is received with an Expires value less than the [[minRegistrationTimeInSeconds]] attribute when the parameter is set to "true".

parameter.name: maxRegistrationExpirationInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum time (in seconds) during which a Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) phone can register its location. Requests for longer registration times are truncated to this time.

parameter.name: minRegistrationExpirationInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minimum interval at which registrations are written to the database. To avoid loss of service, the [[extensionTimeInSeconds]] attribute has doubled the value of this attribute.

parameter.name: registrationExtension
parameter.description: This parameter specifies an extension to the time the Execution Server honors registrations.

parameter.name: registrationPostUpgradeExtension
parameter.description: This parameter specifies an extension to the time the Execution Server honors registrations after an upgrade. It also applies after a fresh install in cases when a previously backed-up database is restored or when subscriber configuration occurs within the time interval determined by this attribute.

parameter.name: subscriptionMaxExpirationInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum expiration time in seconds for the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) subscription event.

parameter.name: supportAnswerAfter
parameter.description: This parameter enables support after an answer. When this parameter value is set to "false", an answer-after parameter is not sent. When this parameter value is set to "true", Client Application Protocol (CAP) initiated Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) INVITES are sent out with an [[answer-after=0]] parameter.

parameter.name: supportForkingProxies
parameter.description: This parameter enables ("true") and disables ("false") forking proxy behavior for the access-side of the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) interface.

parameter.name: supportXFeatureControl
parameter.description: This parameter lets the Execution Server determine whether whether it sends the X-FeatureControl header in Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) INVITE messages. When this parameter value is set to "true", the X-FeatureControl header is inserted if the FAC programming result is known. When this parameter value is set to "false", the X-FeatureControl header is not inserted.

context.name: Contact
context.description: This level is used to view and modify attributes related to the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Access Contact header configuration.

command.name: get
command.description: Use this command is view attributes related to the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Access Contact header configuration.

command.name: set
command.description: Use this command is to modify attributes related to the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) access Contact header configuration.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the CONTACT host portion of Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) messages.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port. This parameter must be set to "nil" (blank) to ensure the access device does a Service Locator (SRV) record lookup on the contact host.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) attributes related to Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) access Contact header configuration.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: Proxy
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) proxy-related system attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) proxy-related system attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) proxy-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the host/Internet Protocol (IP) address. Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) access proxy is only used to indicate an alternate source from which it is acceptable to receive messages from an access device when Access Control List (ACL) is enabled. Its use has no impact on how BroadWorks processes outbound messages.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port associated with the [[accessProxyHost]]. The Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) access proxy is only used to indicate an alternate source from which it is acceptable to receive messages from an access device when the Access Control List (ACL) is enabled. Its use has no impact on how BroadWorks processes outbound messages.

parameter.name: transportProtocol
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the transport associated with the [[accessProxyHost]].

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) proxy-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute to clear.

context.name: Via
context.description: This level is used to view and modify attributes related to Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Via configuration on the access-side.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view attributes related to Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Via configuration on the access-side.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify attributes related to Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Via configuration on the access-side.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) Address or hostname of the location on this Execution Server where access-side devices send responses. It is included within the Via sent-by field of the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) requests sent towards access-side devices. If this parameter is empty, the parameter publicIPAddress is used. If it is not set, the ipAddress from the resolving "localhost" is used.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) attributes related to Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Via configuration on the access-side.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute to clear.

context.name: AlertingInfo
context.description: This level is used to view and modify system attributes related to the''Alert-Info''Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) header.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view system attributes related to the ''Alert-Info'' Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) header.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify system attributes related to the ''Alert-Info'' Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) header.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: priority0
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ''Alert-Info'' header when the call priority is set to "0". When this value is empty or nil, then the ''Alert-Info'' header is not sent in the INVITE message.

parameter.name: priority1
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ''Alert-Info'' header when the call priority is set to "1". When this value is empty, the ''Alert-Info'' header is not sent in the INVITE message.

parameter.name: priority2
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ''Alert-Info'' header when the call priority is set to "2". When this value is empty, the ''Alert-Info'' header is not sent in the INVITE message.

parameter.name: priority3
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ''Alert-Info'' header when the call priority is set to "3". When this value is empty, the ''Alert-Info'' header is not sent in the INVITE message.

parameter.name: priority4
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ''Alert-Info'' header when the call priority is set to "4". When this value is empty, the ''Alert-Info'' header is not sent in the INVITE message.

parameter.name: priority5
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ''Alert-Info'' header when the call priority is set to "5". When this value is empty, the ''Alert-Info'' header is not sent in the INVITE message.

parameter.name: priority6
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ''Alert-Info'' header when the call priority is set to "6". When this value is empty, the ''Alert-Info'' header is not sent in the INVITE message.

parameter.name: priority7
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ''Alert-Info'' header when the call priority is set to "7". When this value is empty, the ''Alert-Info'' header is not sent in the INVITE message.

parameter.name: ringSplash
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ''Alert-Info'' header when processing a ring splash. When this value is empty, the ''Alert-Info'' header is not sent in the INVITE message.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) system attributes related to the ''Alert-Info'' Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) header.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute to clear.

context.name: ContentType
context.description: This level is used to view, modify, add, and delete content types supported by the BroadWorks Execution Server SIP interface.

command.name: get

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Content Type-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enableAcceptHeaderTransparency
parameter.description: This parameter enables header transparency. It indicates whether a content type entry should be allowed from the access, network, or both access and network-side interfaces.

context.description: This level is used to manage Content-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Content-related attributes.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a new Content entry.

parameter.name: contentType
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the content type.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether the content type entry is allowed from the access, network, or both access and network-side interfaces.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to change the supported Interface attribute for a supported Content type list entry.

parameter.name: contentType
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the content type.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether the content type entry is allowed from the access, network, or both access and network-side interfaces.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing Content entry.

parameter.name: contentType
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the content type.

context.name: MediaServer
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) attributes for Media Servers.

context.name: Contact
context.description: This level is used to view and modify attributes related to SIP media server Contact header configuration.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to display attributes related to SIP media server Contact header configuration.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify attributes related to SIP media server Contact header configuration.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: The parameter specifies the host. It is used to populate the contact host portion of SIP messages. This parameter is included within ''Contact'' headers of SIP messages sent towards Media Servers. If it is not set and the private IP address and public IP address are set, the private IP address is used. If only the public IP address is set, it is used. Otherwise, the IP address from resolving "localhost" is used.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the contact port sent to the Media Server. This parameter must be set to "nil" to ensure the network device does a Service Locator (SRV) record lookup on the contact host.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear attributes related to SIP media server Contact header configuration.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to clear.

context.name: Via
context.description: This level is used to manage attributes related to SIP Via configuration on the media server side.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to display attributes related to SIP Via configuration on the media server side.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify attributes related to SIP Via configuration on the media server side.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address or host name indicating the location on this Execution Server where Media Servers should send responses. It is included within the ''Via sent-by'' field of the SIP requests sent towards Media Servers. If this parameter is not set and private IP address and public IP address are set, private IP address is used. If only public IP address is set, it is used. Otherwise, the IP address from the resolving "localhost" is used.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear attributes related to SIP Via configuration on the media server side.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute to clear.

context.name: Network
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Network-related system attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Network-related system attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Network-related system attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: allowBroadWorksConferenceInfo
parameter.description: This parameter enables Session Interface (SIP) INFO messages with an application/x-broadworks-conference-info+xml body.

parameter.name: callingPartyE164Normalization
parameter.description: This parameter specifies how the Execution Server normalizes the calling party's CLID (Calling Line Identity) for network originators. When this parameter value is set to "None", the calling party's CLID for a network originator is never normalized to the E.164 format. When this parameter value is set to "SystemCountryCode", the calling party's CLID for a network originator is normalized to E.164 using the system country code. When this parameter value is set to "CalledCountryCode", the calling party's CLID for a network originator is normalized to E.164 using the called country code for the INVITE when the CLID is considered a phone number but is not already in E.164 format. The called country code is the country code for the called address.

parameter.name: chargeHeaderFormat
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the type of Charge header to use.

parameter.name: destinationTrunkGroupFormat
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the destination trunk group format. When this parameter value is set to "DTG", the Execution Server sends the destination trunk group information in the outgoing INVITE as the [[dtg]] parameter of the request-URI. When this parameter value is set to "X-Nortel-Profile", an ''X-Nortel-Profile'' header is added to carry the destination trunk group information in the outgoing SIP INVITE sent towards the network. When this parameter value is set to ''[[tgrpInRequestURI]]'', the destination trunk group information is passed in the outgoing INVITE as the [[tgrp]] and [[trunk-context]] parameters in the user portion of the request-URI. When this parameter value is set to ''[[TgrpInContact]]'', the destination trunk group information is passed in the outgoing INVITE as the [[tgrp]] and [[trunk-context]] parameters in the user portion of the ''Contact'' header URI.

parameter.name: encryptXBroadWorksDNCHeader
parameter.description: This parameter enables the encryption of the X-BroadWorks -DNC header when included in Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) messages when the value is set to "true".

parameter.name: originatingTrunkGroupFormat
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the originating trunk group format. When this parameter value is set to "OTG", the Execution Server sends the originating trunk group in the From header as a Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) URI parameter. When this parameter value is set to "X-Nortel-Profile", the Execution Server sends the originating trunk group in the X-Nortel-Profile header.

parameter.name: privateDialPlanOriginatorUsesExtension
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether 302 responses to SIP INVITES include either an extension or a phone number (or E.164 number). When this parameter value is set to "false", any Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) INVITES received with the private dialing plan context set (and it is not an intra-group call) have the originating identification normalized to an E.164 number. Any 302 responses received with the private dialing plan context set causes the resulting SIP INVITE to be sent out with an extension phone number or E.164 number. When this parameter value is set to "true", any SIP INVITES received with the private dialing plan context set use an extension for the originator identification instead of normalizing the originator identification to an E.164 number if the originator identification is a phone number. Any 302 responses received with the private dialing plan context set causes the resulting SIP INVITE to be sent out with an extension instead of a phone number or E.164 number.

parameter.name: requiresBroadWorksDigitCollection
parameter.description: This parameter enables digit collection when it is set to "true".

parameter.name: sendCallerNameInfo
parameter.description: This parameter enables ("true") and disables ("false") the sending of caller name information in network calls.

parameter.name: sendCarrierSelection
parameter.description: This parameter controls carrier selection. When this parameter value is set to "true", the Execution Server sends in outgoing Invite messages to the caller's preferred Carrier Identification Codes (CICs) for intra-LATA (cic2), inter-LATA (cic1), and international calls (cic3). It also selects the carrier to be used based on the type of the call.

parameter.name: sendDialedCAC
parameter.description: This parameter lets the Execution Server determine to send the dialed casual dial prefix and carrier code in the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) INVITE requests to the Network Server.

parameter.name: sendXBroadWorksDNCHeader
parameter.description: This parameter enables ("true") and disables ("false") the inclusion of the X-BroadWorks -DNC header in Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) messages.

parameter.name: supportForkingProxies
parameter.description: This parameter enables support for forking proxies. When this parameter value is set to "false", it disables the forking proxy behavior for the network-side of the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) interface.

parameter.name: supportInviteWithoutSDP
parameter.description: This parameter provides support for the network-side INVITE requests without Session Definition Protocol (SDP) and the Execution Server allows INVITE requests to terminate to the network-side without an SDP. When this parameter value is set to "false", the network-side does not support INVITE requests without SDP and the Execution Server includes the fake SDP in INVITE requests that do not have a SDP. In this case, the Execution Server re-INVITEs the network endpoint immediately upon receiving the 200 OK response to ensure that the network endpoint provides a valid offer SDP.

parameter.name: supportVideo
parameter.description: This parameter enables ("true") and disables ("false") network-side video support.

parameter.name: useHistoryInfoHeader
parameter.description: This parameter enables ("true") and disables ("false") the use of the ''History Info'' header on the network-side.

parameter.name: xBroadWorksDNCHeaderKey
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the private encryption key that is used for encrypting the X-BroadWorks-DNC header in Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) messages.

context.name: Contact
context.description: This level is used to view and modify attributes related to Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) network''Contact''header configuration.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view attributes related to Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) network ''Contact'' header configuration.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify attributes related to Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) network ''Contact'' header configuration.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the CONTACT host portion of Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) messages.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the network contact port. This parameter must be set to "nil" (that is, blank) to ensure the network device executes a Service Locator (SRV) record lookup on the contact host.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) attributes related to SIP network ''Contact'' header configuration.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to clear.

context.name: Proxy

command.name: get

command.name: set

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the network address. It indicates that network-bound Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) INVITE messages leaving BroadWorks should be sent to the specified location if its value is not an empty string.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port to send the specified location network-bound Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) INVITE messages leaving BroadWorks.

parameter.name: transportProtocol
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the transport to use for sending to the specified location network-bound Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) INVITE messages leaving BroadWorks.

command.name: clear
command.description: Use this command clear (set to no value) Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Proxy-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute to clear.

context.name: Via
context.description: This level is used to view and modify attributes related to Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Via configuration on the network-side.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view attributes related to Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Via configuration on the network-side.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to view attributes related to Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Via configuration on the network-side.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address or hostname indicating the location where network-side devices send responses. If this parameter is empty and both the privateIPAddress and publicIPAddress are set, the privateIPAddress is used. If only the publicIPAddress is set, it is used. Otherwise, the ipAddress from the resolving "localhost" is used.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) attributes related to Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Via configuration on the network-side.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute to clear.

context.name: SDP

command.name: set

parameter.name: broadWorksHoldingSDPMethod
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the holding Session Description Protocol (SDP) method system wide.

parameter.name: broadWorksHoldingSDPNetAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a dummy address to use to build a modified address using the Session Description Protocol (SDP) method.

parameter.name: broadworksHoldingSDPIPv6NetAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a dummy IPv6 address to use when building a modified address using the Session Description Protocol (SDP) method.

parameter.name: useStrictRFC3264Compliance
parameter.description: This parameter enables strict compliance with RFC 3264 for Session Description Protocol (SDP) offer/answer when the value is set to "true".

parameter.name: disableSDPChangesForAnswerResponses
parameter.description: This parameter enables ("true") or disables ("false) Session Description Protocol (SDP) changes for answer responses.

parameter.name: forceAnswerSDPOnAnswer
parameter.description: This parameter provides the ability to send the SDP in the generated 200 OK message when no SDP is received in the 200 OK final response by the Execution Server when the value is set to "true".

command.name: clear
