context.name: SNMP
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) agent.

context.name: AccessList
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the list of entries in the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) access list.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the nodes that currently can access the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) agent.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a node to the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) access list. To obtain performance measurements, the SNMP manager must have access to the individual nodes in the network. The SNMP manager Internet Protocol (IP) address is used by the agent to identify managers that are granted access.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of an external Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) manager.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove a node from the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) access list. When the node is removed from the access list, it is longer able to obtain performance measurements from the SNMP Agent. The node's IP address is used to identify the manager.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of an external Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) manager.

context.name: Agent
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the current Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent settings, modify the listening port, modify the read community string, or modify the write community string. You can set the source address that is used to send traps, which supports configurations whereby a server can have multiple network interfaces, including a dedicated maintenance/management interface.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the current Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port used to communicate to the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent.

parameter.name: encoding
parameter.description: This parameter controls whether ISO-8859-1 or UTF-8 (Unicode) encoding is used by the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent to send traps.

parameter.name: readCommunity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the read community string used to access the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent.

parameter.name: writeCommunity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the write community string used to access the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent.

parameter.name: trapCommunity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the trap community string used by the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent when sending SNMP Traps.

parameter.name: trapSourceAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the trap source for the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: disableV2
parameter.description: This parameter is used to disable Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) v2.

context.name: JVMStatsCollector
context.description: This level is used to configure the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector settings.

context.name: GeneralSettings
context.description: This level is used to configure the general settings of the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the general settings of the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector.

command.name: set
command.description: The command is used to modify the general settings of the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter enables or disables data collection for JVM statistics.

parameter.name: statisticsRefreshPeriod
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the frequency at which BroadWorks fetches PMs from JVM Mbeans.

context.name: HeapUsageThreshold
context.description: This level is used to configure the heap usage threshold settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the heap usage threshold settings.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the heap usage threshold settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether a threshold is active.

parameter.name: armValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a value for enabling a threshold crossing.

parameter.name: resetValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a value for clearing a threshold crossing.

context.name: NonHeapUsageThreshold
context.description: This level is used to configure the non-heap usage threshold settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the non-heap usage threshold settings.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the non-heap usage threshold settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether a threshold is active.

parameter.name: armValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a value for enabling a threshold crossing.

parameter.name: resetValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a value for clearing a threshold crossing.

context.name: Logging
context.description: This level is used to view and modify logging for the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view logging-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify logging-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the attribute to be modified.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the logging on and off.

parameter.name: severity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the default logging severity level.

parameter.name: priority
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the priority of the logging thread. The value "1" indicates the lowest priority and "5" indicates the highest.

parameter.name: maxQueueSize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum size of the logging queue.

parameter.name: showThreadName
parameter.description: This parameter enables thread name logging.

context.name: InputChannels
context.description: This level is used to view, modify, or clear input channels entries.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view input channels-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify input channels-related attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the logging input channel.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the logging to the logging input channel on and off.

parameter.name: severity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the severity level of the logging input channel.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear input channels-related attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the logging input channel.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to clear.

context.name: OutputChannels
context.description: This level is used to view, modify, or clear output channels.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view output channels-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify output channels-related attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the logging output channel.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the logging to the logging output channel on and off.

parameter.name: directory
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the directory where the log files are located.

parameter.name: filePrefix
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the prefix of the log files.

parameter.name: fileSizeInMB
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum size of a log file.

parameter.name: numberOfFiles
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of log files that exist before the old log files are deleted.

context.name: Reporting
context.description: This level is used to view and configure the attributes related to the automated performance measurement (PM) reporting over the SNMP feature.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Performance Measurement (PM) reporting-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Performance Measurement (PM) reporting attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: active
parameter.description: If true, enables automated PM reporting.

parameter.name: intervalMin
parameter.description: PM reporting frequency in minutes.

parameter.name: resetCounters
parameter.description: If true, automatically resets all counters after generating a report.

command.name: generateReport
command.description: This command is used to generate a Performance Measurement (PM) report and send it to remote File Transfer Protocol (FTP) servers. This command does not reset counters (even when resetCounters is enabled).

context.name: FTP
context.description: The File Transfer Protocol (FTP) level is used to view and modify the target FTP servers for Performance Measurement (PM) reporting.

command.name: get
command.description: Use this command to view File Transfer Protocol (FTP) server-related attributes.

command.name: add
command.description: Use this command to add a File Transfer Protocol (FTP) server.

parameter.name: hostname
parameter.description: The IP address, host name, or domain of a target FTP server to be deleted.

parameter.name: userid
parameter.description: User ID to use when logging in to the target FTP server.

parameter.name: usePassiveMode
parameter.description: Use FTP passive mode when connecting to the remote FTP server.

command.name: set
command.description: Use this command to modify the information associated with the File Transfer Protocol (FTP) server.

parameter.name: hostname
parameter.description: The IP address, host name, or domain of a target FTP server to be deleted.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: usePassiveMode
parameter.description: Use FTP passive mode when connecting to the remote FTP server.

command.name: delete
command.description: Use this command to delete an existing File Transfer Protocol (FTP) serve.

parameter.name: hostname
parameter.description: The IP address, host name, or domain of a target FTP server to be deleted.

context.name: SMAP
context.description: This level is used to view, add, modify, and delete Software Management Application Protocol (SMAP)-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Software Management Application Protocol (SMAP)-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Software Management Application Protocol (SMAP)-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the length of time that the agent waits for a server's response to its requests (in seconds).

context.name: BCCT
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Software Management Application Protocol (SMAP) BroadWorks Common Communication Transport (BCCT)-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Software Management Application Protocol (SMAP) BroadWorks Common Communication Transport (BCCT)-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Software Management Application Protocol (SMAP) BroadWorks Common Communication Transport (BCCT)-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number for the Software Management Application Protocol (SMAP) BroadWorks Common Communication Transport (BCCT) Channel.

context.name: TrapTable
context.description: This level is used to view and modify entries in the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) trap table.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view information in the current Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) trap table, such as the IP address of the machine the BroadWorks server is sending traps to and the corresponding port.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a node to the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) trap table. To send traps, the BroadWorks server must be able to identify the node where traps are sent. This is usually a machine designated as the central point for monitoring. The node's IP address and port are used to identify the node.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the node.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port of the node.

parameter.name: model
parameter.description: This parameter determines how Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) traps are sent. When the value is set to "shared", the SNMP Agent wraps every trap in an envelope with the same name. The recipient can receive three different types of envelopes: a notification, an alarm, or a software error. The content of the envelope provides an explanation of the source of the problem. When the value is set to "unique", the SNMP Agent sends every instance of a notification in a different envelope. Each of these uniquely identifies the problem without having to open the envelope.

parameter.name: useAlarms
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the system sends pairs of notifications or alarms. This is a backward-compatibility flag.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify an entry in the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) trap table.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the node.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port of the node.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: model
parameter.description: This parameter determines how Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) traps are sent. When the value is set to "shared", the SNMP Agent wraps every trap in an envelope with the same name. The recipient can receive three different types of envelopes: a notification, an alarm, or a software error. The content of the envelope provides an explanation of the source of the problem. When the value is set to "unique", the SNMP Agent sends every instance of a notification in a different envelope. Each of these uniquely identifies the problem without having to open the envelope.

parameter.name: useAlarms
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the system sends pairs of notifications or alarms. This is a backward-compatibility flag.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove a node from the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) trap table. Nodes removed from the SNMP trap table are no longer sent traps. The node's IP address and port are used to identify the node.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the node.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port of the node.

context.name: V3AccessControl
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 Access Control level.

context.name: Groups
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 groups.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 groups-related attributes.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 groups.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the group.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) v3 group.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the group.

context.name: AccessLevels
context.description: This level is used to view and modify levels of access for the group.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 group access levels.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the group.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 access levels to a group.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the group.

parameter.name: level
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a level of access for the group. When the value is set to "all", complete access is provided; when the value is set to "management", access to the managed objects is provided; when the value is set to "performance", access to the performance measurements is provided.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 access levels from a group.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the group.

parameter.name: level
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a level of access for the group. When the value is set to "all", complete access is provided; when the value is set to "management", access to the managed objects is provided; when the value is set to "performance", access to the performance measurements is provided.

context.name: V3Users
context.description: This level is used to view, add, modify, delete and clear the V3 User level attributes. The V3 User level provides support for the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) version 3 (SNMPv3). The primary feature of SNMPv3 is additional security. The only security feature in SNMPv2 is the support of community strings (that can be viewed as a simple password with no user name). SNMPv3 supports multiple user name/password pairs, as well as encryption. System administrators are able to configure the version of SNMP that BroadWorks should support (v2 or v3), as well as parameters specific to each version. View-based Access Control Model (VACM) is supported with three predefined views: all, management and performance. It is configurable through the V3 user group attribute and the V3AccessControl level.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 user-related attributes.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 user.

parameter.name: user
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the SNMP v3 user ID. It is required to perform SNMP v3 access to the server.

parameter.name: read
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether this user is authorized for read access.

parameter.name: write
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether this user is authorized for write access.

parameter.name: security
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the security implemented for this Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) v3 user.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: authenticationKey
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user authentication key.

parameter.name: privacyKey
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the privacy key used for encryption.

parameter.name: group
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) v3 group name.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 user-related attributes.

parameter.name: user
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the SNMP v3 user ID. It is required to perform SNMP v3 access to the server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: read
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether this user is authorized for read access.

parameter.name: write
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether this user is authorized for write access.

parameter.name: security
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the security implemented for this Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) v3 user.

parameter.name: authenticationKey
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user authentication key.

parameter.name: privacyKey
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the privacy key used for encryption.

parameter.name: group
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) v3 group name.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) v3 user.

parameter.name: user
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the SNMP v3 user ID. It is required to perform SNMP v3 access to the server.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 user-related attributes.

parameter.name: user
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the SNMP v3 user ID. It is required to perform SNMP v3 access to the server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute to clear.

context.name: SOAP
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the current Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) configuration.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: perQueryTimeout
parameter.description: This parameter defines the timeout value (in seconds) for each SOAP query.

parameter.name: minNumberOfThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minimum number of SOAP threads.

parameter.name: maxNumberOfThreads
parameter.description: TThis parameter specifies the maximum number of SOAP threads.

context.name: System
context.description: This level is used to configure and report on information related to routing and translations, devices accessed by the Execution Server, call processing, emergency numbers, long duration call accounting events, digit collection, network progression, queue statistics, routing and treatments, session audits, and device inventory.

context.name: Alias
context.description: The BroadSoft Execution Server identifies itself by multiple network addresses. The alias feature allows a system administrator to configure these Internet IP addresses and aliases for the Execution Server. These addresses are used during call processing to determine if an incoming address matches one of the server aliases. For example, a SIP REGISTER message or INVITE message contains IP addresses or host names that must be looked up to determine if the address is one of the Execution Server aliases.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view a list of all the configured Execution Server aliases in alphabetical order.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a new IP address or host name to the list of Execution Server aliases.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the alternative Internet address of the Execution Server.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a previously configured Execution Server alias.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the alternative Internet address of the Execution Server.

context.name: CallP
context.description: This level is used to view, add, modify, or delete information related to call processing.

context.name: AccessRouting
context.description: This level is used to view and modify call processing attributes of access devices.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the attributes related to call routing on the access-side.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the attributes related to call routing on the access-side.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enableTerminationAttemptTimeout
parameter.description: This parameter controls the termination attempt timer. When this parameter value is set to "false", the termination attempt (to an unresponsive access device) times out according to the underlying protocol-specific timers (Session Initiation Protocol [SIP]/Media Gateway Control Protocol [MGCP]). When this parameter value is set to "true", the termination attempt (to an access device) times out according to the value indicated by the [[terminationAttemptTimeoutSeconds]] variable.

parameter.name: terminationAttemptTimeoutInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time (in seconds) before the termination attempt to an access device times out.

context.name: DNS
context.description: This level is used to view, add, modify, and delete DNS entries.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Domain Name Server (DNS)-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the call processing system attributes related to Domain Name Server (DNS).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enableNameLookupForURLDialing
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether the Execution Server performs name lookups for the network URL domain dialing.

parameter.name: enableNameLookupTimeout
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether the Execution Server uses the name lookup timeout in the context of the call processing thread.

parameter.name: nameLookupTimeoutMilliseconds
parameter.description: This parameter determines the name lookup timeout value.

context.name: DTMFTransmission
context.description: This level is used to determine how the DTMF is sent over an active media stream.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Dual-Tone Multi-Frequency Transmission (DTMF)-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Dual-Tone Multi-Frequency Transmission (DTMF)-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: transmissionMethod
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the client Dual-Tone Multi-Frequency (DTMF) transmission method.

parameter.name: signalingContentType
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the content type for the signaling transmission method.

context.name: ExpensiveCalls
context.description: The service provides an audio notification to users making a call that carries a particular Network Server alternate call indicator (NS ACI), which corresponds to an expensive call. Upon originating a call, if the Network ACI for that call corresponds to an ACI configured by this Expensive Call Notification service to identify an expensive call, the user is provided with a warning announcement stating that the call is expensive, and the user can release the call to avoid the charge before the call proceeds. If the network ACI does not identify an expensive call by this Expensive Call Notification service, the call is routed as usual. If the user does not release the call before the end of the announcement, the call is routed as usual. The carrier can record a silence that follows the notification announcement, or repeat the announcement to provide a grace period for the user to release the call-all in the same announcement file. The service, itself, does not provide this grace period explicitly. This level is used to manage Expensive Call-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view expensive calls-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify expensive calls-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enablePostAnnouncementDelay
parameter.description: This parameter enables ("true") or disables ("false") the post announcement delay timer. The delay gives the user more time to release the call.

parameter.name: postAnnouncementDelay
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the value of the post-announcement delay, after which the call proceeds and the user is charged for it.

context.name: AlternateCallIndicators
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the expensive alternate call indicators.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the expensive alternate call indicators.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add an expensive Alternate Call Indicator (ACI) entry.

parameter.name: alternateCallIndicator
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the alternate call indicator (ACI) used by the Execution Server to verify whether a call is an expensive call. The value has to match an Alternate Call Indicator (ACI) on the Network Server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to add through the add command.

parameter.name: treatmentAudioFile
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the audio file that is played as announcement for an Expensive Call Notification when the call maps to this Alternate Call Indicator. This file name must be relative to the localized system prompts directory, where current system-defined audio treatments are located (that is, files must be copied to that directory). The file must be in one of the following formats: .wav, uLaw, 8kHz, or 8 bit.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify expensive Alternate Call Indicators (ACIs).

parameter.name: alternateCallIndicator
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the alternate call indicator (ACI) used by the Execution Server to verify whether a call is an expensive call. The value has to match an Alternate Call Indicator (ACI) on the Network Server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: treatmentAudioFile
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the audio file that is played as announcement for an Expensive Call Notification when the call maps to this Alternate Call Indicator. This file name must be relative to the localized system prompts directory, where current system-defined audio treatments are located (that is, files must be copied to that directory). The file must be in one of the following formats: .wav, uLaw, 8kHz, or 8 bit.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an expensive Alternate Call Indicator (ACI) entry.

parameter.name: alternateCallIndicator
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the alternate call indicator (ACI) used by the Execution Server to verify whether a call is an expensive call. The value has to match an Alternate Call Indicator (ACI) on the Network Server.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) expensive Alternate Call Indicator (ACI)-related attributes.

parameter.name: alternateCallIndicator
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the alternate call indicator (ACI) used by the Execution Server to verify whether a call is an expensive call. The value has to match an Alternate Call Indicator (ACI) on the Network Server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: ExternalEmergencyRouting
context.description: This level is used to view and modify external emergency routing-related attributes. Activation of the External Emergency Routing service causes the Execution Server to launch a query to the Emergency Server (EN) to obtain a routable emergency number. This service, which is enabled at the system level, has the address of the EN server configured as a fully qualified domain name (FQDN). The Execution Server accesses the EN server cluster via a DNS query and selects a specific EN server from the ordered list of servers returned by the DNS. If there is no reply from the EN server, the Execution Server falls back to the default routing for the emergency call. A default emergency routing number is configured on a system-wide basis. In the absence of a routing number obtained from the EN server, the emergency call is routed to the default emergency number.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view External Emergency Routing-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify External Emergency Routing-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the external emergency routing server on and off.

parameter.name: serviceURI
parameter.description: This parameter specifies an Internet Protocol (IP) address, host, or domain for available Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) servers.

parameter.name: supportsDNSSRV
parameter.description: This parameter provides support for a Domain Name Server (DNS) Service Locator (SRV) query. When this parameter set to "true", the DNS SRV query takes precedence over the DNS A query in the default DNS/SOAP query operation sequence.

parameter.name: connectionTimeoutInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time (in seconds) before the emergency number server times out. If the server times out, the next emergency number server that has been returned by Domain Name Server (DNS) query is attempted.

parameter.name: defaultEmergencyNumber
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the default emergency number.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) External Emergency Routing-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: GETS
context.description: This level is used to view and modify GETS-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view GETS-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify GETS-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter controls whether GETS is enabled on the system.

parameter.name: enableRequireResourcePriority
parameter.description: This parameter controls whether the outgoing first SIP INVITE request contains a Require header with the resource-priority option tag.

parameter.name: priorityAVP
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Diameter Session-Priority Attribute Value Pair (AVP) value.

parameter.name: signalingDSCP
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the signaling DSCP value used for GETS SIP traffic.

parameter.name: sipUdpPort
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the From port for outgoing GETS SIP UDP signaling.

parameter.name: sipTcpPort
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the From port for outgoing GETS SIP TCP signaling.

parameter.name: errorEtsX
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the provisioned ets.x value used in the Resource-Priority SIP header for some GETS error scenarios.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) GETS-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: ResourcePriorities
context.description: This level is used to view, add, and delete resource priorities values.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view resource priorities values.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a resource priority value.

parameter.name: priorityValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies one recognized Resource-Priority r-value, made of a namespace, a dot, and a priority value, as per RFC 4412. Examples are 'ets.2' and 'dsn.flash'. Values are case-insensitive.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a resource priority value.

parameter.name: priorityValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies one recognized Resource-Priority r-value, made of a namespace, a dot, and a priority value, as per RFC 4412. Examples are 'ets.2' and 'dsn.flash'. Values are case-insensitive.

context.name: IMRN
context.description: This level is used to view the Intermediate Routing Number (IMRN)-related attributes.

context.name: Dn
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Intermediate Routing Number (IMRN) Directory Number (DN)-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Intermediate Routing Number (IMRN) Directory Number (DN)-related attributes.

command.name: add

parameter.name: dn

command.name: delete

parameter.name: dn
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the E.164 DN.

context.name: NetProgression
context.description: This level is used to configure the network progression service. NetProgression is an originating call timer used for PRI interworking. If a progress message is not received before the netProgression times out, the originating call sends a progress message. This ensures that the originating PRI gateway does not tear down the call. The netProgression timer is used for interoperability with SIP PRI gateways that do not allow configuration with the ISDN T310 timer. The T310 timer tears down a call that has been in the call proceeding state longer than the T310 timer. The T310 timer is cleared when the call exits the call proceeding state, typically when the call moves to the alerting, connect, or progress state. In general, when the PRI gateway or soft switch supports configuration of the T310 timer, the T310 timer on the gateway or soft switch should be adjusted to an appropriate value based on the network that the gateway or soft switch is deployed in, rather than using the netProgression timer on BroadWorks. The purpose of the netProgression timer is to cancel the T310 timer for gateways or soft switches that do not allow configuration of the T310 timer.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Network Progression-related attributes. For example, attributes such as whether network progression is active or the wait period before sending a message.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Network Progression-related attributes. For example, attributes such as whether network progression is active or the wait period before sending a message.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the network progression on and off.

parameter.name: waitPeriod
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of seconds before the service sends a 180 (Ringing) back to the originating Public Switched Telephone Network (PSTN) gateway to pacify it to keep it from terminating the connection.

context.name: Routing
context.description: This level is used to view and modify routes. Routes are small areas such as a building or a small geographic area. A route is comprised of network devices (an IP address, host name, or domain) that serve the area for calls outgoing to the public network.

context.name: MediaServerSelection
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Media Server Selection (MSS)-related attributes, such as whether MSS is active, the local and remote ports, the maximum number of retransmissions allowed, and the retransmission delay time.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Media Server Selection (MSS)-related attributes, such as whether MSS is active, the local and remote ports, the maximum number of retransmissions allowed, and the retransmission delay time.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Media Server Selection (MSS)-related attributes, such as whether MSS is active, the local and remote ports, the maximum number of retransmissions allowed, and the retransmission delay time.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: mediaServerSelectionRouteTimer
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time (in milliseconds) the Execution Server waits before advancing to the next Network Server during Media Server selection, or before advancing to the next Media Server when processing an initial connection message. This value is only used if the [[useStaticMediaServerDevice]] value is set to "false".

parameter.name: mediaServerResponseTimer
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time (in milliseconds) the Execution Server waits before declaring that the Media Server has stopped responding. When this timer expires, the call is dropped and a [[bwMediaServerNotResponding]] alarm is raised.

parameter.name: useStaticMediaServerDevice
parameter.description: This parameter controls the use of the static Media Server device. If the parameter is set to "true", the Media Server(s) is statically configured on the Execution Server. If the parameter is set to "false", a query is made to the Network Server

context.name: MediaServerDevice
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Internet Protocol (IP) address, port, and description of active Media Servers. The BroadWorks Media Server provides specialized media resources, interactive voice response, and conferencing capabilities. The Execution Server keeps a list of Media Servers associated with that Execution Server so it does not have to query the Network Server every time it needs a Media Server. The relationship between Application Servers and Media Servers is many-to-many.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Internet Protocol (IP) address, port, and description of active Media Servers.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a new Media Server.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address, host name, or domain name of the Media Server.

parameter.name: transportProtocol
parameter.description: This parameter specifies which transport type is used by this server. When the value is set to "Unspecified", either protocol is allowed.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port of the Media Server.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the description of the Media Server.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify a Media Server.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address, host name, or domain name of the Media Server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port of the Media Server.

parameter.name: transportProtocol
parameter.description: This parameter specifies which transport type is used by this server. When the value is set to "Unspecified", either protocol is allowed.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the description of the Media Server.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a Media Server.

command.name: clear

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address, host name, or domain name of the Media Server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: RouteParms
context.description: This level is used to view and modify network routing attributes. The Network Routing Service attributes are routeTimerLength and routeRoundRobin. The routeTimerLength is the timer used to determine if the Network Routing Service should route advance to the next device in the Route. The timer is configurable from 1 to 25 seconds with a default of 1 second. The Network Routing Service considers a device route successful upon receipt of a 1XX (including a 100 Trying) message from the device over the SIP interface. The enableRoundRobin attribute is used by the Network Routing Service to determine the routing algorithm to use upon route advancing to the next device in the Route. When enableRoundRobin is false, the Network Routing Service performs sequential device route advancing and always starts with the first device in the Route. Subsequent routes are tried sequentially, in order of their appearance in the Route, until a successful device route is obtained. When enableRoundRobin is true, the Network Routing Service remembers the last successful device route and starts the Route, using the device immediately following the last successful device route in the Route. If the last successful device route was the last device in the Route, the Network Routing Service then uses the first device in the Route to attempt to route the call. Route Advancing proceeds sequentially, in order of their appearance in the Route, until a successful device route is obtained. The hostname Usage parameter indicates how BroadWorks should interpret the meaning hostnames with multiple IP addresses. The possible values are standard, loadbalanced, or stateful. Standard indicates that the DNS query ordering reflects the preferred order. Loadbalanced indicates that the results from the DNS query should be randomized. Stateful indicates that the DNS query ordering is prioritized; however upon successfully reaching an IP address associated with a hostname, it should be used until it fails or reaches statefulExpiration. Resetting the hostname Usage value automatically clears the stateful hostname to IP address mappings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view routing parameter-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify routing parameter-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: routeTimer
parameter.description: This parameter specifies when the Network Routing service should advance to the next device in the Route.

parameter.name: dnsResolvedAddressSelectionPolicy
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the resolved Address Selection policy. When this parameter value is set to "Standard", the Domain Name Server (DNS) query ordering reflects the preferred order. When this parameter value is set to "Loadbalanced", the result from the DNS query is randomized. When this parameter value is set to "Stateful", the DNS query ordering is prioritized.

parameter.name: statefulExpiration
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of minutes that stateful [[hostnameUsage]] is maintained once successful.

parameter.name: maxAddressesPerHostname
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of addresses from a Domain Name Server (DNS) query.

parameter.name: maxAddressesDuringSetup
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of addresses that the Network Routing service tries during a call setup.

context.name: SCC
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Service Centralization Continuity (SCC)-related attributes.

context.name: ServiceCodes

command.name: get

At least one of the parameters defined in the multiple choice attribute needs to be specified to search all service codes. The Service Code and its description are used as search criteria. If the search produces over 1,000 entries, an error message appears indicating you should refine your search criteria to narrow the search.

command.name: add

parameter.name: serviceCode

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: description

command.name: delete

parameter.description: This parameter specifies the service code to add.

context.name: SessionAudit
context.description: This level is used to view and modify session audit-related attributes, such as whether session audit is active or not, the audit period, and the audit timeout period.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view session audit-related attributes, such as whether session audit is active or not, the audit period, and the audit timeout period.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify session audit-related attributes, such as whether session audit is active or not, the audit period, and the audit timeout period.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the audits on and off.

parameter.name: auditIntervalInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time a call is up before the system checks to see whether it still exists (in seconds).

parameter.name: auditTimeoutInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the amount of time the access device has to respond to the audit request from the Execution Server before a timeout occurs (in seconds).

parameter.name: releaseCallOnAuditFailure
parameter.description: This parameter controls release call on audit failure. When this parameter value is set to "true", the calls are explicitly taken down with BYE requests, when an audit times out.

context.name: SIP
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Session Interface Protocol (SIP) Session audit-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Session Interface Protocol (SIP) Session audit-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Session Interface Protocol (SIP) Session audit-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: refreshAllowedOnAudit
parameter.description: This parameter controls refreshing on audits. When this parameter value is set to "false", the Execution Server prevents session audit from performing refreshes if the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) session timer was negotiated with the device (or intervening proxy).

parameter.name: allowUpdateForRefresh
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether UPDATE messages are allowed to Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) refresh.

parameter.name: enableSessionTimer
parameter.description: This parameter enables the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) session timer.

parameter.name: sessionExpiresMinimumInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minimum value of the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) session expires timer.

parameter.name: enforceSessionExpiresMaximum
parameter.description: This parameter enables the enforce session expires maximum. When this parameter value is set to "true", the Execution Server compares the received Min-SE against sipSessionExpiresMaximumSeconds. If the received value is higher than the ceiling, the Execution Server forces a refresh of the session at half the configured ceiling value (instead of half the received Session-Expires value). This forced refresh occurs even if the Execution Server was not supposed to be the refresher. This prevents the abnormally high refresh values.

parameter.name: sessionExpiresMaximumInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ceiling value for the negotiated Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) session expires timer.

parameter.name: sessionExpiresTimerInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the value of the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) session expires timer.

parameter.name: alwaysUseSessionTimerWhenSupported
parameter.description: This parameter provides support for the session timer. When this parameter value is set to "true", the Execution Server always tries to negotiate the session timer.

parameter.name: preferredSessionTimerRefresher
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether the local or the demote note refreshes the session.

context.name: Treatment
context.description: This level is used to view and modify treatment-related attributes. System treatments are the scheme by which errors are handled. When a specific event occurs, the Application Server performs the corresponding treatment. For example, if a call fails, a file message can be played. The list of .WAV files available are dynamically generated based on those available in the /var/broadworks/userfiles directory.There are several error conditions with a corresponding directory for each where .WAV files are located: Unknown user - a user dials an unassigned number within their group. Unknown number - a user dials an unknown number. Unknown route - a user attempts to make a call and the routing fails. Network unavailable - a call is made when a gateway is not responding to the network service or when an endpoint timeout has occurred. Resource unavailable - a call is made but the media server and/or endpoint are/is not available. Dial tone timeout - a call is attempted but incomplete or the receiver is left off-hook. Call failure - a call is made and a network-related problem exists.For more information on system-defined treatments, see the BroadWorks Announcement Guide.Treatments can also be configured by the system administrator using SIP status code mapping and system treatments mapping. Support is also provided for the Reason header, as defined in RFC 3326, which includes support of Q.850 cause codes. This feature:Allows configuration of customer-defined treatments (as opposed to system-defined treatments).Provides support for Q.850 cause values (extracted from the Reason header, as defined in RFC 3326) in SIP responses.Allows system administrator to define Q.850 cause values for translation errors on the Network Server. Allows Execution Server handling of Network Server defined treatments via the Network Server treatment being added as a new protocol to the Reason header.This feature allows system administrators to configure the mapping of:SIP status codes to treatments (independently for the network and access side)Q.850 cause values to treatments (if this Q.850 value is present, it supersedes the SIP status code when computing the treatment to use)Services to the treatments to use, for services that can block calls (Outgoing Calling Plan [OCP], Incoming Calling Plan [ICP], Anonymous Call Rejection [ACR], Selective Call Rejection [SCR], Shared Call Appearance [SCA], Intercept, Account/Authorization Code [AAC], and Push to Talk [PTT])Network Server defined treatments to treatments on the Execution Server. System-defined treatments (that is, internal release causes) to treatmentsTreatments to an action (play a specific media file or simply send a SIP response) (independently for the network and access side)Treatments to outgoing SIP status codes (independently for the network and access side)Treatments to Q.850 cause values to be added in a Reason header in outgoing SIP responsesTreatments to whether or not a Reason header should be sent in the response (independently for the network and access side)Treatments to the termination cause to use when generating the call detail recordTreatments to the Route Advancing policyTreatments to system-defined treatments (that is, internal release cause) to allow predefined behavior processing for a particular customer-defined treatmentTreatments to a charge indicator, to configure whether or not the call is marked as charged in the call detail recordThe presence of a customer-defined treatment overrides the default system behavior with the customer-defined behavior (media file to play, SIP status code to generate, terminationCause to generate, and so on). In the absence of any customer-defined treatment, the system behaves as usual. Note that for a given treatment, the SIP status code, internal release cause, and terminationCause are optional. If these attributes are not defined for a treatment, the existing behavior is applied based on the internal release cause. The Q.850 value, Reason Header Transmission policy, Route Advance policy, charge indicator, and announcements for a treatment must be explicitly configured. If these explicit configuration attributes are not configured, default values are used, which means that there is no Reason header with Q.850 value sent for the treatment, route advancing is not triggered, the call is not set to chargeable, and there is no announcement played (the SIP status code is proxied instead).In addition to these configurable treatments, a system parameter provides system administrators with the ability to decide whether charge treatments are handled by answering the call (via a 200 OK message) or with early media (via an 18x message).This level is used to view and assign treatment-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view treatment-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify treatment-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: noChargeTreatments
parameter.description: This parameter determines the treatment for chargeable calls. When this value is set to none, it indicates that network calls blocked by an Accounting Request (ACR), a Selective Call Rejection (SCR), a Selective Call Acceptance (SCA), a Push To Talk (PTT), or an Incoming Calling Plan (ICP) are marked as chargeable. All other treatments remain non-chargeable. When this value is set to "allExceptUserScreened", network calls blocked by ACR, SCR, SCA, or PTT are marked as chargeable. All other treatments remain non-chargeable. When this value is set to "all", any treatment applied by BroadWorks is marked as non-chargeable in the Call Detail Record, regardless of the call type or service.

parameter.name: accessNoChargeTreatmentHandling
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether the non-chargeable treatments on the access side are played with earlyMedia (18x with SDP) or answer (200 OK).

parameter.name: networkNoChargeTreatmentHandling
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether the non-chargeable treatments on the network-side are played with earlyMedia (18x with SDP) or answer (200 OK).

context.name: CommunicationUtility
context.description: This level is used to modify BroadWorks communication utility attributes.

context.name: Settings
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the communication utility default settings.

command.name: get

parameter.name: enableSrvLookup

command.name: get

command.name: set

context.name: Logging

command.name: get

command.name: set

context.name: InputChannels
context.description: This level is used to view, modify, or clear input channels entries.

command.name: set

parameter.name: filePrefix

parameter.name: fileSizeInMB

parameter.name: numberOfFiles

context.name: Device
context.description: This level is used to view, modify, add, and delete devices, device monitors, and other attributes related to devices associated with the Execution Server. Devices can be access devices, network devices, conferencing devices, Media Servers, or Network Servers.

context.name: DefaultCodecs
context.description: This level allows display, addition, and deletion of default codecs.

command.name: get
command.description: This command displays the active codecs of the Execution Server.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a codec for use.

parameter.name: codec
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of a codec.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a codec from the system. Note that codec G711ulaw (G.711 u-Law 64000 bps) cannot be deleted.

parameter.name: codec
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of a codec.

context.name: NetworkServers
context.description: This level is used to view and configure addressable Network Servers. The Network Server provides policy-based call routing and translations. The Execution Server keeps a list of all the addressable Network Servers available to the Execution Server. The Network Server context is split into two separate contexts to allow a different port to be set for each function: routing and synching. A routing Network Server translates to a "lookup" type with reference to the OCI and a synching Network Server translates to an "update" type with reference to the OCI. If a Network Server is to perform both functions, it now must to be added in both the Routing and Synch CLI contexts.

context.name: Routing
context.description: This level is used to view and modify routing Network Server-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view routing Network Server-related attributes.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a new routing Network Server.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the corresponding Internet Protocol (IP) address, host name, or domain for the routing Network Server.

parameter.name: transportProtocol
parameter.description: This parameter specifies which transport type is used by this server. When this parameter value is set to "Unspecified", either protocol is allowed.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port for the routing Network Server.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the routing Network Server's description.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Routing Network Server-related attributes.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the corresponding Internet Protocol (IP) address, host name, or domain for the routing Network Server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port for the routing Network Server.

parameter.name: transportProtocol
parameter.description: This parameter specifies which transport type is used by this server. When this parameter value is set to "Unspecified", either protocol is allowed.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the routing Network Server's description.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a routing Network Server entry.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the corresponding Internet Protocol (IP) address, host name, or domain for the routing Network Server.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) routing Network Server-related attributes.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the corresponding Internet Protocol (IP) address, host name, or domain for the routing Network Server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: GeneralSettings
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the general settings of the BroadWorks server.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view general attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify general attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: preferIPv4Stack
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the value of the java.net.preferIPv4Stack property used to start starting java processes. The default value is "true". It must be set to "false" to to use IPv6 for the process.

parameter.name: configureIPFilter
parameter.description: This parameter indicates whether or not Broadworks configure the IP filtering functionality of the OS. In case the functionality currently supported by Broadworks is not sufficient, an administrator could manually configure the IP filtering function by setting this parameter to false. When doing, the file produced by Broadworks containing the rules are still produced but are not transferred into the OS.

context.name: Licensing
context.description: This level is used to view licensing information for the BroadWorks server.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view licensing information, such as the license type, the number of ports, and the licensing expiration date.

context.name: LicenseManager
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the License Manager settings.

command.name: getpermission
command.description: This command forces the License Manager to execute the entire license permission request process, including the validation of the license.

command.name: showpermission
command.description: This command shows the current license permission state of the License Manager.

context.name: Bcct
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the BroadWorks Common Communication Transport (BCCT) settings.

context.name: Ports
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the BroadWorks Common Communication Transport (BCCT) ports settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the BroadWorks Common Communication Transport (BCCT) ports settings.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the BroadWorks Common Communication Transport (BCCT) ports settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Identifies an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: secured
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Transport Layer Security (TLS) secured port for the license manager.

context.name: GeneralSettings
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the general settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view general settings-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify general settings-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: nfmURI
parameter.description: This parameter specified the Network Function Manager farm Uniform Resource Identifier (URI). This URI is used by the node to request license permission usage to the Network Function Manager.

parameter.name: nfmResponseTimeoutInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter determines the maximum amount of time the license manager waits for a response from the Network Function Manager's license management web application for a license request.

parameter.name: licenseProcessingPeriodInMinutes
parameter.description: This parameter specifies at which interval the license processing is executed (in minutes).

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) general settings-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute to clear.

context.name: GracePeriods
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the grace periods settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view grace periods settings-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify grace periods settings-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: mediumSeverityThreshold
parameter.description: This parameter specifies how long (in % of total grace period) the license manager waits before sending a medium severity notification after a grace period starts.

parameter.name: highSeverityThreshold
parameter.description: This parameter specifies how long (in % of total grace period) the license manager waits before sending a high severity notification after a grace period starts.

parameter.name: criticalSeverityThreshold
parameter.description: This parameter specifies how long (in % of total grace period) the license manager waits before sending a critical severity notification after a grace period starts.

context.name: JVMStatsCollector
context.description: This level is used to configure the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector settings.

context.name: GeneralSettings
context.description: This level is used to configure the general settings of the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the general settings of the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector.

command.name: set
command.description: The command is used to modify the general settings of the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter enables or disables data collection for JVM statistics.

parameter.name: statisticsRefreshPeriod
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the frequency at which BroadWorks fetches PMs from JVM Mbeans.

context.name: HeapUsageThreshold
context.description: This level is used to configure the heap usage threshold settings.

parameter.name: armValue

context.name: LicenseStore
context.description: This level is used to view and manage the BroadWorks License Store.

command.description: This command deletes the specified license version from the License Manager store. Only non-active local license can be deleted, NFM provided license can only be managed from the NFM.

parameter.name: version
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the version of the license to delete.

command.name: import
command.description: This command imports a license file into the License Manager license store.

parameter.name: fileName

command.name: showLicenses
command.description: This command shows the content of the License Manager license store.

context.description: This level is used to view and modify logging for the License Manager.

parameter.description: This parameter turns the logging on and off.

parameter.name: severity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the default logging severity level.

parameter.name: priority
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the priority of the logging thread. The value "1" indicates the lowest priority and "5" indicates the highest.

parameter.name: maxQueueSize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum size of the logging queue.

parameter.name: showThreadName
parameter.description: This parameter enables thread name logging.

context.description: This level is used to view, add, set, delete, and clear a management access list entry.

parameter.name: attribute

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the description of the entry.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing management access list entry.

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the network element that sends requests to the BroadWorks node.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear management access list entry-related attributes.

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the network element that sends requests to the BroadWorks node.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

context.name: MediaFileSystem
context.description: This level is used to configure the way the media file server accesses audio and video files. The media file server can access files using Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP). In this case, the Execution Server provides the Uniform Resource Locator (URL) that specifies where the files are available. This URL usually resolves in the host name of the Execution Server that is handling the call. Web-based Distributed Authoring and Versioning (WebDAV) is a set of extensions to the HTTP and allows users to collaboratively edit and manage files on remote Web Servers. When using WebDAV (or secure WebDAV), the Media Server directly accesses files that are stored on the external file server.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view media file system-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify media file system-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: customerSoundFileDir
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the prefix of the path where customized ''.WAV'' files are stored (custom Auto Attendant greetings, custom User Voice Mail greetings, ''.WAV'' Personalized Names, and so on). '''NOTE''': Changing this parameter may not have the expected result. Uploading a custom ''.WAV'' file from the web does not take this parameter into account, nor does recording the ''.WAV'' files via the voice portal.

parameter.name: mediaFileServerNetAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the media Internet Protocol (IP) address used by the Execution Server when signaling the Media Server. This parameter is only used with the file protocol; it is not used with WebDAV protocol.

parameter.name: directory
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the directory where all audio/video files are located on the server.

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether the local file system or a remote WebDAV server is used.

parameter.name: replicated
parameter.description: This parameter enables replication. If this parameter is set to "true", if the local file system is replicated.

parameter.name: fileServerFQDN
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the WebDAV repository Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN).

parameter.name: userName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the WebDAV user name.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the WebDAV password.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) media file system-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute to delete.

context.description: This level is used to configure network access lists for devices from which calls or messages are accepted by the Execution Server.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view whether or not the system uses Access Control Lists to prevent network access from unauthorized SIP devices.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to enable or disable the use of Access Control Lists to prevent or allow access from unauthorized SIP devices.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: restrictSIPAccess
parameter.description: This parameter enables and disables the use of Access Control Lists (ACLs) for Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) devices. The default value is "false".

parameter.name: attribute

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the character-based description of the device from which calls are permitted.

parameter.description: This parameter specifies the host name, domain name, or Internet Protocol (IP) address of the device.

parameter.name: attribute

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the character-based description of the device from which calls are permitted.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the host name, domain name, or Internet Protocol (IP) address of the device.

parameter.name: netAddress

parameter.name: attribute

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to add through the add command.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the character-based description of the device from which calls are permitted.

command.description: This command is used to modify external authentication Access Control List (ACL)-related entry attributes.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the network device from which calls are permitted.

parameter.name: attribute

parameter.name: description
