parameter.description: This parameter specifies the managed neighbor Internet Protocol (IP) address.

parameter.name: retryAfterReceiver
parameter.description: This parameter enables Retry-After Receiver when the value is set to "true".

parameter.name: retryAfterSender
parameter.description: This parameter enables Retry-After Sender when the value is set to "true".

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the description of the neighbor.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify managed neighbor capabilities.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the managed neighbor Internet Protocol (IP) address.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: retryAfterReceiver
parameter.description: This parameter enables Retry-After Receiver when the value is set to "true".

parameter.name: retryAfterSender
parameter.description: This parameter enables Retry-After Sender when the value is set to "true".

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the description of the neighbor.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove a managed neighbor with manually set capabilities controls from the group of Managed Neighbors.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the managed neighbor Internet Protocol (IP) address.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) optional parameters of a neighbor.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the managed neighbor Internet Protocol (IP) address.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: States
context.description: This level is used to view and modify states settings for all managed neighbors.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view states settings for all Managed Neighbors.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to create a new managed neighbor for the purpose of assigning states for that neighbor.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the managed neighbor Internet Protocol (IP) address.

parameter.name: inService
parameter.description: This parameter enables the in service state. This parameter is used to manually set the neighbor state to in-service.

parameter.name: overloaded
parameter.description: This parameter enables the Overloaded state. This parameter is used to manually set the neighbor state to "overloaded".

parameter.name: inhibited
parameter.description: This parameter enables the ''inhibited'' state. This parameter is used to manually set the neighbor state to "inhibited".

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the description of the managed neighbor.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify managed neighbor states.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the managed neighbor Internet Protocol (IP) address.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: inService
parameter.description: This parameter enables the in service state. This parameter is used to manually set the neighbor state to in-service.

parameter.name: overloaded
parameter.description: This parameter enables the Overloaded state. This parameter is used to manually set the neighbor state to "overloaded".

parameter.name: inhibited
parameter.description: This parameter enables the ''inhibited'' state. This parameter is used to manually set the neighbor state to "inhibited".

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the description of the managed neighbor.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a neighbor with manually set state controls from the group of managed neighbors.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the managed neighbor Internet Protocol (IP) address.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) optional parameters of a managed neighbor.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the managed neighbor Internet Protocol (IP) address.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: NonCallP
context.description: This level is used to view and modify non-callp overload controls settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view non-callp overload controls settings.

command.name: set
command.description: Use this command modify non-callp overload controls settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: numSamples
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the queue delay sample size needed before the Overload Controls are activated.

parameter.name: minTimeInZone
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minimum amount of time (in milliseconds) that the server must stay in a specific zone before returning to a lower one.

parameter.name: delayToEnterYellowZoneInMilliseconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the average queue delay (in milliseconds) required to enter the yellow zone. This value must be greater than the [[DelayToLeaveYellow]] value but less than the [[DelayToLeaveRed]] value.

parameter.name: delayToEnterRedZoneInMilliseconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the average queue delay (in milliseconds) required to enter the red zone. This value must be greater than the [[DelayToLeaveRed]] value.

parameter.name: delayToLeaveYellowZoneInMilliseconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the average queue delay (in milliseconds) required to exit the yellow zone. This value must be less than the [[DelayToEnterYellow]] value.

parameter.name: delayToLeaveRedZoneInMilliseconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the average queue delay (in milliseconds) required to exit the red zone. This value must be greater than [[DelayToEnterYellow]] value but less than the [[DelayToEnterRed]] value.

parameter.name: callpQDelayToEnterYellowZoneInMilliseconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the call processing decode queue delay required to enter the yellow zone.

parameter.name: callpQDelayToEnterRedZoneInMilliseconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the call processing decode queue delay required to enter the red zone.

parameter.name: callpQDelayToLeaveYellowZoneInMilliseconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the call processing decode queue delay required to exit the yellow zone.

parameter.name: callpQDelayToLeaveRedZoneInMilliseconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the call processing decode queue delay required to exit the red zone.

context.name: ProfileManagement
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the configuration settings for subscriber profile management.

context.name: Modification
context.description: This level is used to view and modify attributes related to profile modification.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view attributes related to profile modification.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify attributes related to profile modification.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: callPNumThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of threads used to modify values in a subscriber profile in call processing scenarios.

parameter.name: nonCallNumThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of threads used to modify values in a subscriber profile in non-call processing scenarios.

context.name: Retrieval
context.description: This level is used to view and modify attributes related to profile retrieval.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view attributes related to profile retrieval.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify attributes related to profile retrieval.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: callTimeoutInMilliseconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of milliseconds that the Execution Server waits when retrieving a subscriber profile because of an initial call request.

parameter.name: minNumberOfCallThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minimum number of threads affected to call-related processing.

parameter.name: maxNumberOfCallThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of threads affected to call-related processing.

parameter.name: callMaxQueueSize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of requests to queue up before allocating more than the minimum number of threads in this pool.

parameter.name: nonCallTimeoutInMilliseconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of milliseconds that the Execution Server waits when retrieving a subscriber profile because of a non-call related request.

parameter.name: minNumberOfNonCallThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minimum number of threads affected to non-call-related processing.

parameter.name: maxNumberOfNonCallThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of threads affected to non-call-related processing.

parameter.name: nonCallMaxQueueSize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of requests to queue up before allocating more than the minimum number of threads in this pool.

parameter.name: midCallTimeoutInMilliseconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of milliseconds that the Execution Server waits when retrieving a subscriber profile during call processing (typically for service processing).

context.name: ProfileTuning
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the profile tuning for the server.

context.name: GeneralSettings
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the general settings of profile tuning.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to get the last applied profile tuning name.

command.name: apply
command.description: This command is used to apply a specific tuning profile. The printed output lists the difference between the current values stored within the configuration and the new values that will be set by applying the profile.

parameter.name: profileTuningName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the selected profile tuning.

command.name: describe
command.description: This command is used to print the configuration changes performed by a profile. The printed output lists the difference between the current values stored within the configuration and the new values that would be set by applying the profile. No configuration changes are applied.

parameter.name: profileTuningName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the selected profile tuning.

context.name: Resources
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the physical resources of the server.

context.name: Memory
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the memory allocation rules for the applications running on the server.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to show memory allocation general settings. They include the over-allocation protection, which will adjust the container memory allocation if the configured memory settings exceed physical memory available.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to set memory allocation general settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: overAllocationProtection
parameter.description: This parameter controls whether the software manager adjusts the containers memory allocation if the configured memory settings exceed the physical memory available. The default value is "true".

context.name: Containers
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the memory allocation rules for each container.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to display container memory allocation settings and runtime values.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the memory allocation settings for a container. For the purpose of the set command, the memory can be expressed as an amount of memory (in megs) or a percentage of physical memory. Modifying one of the values causes the other to be recalculated.

parameter.name: containerName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the container name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: amount
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the amount of memory that is allocated to a container (in megs).

parameter.name: percentage
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the percentage of physical memory that is allocated to a container.

context.name: Security
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Access Control List (ACL) security options for the server.

context.name: BlackList
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Access Control List (ACL) black list security options for the BroadWorks server.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to display network security-related attributes. It displays the Access Control List (ACL) black list that filters inbound network packets to the BroadWorks server. Packets that match entries in the black list are processed by the BroadWorks server.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add an entry to the Access Control List (ACL) black list.

parameter.name: SourceAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the sourceIp/sourceMask pair as a subnet range of IPs. The sourceIp is always the string representation of the IP whether IPv4 or IPv6.

parameter.name: Mask
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the source mask. It is in dotted string format for IPv4 (for example, 255.255.0.0) or the number of bits in the mask for IPv4 and IPv6.

parameter.name: DestinationAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the destination IP address of the packet matches against this IP address. This is one of the configured IP addresses of the BroadWorks server.

parameter.name: destinationPortFirst
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the first port of the range of inbound packets that match against a range of destination ports. For protocol Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP), this is "0".

parameter.name: destinationPortLast
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the last port of the range of inbound packets that match against a range of destination ports. For protocol Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP), this is "0".

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.description: This parameter determines the received network packet matches against this protocol. Values include" "tcp", "udp", or "icmp".

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove an entry from the Access Control List (ACL) black list.

parameter.name: SourceAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the sourceIp/sourceMask pair as a subnet range of IPs. The sourceIp/sourceMask pair defines a subnet range of IPs. The sourceIp is always the string representation of the IP whether IPv4 or IPv6.

parameter.name: Mask
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the sourceMask is in dotted string for IPv4 (for example, 255.255.0.0) or the number of bits in the mask for IPv4 and IPv6.

parameter.name: DestinationAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the destination IP address of the packet matches against this IP address. This is one of the configured IP addresses of the BroadWorks server.

parameter.name: destinationPortFirst
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the first port of the range of inbound packets that match against a range of destination ports. For protocol Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP), this is "0".

parameter.name: destinationPortLast
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the last port of the range of inbound packets that match against a range of destination ports. For protocol Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP), this is "0".

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.description: This parameter determines the received network packet matches against this protocol. Values include: "tcp", "udp", or "icmp".

context.name: WhiteList
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Access Control List (ACL) white list security options for the BroadWorks server.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to display the network security-related attributes. It displays the Access Control List white list that filters inbound network packets to the BroadWorks Server. Packets match entries in the white list to be processed by the BroadWorks server.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add an entry to the Access Control List ( ACL) white list.

parameter.name: SourceAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the sourceIp/sourceMask pair as a subnet range of IPs. The sourceIp is always the string representation of the IP whether IPv4 or IPv6.

parameter.name: Mask
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the sourceMask is in dotted string for IPv4 (for example, 255.255.0.0) or the number of bits in the mask for IPv4 and IPv6.

parameter.name: DestinationAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the destination IP address of the packet matches against this IP address. This is one of the configured IP addresses of the BroadWorks Server.

parameter.name: destinationPortFirst
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the first port of the range of inbound packets that match against a range of destination ports. For protocol Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP), this is "0".

parameter.name: destinationPortLast
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the last port of the range of inbound packets that match against a range of destination ports. For protocol Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP), this is "0".

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.description: This parameter determines the received network packet matches against this protocol. Values include: "tcp", "udp", or "icmp".

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove an entry from the Access Control List (ACL) white list.

parameter.name: SourceAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the sourceIp/sourceMask pair as a subnet range of IPs. The sourceIp/sourceMask pair defines a subnet range of IPs. The sourceIp is always the string representation of the IP whether IPv4 or IPv6.

parameter.name: Mask
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the sourceMask is in dotted string for IPv4 (for example, 255.255.0.0) or the number of bits in the mask for IPv4 and IPv6.

parameter.name: DestinationAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the destination IP address of the packet matches against this IP address. This is one of the configured IP addresses of the BroadWorks Server.

parameter.name: destinationPortFirst
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the first port of the range of inbound packets that match against a range of destination ports. For protocol Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP), this is "0".

parameter.name: destinationPortLast
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the last port of the range of inbound packets that match against a range of destination ports. For protocol Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP), this is "0".

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.description: This parameter determines the received network packet matches against this protocol. Values include: "tcp", "udp", or "icmp".

context.name: SubscriberMgmt
context.description: This level is used to manage all user types including system, service provider, group, and user.

context.name: Policy
context.description: This level is used to configure policies for groups and users.

context.name: CallProcessing
context.description: This level is used to manage call processing policies.

context.name: CallLimits
context.description: This level is used to view and modify CallLimits Policy-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view CallLimits Policy-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify CallLimits Policy-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: maxRedirectionDepth
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of cascaded redirections.

context.name: Conferencing
context.description: This level is used to view, add, modify, and clear Conferencing-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Conferencing Policy-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Conferencing Policy-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: maxConferenceParties
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of parties allowed in a conference call.

context.name: DialPlan
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Dial Plan policy-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Dial Plan Policy-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Dial Plan Policy-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: requiresAccessCodeForPublicCalls
parameter.description: This parameter enables the requirement of dialing an access code for public calls when the parameter is set to "true". Typically, this is enforced by the Network Server Voice Virtual Private Network (VPN) policy. This allows the implementation of a non-permissive private dial plan for smaller enterprises without the need to configure the Voice VPN policy on the Network Server.

parameter.name: allowE164PublicCalls
parameter.description: This parameter enables E 164 for public calls. This parameter determines whether E.164 addresses are allowed for public calls regardless of the non-permissive option setting. This option is only relevant when the non-permissive option is set.

parameter.name: preferE164FormatForCallbackServices
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether E.164 formatted Callback numbers are transformed into a national-prefixed number by the callback services.

parameter.name: publicDigitMap
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the public digit maps. Digit maps are sent by the Execution Server in the context of a call origination from a Media Gateway Control Protocol (MGCP) device or a call origination that involves the Media Server for digit collection. This digit map is mandatory.

parameter.name: privateDigitMap
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the private digit map. This parameter is optional, but must be configured if the "Enabled" secondary dial tone option of an access code is set.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) Dial Plan policy-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: AccessCodes
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Dial Plan policy access code attributes. System-wide access codes are used for all users in the system unless overridden by different access codes at the service provider or group level.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Dial Plan policy access code attributes.

command.name: detail
command.description: This command is used to view Dial Plan Policy Access Codes details.

parameter.name: accessCode
parameter.description: The network access code for an outside line.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add new Dial Plan policy access code.

parameter.name: accessCode
parameter.description: The network access code for an outside line.

parameter.name: includeCodeForNetworkTranslationsAndRouting
parameter.description: This parameter enables the access code to be included as part of the dialed digits for the purpose of network translations and routing.

parameter.name: includeCodeForScreeningServices
parameter.description: This parameter enables the access code to be included as part of the dialed digits for the purpose of call screening (for example, Outgoing Digit Plan and Outgoing Calling Plan).

parameter.name: enableSecondaryDialTone
parameter.description: This parameter enables the secondary dial tone to be applicable for calls initiated from a Media Gateway Control Protocol (MGCP) device or for call originations that involve the Media Server for digit collection. If this attribute is set to "true", the private digit map is initially used for digit collection. This attribute cannot be set unless a private digit map is configured.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the description of the access code.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Dial Plan policy access code-related attributes.

parameter.name: accessCode
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the network access code for an outside line.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: includeCodeForNetworkTranslationsAndRouting
parameter.description: This parameter enables the access code to be included as part of the dialed digits for the purpose of network translations and routing.

parameter.name: includeCodeForScreeningServices
parameter.description: This parameter enables the access code to be included as part of the dialed digits for the purpose of call screening (for example, Outgoing Digit Plan and Outgoing Calling Plan).

parameter.name: enableSecondaryDialTone
parameter.description: This parameter enables the secondary dial tone to be applicable for calls initiated from a Media Gateway Control Protocol (MGCP) device or for call originations that involve the Media Server for digit collection. If this attribute is set to "true", the private digit map is initially used for digit collection. This attribute cannot be set unless a private digit map is configured.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the description of the access code.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing Dial Plan Policy access code.

parameter.name: accessCode
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the network access code for an outside line.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) Dial Plan Policy access code-related attributes.

parameter.name: accessCode
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the network access code for an outside line.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: Multimedia
context.description: This level is used to view and modify existing Multimedia policies.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view existing Multimedia policies.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the attributes of a Multimedia policy.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: restrictNonAudioVideoMediaTypes
parameter.description: This parameter enables [[restrictNonAudioVideoMediaTypes]].

context.name: ProfileData
context.description: This level is used to load and display the profile data for a service provider, group or user.

context.name: Groups
context.description: This level is used to load and display the profile data for groups.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to load and display the profile data for the specified group.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The id of the group to load.

context.name: ServiceProviders
context.description: This level is used to load and display the profile data for service providers.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to load and display the profile data for the specified service provider.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The id of the service provider to load.

context.name: Users
context.description: This level is used to load and display the profile data for users.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to load and display the profile data for the specified user.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.description: Key to be used to retrieve the profile data of a user.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The id of the user to load.

context.name: SystemConfig
context.description: This level is used to view and modify subscriber-related system settings.

context.name: CallProcessing
context.description: This level is used to view and modify system configured call processing attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view system configured call processing attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify system configured call processing attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: publicIPAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the public Internet Protocol (IP) address of the Execution Server. This address is used for all access-side (towards access devices).

parameter.name: privateIPAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the private Internet Protocol (IP) address of the Execution Server. This address is used for all network-side (towards the Network Server, Media Server, and any Public Switched Telephone Network [PSTN] interconnect contacts returned by the Network Server) Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) traffic. By default, the SIP Via and Contact headers are populated with the respective Public IP address and Private IP addresses. If the value is empty and Private IP address and Public IP address are set, the Private IP address is used. If only the Public IP address is set, it is used.

parameter.name: publicIPv6Address
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the server default IPv6 address. Used by SIP instead of publicIPAddress when sipIpVersion is IPv6. Unused when not using IPv6.

parameter.name: privateIPv6Address
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the server default private IPv6 address. Used by SIP instead of privateIPAddress when sipIpVersion is IPv6. Unused when not using IPv6.

parameter.name: callhalfNumThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of threads affected to call-related call-half processing.

parameter.name: callhalfNonCallNumThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of threads affected to non-call-related call-half processing.

parameter.name: extendedCallingLineIdEnabled
parameter.description: This parameter enables the Extended Calling Line ID.

parameter.name: incomingCallToUserAliasMode
parameter.description: This parameter is used to control which user alias the AS is allowed to use to perform translations for incoming calls.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) system configured call processing attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to clear.

context.name: RingTimeout
context.description: This level is used to view and modify ring timeout attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view ring timeout attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify ring timeout attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether ring timeout is enabled.

parameter.name: terminationAttemptTimeout
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ring timeout.

context.name: Service
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the options available for the Execution Server services. Announcements (or''.WAV''files) heard for each service can be customized and uploaded to the following directory on the Media Server:''/var/broadworks/userfiles/{servicename}/''. These directories are created during the installation process. If you want to modify the announcements played by the services in the directory above, you must place new, correctly encoded''.WAV''files into the directory for each service. NOTE: If you update an existing file with the same name, the Media Server must be rebooted for the changed announcement to be active.

context.name: AdviceOfCharge
context.description: This level is used to view, modify, and clear Advice of Charge-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Advice Of Charge-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Advice Of Charge-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: delayBetweenNotificationInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interval (in seconds) for sending out Advice of Charge - During call (AoC-D) information to the caller. A low duration for this value could have a negative impact on the system performance so it should be set appropriately; values under 20 seconds are not recommended.

parameter.name: incomingAocHandling
parameter.description: This parameter specifies how an incoming Advice of Charge is processed by the Execution Server.

parameter.name: costInformationSource
parameter.description: This parameter specifies where the service price enquiry request is sent.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) the Advice of Charge-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: AnonymousCallRejection
context.description: This level is used to view, modify, and clear Anonymous Call Rejection-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the system-level Anonymous Call Rejection service settings.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify system-level Anonymous Call Rejection settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: paiRequired
parameter.description: This parameter enables the P-Asserted-Identity (PAI) for the invocation of the Anonymous Call Rejection service when the value is set to "true".

parameter.name: screenOnlyLocalCalls
parameter.description: This parameter enables only local calls to be subject to the Anonymous Call Rejection service when the value is set to "true".

context.name: AutomaticCallback
context.description: This level is used for system-level configuration of the Automatic Callback service for groups.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view parameters associated with the AutomaticCallback service.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify parameters associated with the AutomaticCallback service.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: monitorDuration
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the monitor period (in seconds).

parameter.name: maxMonitorsPerOriginator
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of originator sessions.

parameter.name: maxMonitorsPerTerminator
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of terminator sessions.

parameter.name: maxCallbackRings
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of retry rings.

parameter.name: terminatorIdleGuardTimer
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the idle guard period (in seconds).

parameter.name: callbackMethod
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the method used to determine whether the called party is available.

parameter.name: pollingIntervalInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the automatic callback polling interval (in seconds).

parameter.name: activationDigit
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the [[activationDigit]] to determine the digit the subscriber must press to activate the Automatic Callback service. When a subscriber, who has Automatic Callback assigned, originates a call to a busy subscriber, they receive a prompt to enter a digit to activate the Automatic Callback service.

context.name: ReleaseCause
context.description: This level is used to configure the behavior of Automatic Callback based on SIP Status codes. In this way, the list could be defaulted to 486 (Busy Here) and 600 (Busy Everywhere); however the administrator has the ability to add or remove response codes to this list.

command.name: get
command.description: The get command is used to view Automatic Callback Release Causes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Automatic Callback Release Causes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute to modify.

parameter.name: onBusy
parameter.description: Controls whether Automatic Callback is invoked on Busy release cause.

parameter.name: onForbidden
parameter.description: Controls whether Automatic Callback is invoked on Forbidden release cause.

parameter.name: onGlobalFailure
parameter.description: Controls whether Automatic Callback is invoked on Global Failure release cause.

parameter.name: onRequestFailure
parameter.description: Controls whether Automatic Callback is invoked on Request Failure release cause.

parameter.name: onServerFailure
parameter.description: Controls whether Automatic Callback is invoked on Server Failure release cause.

parameter.name: onTranslationFailure
parameter.description: Controls whether Automatic Callback is invoked on Translation Failure release cause.

parameter.name: onTemporarilyUnavailable
parameter.description: Controls whether Automatic Callback is invoked on Temporarily Unavailable release cause.

parameter.name: onUserNotFound
parameter.description: Controls whether Automatic Callback is invoked on User Not Found release cause.

parameter.name: onRequestTimeout
parameter.description: Controls whether Automatic Callback is invoked on Request Timeout release cause.

context.name: BusyLampField
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Busy Lamp Field-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Busy Lamp Field-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Busy Lamp Field-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: displayLocalUserIdentityLastNameFirst
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether the Busy Lamp Field service provides display name with last name first.

parameter.name: forceUseOfTCP
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether the BroadWorks Application Server sends the Busy Lamp Field service SIP NOTIFY requests over TCP instead of honoring the implicit, explicit, or DNS resolved indication to use UDP. This behavior also depends on BroadWorks Execution Server setting supportTcp being set to true.

context.name: CallNotify
context.description: This level is used for the system-level configuration of the Call Notify service.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Call Notify-related attributes (the default From e-mail address of text messages sent to users when incoming calls are received). The Call Notify default e-mail address appears when the actual address is unknown. If the e-mail address of the caller is available, it displays.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Call Notify-related attributes (the default From e-mail address of text messages sent to users when incoming calls are received).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: defaultFromAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the default From e-mail address of text messages sent to users when incoming calls are received.

parameter.name: useShortSubjectLine
parameter.description: This parameter triggers the Execution Server to send the subject line in the e-mail to the default address when the value is set to "true".

parameter.name: useDnInMailBody
parameter.description: This parameter enables a destination number to be specified along with the default address.

context.name: CallReturn
context.description: This level is used for system-level configuration of the Call Return service for groups.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the attributes of the Call Return service.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the attributes of the Call Return service.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: twoLevelActivation
parameter.description: This parameter enables the Call Return service to use two-level activation when the value is set to "true".

parameter.name: provideDate
parameter.description: This parameter enables the date to be provided when the value is set to "true". This parameter only applies to two-level activation.

parameter.name: lastUnansweredCallOnly
parameter.description: This parameter enables the Execution Server to determine whether the service applies to the last incoming call or only to the last unanswered incoming call.

parameter.name: confirmationKey
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the confirmation key for the two-level activation of Call Return service.

parameter.name: allowRestrictedNumber
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether Call Return to a restricted number is allowed.

parameter.name: deleteNumberAfterAnsweredCallReturn
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether the number is deleted from the incoming call memory upon successful call return.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) Call Return-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: CallWaiting
context.description: This level is used to modify the Call Waiting service to optionally provide a distinct ringback tone to the caller when the called party is busy on a call. This capability is required in some markets by regulation and is also commonly used in Europe with mobile phones.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the status of the playDistinctiveRingback system parameter.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to enable or disable the playDistinctiveRingback parameter. When enabled, Distinctive Call Waiting Ringback has precedence over Custom Ringback for waiting calls. The exact Call Waiting Ringback tone to be played is selected based on the country code of the called party.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: playDistinctiveRingback
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether the system applies a distinctive ringback tone to the caller when the called is busy and has Call Waiting.

context.name: CallingNameRetrieval
context.description: This level is used to display, modify, and clear Calling Name Retrieval-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Calling Name Retrieval-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Calling Name Retrieval-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: triggerCNAMQueriesForAllNetworkCalls
parameter.description: This parameter allows the Calling Name Retrieval service to trigger an external database query even when the calling name information is provided in the FROM header of the incoming SIP INVITE from the network.

parameter.name: triggerCNAMQueriesForGroupAndEnterpriseCalls
parameter.description: This parameter allows the Calling Name Retrieval service to trigger an external database query even when the caller is a BroadWorks user known to the Application Server of the Calling Name Retrieval subscriber.

parameter.name: queryTimeoutInMilliseconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time allotted for timer querying.

parameter.name: routeAdvanceTimerInMilliseconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time allotted to query a Caller ID with name (CNAM) server before it is routed to the next CNAM server.

parameter.name: retryFailedCNAMServerIntervalInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the duration before a non-responding Caller ID with name (CNAM) server is queried.

parameter.name: ignoreRestrictedPresentationIndicator
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether a restricted presentation indicator is ignored and the returned calling name is presented.

parameter.name: queryProtocol
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the protocol used by the Calling Name Service for calling name information query.

parameter.name: supportsDNSSRV
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether a DNS SRV query is used before a DNS A query is invoked.

parameter.name: soapExternalDatabaseURI
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the URI to access the database for SOAP

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) CallingNameRetrieval-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: SIPExternalDatabase
context.description: This level is used to view and modify attributes related to the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) External Database for Calling Name Retrieval.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view attributes related to the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) External Database for Calling Name Retrieval.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify attributes related to the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) External Database for Calling Name Retrieval.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to set.

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the IP address, host, or domain name of the database for SIP.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number of the external databse for SIP.

parameter.name: transportProtocol
parameter.description: This parameter specifies which transport type is used by this server. When the value is set to "Unspecified", either protocol is allowed.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) attributes related to the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) External Database for Calling Name Retrieval.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: CustomerOriginatedTrace
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Customer Originated Trace-related attributes in the system.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Customer Originated Trace-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Customer Originated Trace-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: screenMaliciousCallers
parameter.description: Controls the service from creating SCR records upon COT service invocation from a user.

context.name: E911PsapCallback
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the E911 Public Safety Answering Point (PSAP) Callback related attribute.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the E911 Public Safety Answering Point (PSAP) Callback-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the E911 Public Safety Answering Point (PSAP) Callback-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether the E911 Public Safety Answering Point (PSAP) Callback feature is enabled. When the value is set to "true", calls identified as an E911 PSAP Callback bypass terminating services that would prevent the call from being sent through to a device.

context.name: AllowedServices
context.description: This level is used to view, add and delete allowed services.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the allowed services during an E911 Public Safety Answering Point (PSAP) Callback.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a service to the allowed service list. Calls identified as an E911 Public Safety Answering Point (PSAP) Callback will bypass terminating services that would prevent the call from being sent through to a device. However, an operator has the option to override the default PSAP Callback behavior and allow some of the services that would otherwise be bypassed. The services in the AllowedServices will be allowed even during a PSAP callback.

parameter.name: service
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the service.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove an existing service from the allowed service list. Once removed, that service is no longer allowed during a E911 Public Safety Answering Point (PSAP) Callback, that is it will be bypassed.

parameter.name: service
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the service.

context.name: EnhancedCallLogs
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Enhanced Call Logs related attribute. You can set to use DBS instead of CDS as your call log server.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the enhanced call logs-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the enhanced call logs-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: numProcessors
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of threads to handle call log events. Events handled by a processor are converted into Structured Query Language (SQL) statements and written to the centralized database.

parameter.name: eventQueueMemSize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of queue entries allowed for every megabyte of memory heap.

parameter.name: eventQueueFileSize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the size (in kilobytes) per event queue file.

parameter.name: numEventQueueFiles
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of files created for the purpose of storing events that temporarily cannot be stored to the centralized database.

context.name: GeneralSettings
context.description: This level is used to view and modify service general settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view service general settings.

command.name: set
command.description: The command is used to modify service general settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: allowEmergencyNetworkLocationOriginations
parameter.description: This parameter controls the origination of emergency calls initiated from a remote office location.

parameter.name: maxReentryForSameCall
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of re-entries for the same call.

context.name: GroupNightForwarding
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Group Night Forwarding service attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Group Night Forwarding service attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Group Night Forwarding service attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: nightForwardGroupCallsWithinEnterprise
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether the intergroup calls within an enterprise are forwarded when this feature is activated on a group within an enterprise.

context.name: HuntGroup
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Hunt Group-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Hunt Group-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Hunt Group-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: addServiceNameToCLID
parameter.description: This parameter specifies when the hunt group name is added to the Calling Line ID (CLID).

parameter.name: uniformCallDistributionPolicyScope
parameter.description: The system default configuration to determine if the idle time of an agent is calculated on a per agent basis or on a per call center basis.

context.name: Intercept
context.description: This level is used to temporarily suspend service for users who are roaming outside of the carrier serving area.

context.name: SystemAllowedDNList
context.description: This level is used to view and modify System Allowed DN List-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view System Allowed Directory Number (DN) List-related attributes.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add System Allowed Directory Number (DN) List-related attributes.

parameter.name: phoneNumber
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the E.164 phone number of the entry to add.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: Provides more detail about this phone number.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify System Allowed Directory Number (DN) List-related attributes.

parameter.name: phoneNumber
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the E.164 phone number of the entry to add.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: Provides more detail about this phone number.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete System Allowed Directory Number (DN) List-related attributes.

parameter.name: phoneNumber
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the E.164 phone number of the entry to add.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) System Allowed Directory Number (DN) List-related attributes.

parameter.name: phoneNumber
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the E.164 phone number of the entry to add.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: User
context.description: This level allows carriers to temporarily suspend service for users who are roaming outside of the carrier serving area.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view system-wide settings for the Intercept User service.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify system-wide settings for the Intercept User service.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: emergencyAndRepairIntercept
parameter.description: This parameter determines when calls are blocked, including emergency and repair calls.

context.name: MaliciousCallTrace
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Malicious Call Trace-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Malicious Call Trace-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Malicious Call Trace-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: playMCTWarningAnnouncement
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether the Malicious Call Trace warning announcement plays.

context.name: MusicOnHold
context.description: When a device initiates a call transfer using a hold INVITE followed by the REFER method, the time for the device to process and send the REFER may be longer than the Music On Hold processing delay on the BroadWorks Application Server. This level is used to configure a timer which delays Music On Hold when a hold request is received. This ensures the user does not hear Music On Hold for common transfer scenarios.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Music On Hold-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Music On Hold-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: delayInMilliseconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the delay (in milliseconds) before Music On Hold is triggered.

context.name: OMAPresence
context.description: This level is used to view and modify OMA Presence-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the OMA Presence-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the OMA Presence-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: publishExpiration
parameter.description: This parameter determines the expiration time (in seconds) put in the SIP PUBLISH Expires header for initial and refresh requests. An Expires header is not sent if this value is null.

parameter.name: serviceId
parameter.description: This parameter determines the contents of the service-description element's service-id element inside the initial SIP PUBLISH PIDF body. If this value is null, a service-description element is not included in the PIDF body.

parameter.name: version
parameter.description: This parameter determines the contents of the service-description element's version element inside the initial SIP PUBLISH PIDF body. If this value is null, a version element is not included in the service-description element. This value has no effect if the serviceId parameter is null, since in this case a service-description element is not included in the PIDF body.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: This parameter determines the contents of the service-description element's description element inside the initial SIP PUBLISH PIDF body. If this value is null, a description element is not included in the service-description element. This value has no effect if the serviceId parameter is null, since in this case a service-description element is not included in the PIDF body.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) OMA Presence-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: PhysicalLocation
context.description: This level allows an emergency call to continue even if it would have been blocked otherwise by physical location screening.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Physical Location-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Physical Location-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: alwaysAllowEmergencyCalls
parameter.description: This parameter enables emergency calls.

context.name: SelectiveServices
context.description: This level is used to view and set SelectiveServices related attributes. Changes made apply to all selective services.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the selective services-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the selective services-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: screenPrivateNumber
parameter.description: This parameter determines if specific phone numbers with privacy are screened by selective services.

context.name: ServiceCentralizationContinuity
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the service centralization continuity-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the service centralization continuity-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the service centralization continuity-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: scfAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the address (fully qualified domain name [FQDN] or interface Internet Protocol [IP] address) of the BroadWorks Service Control Function (SCF) that is used to fetch a Circuit-Switched Domain Routing Number (CSRN). It is used when the value of the csrnSource parameter is SCF.

parameter.name: scfPort
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port of the BroadWorks Service Control Function (SCF) that is used to fetch a Circuit-Switched Domain Routing Number (CSRN). It is used when the value of the csrnSource parameter is SCF.

parameter.name: STN-SR
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Session Transfer Number for Single Radio (STN-SR) stored in the user's Execution Server mode profile upon registration, when an Access Transfer Control Function (ATCF) does not anchor the user's device. STN-SR number must be in e164 format.

parameter.name: ATU-STI
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Access Transfer Update - Session Transfer Identifier (ATU-STI) that is sent to the Access Transfer Control Function (ATCF) upon registration anchored by an ATCF.

parameter.name: useUEAssistedTADSForUnknownPSSupport
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether User Equipment (UE)-assisted Terminating Access Domain Selection (T-ADS) is used when Packed Switched (network) (PS) support cannot be determined. Otherwise, Circuit Switched (CS) media only is used.

parameter.name: csrnSource
parameter.description: This parameter determines how the CS Domain Routing Number (CSRN) is obtained for terminations breaking out to the Circuit Switched (CS) domain. usePrefix is selected when the CSRN is computed by adding the csrnPrefix to the terminating number. SCF is selected when the CSRN is fetched from the Service Control Function (SCF). HSS is selected when the CSRN field is fetched from the Home Subscriber Server (HSS). alternateImplicitId is selected when the CSRN is an alternate implicit identity from the user's IMS profile.

parameter.name: csrnPrefix
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the prefix used to compute a CS Domain Routing Number (CSRN) by concatenating it with the terminating number. This is only used when the csrnSource parameter values is usePrefix.

parameter.name: imrnOrigSource
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether the IP Multimedia Routing (IMRN) is used for call origination with the imrnPrefix added to the called party with routing number or temporary number dynamically allocated from IMRN pool.

parameter.name: imrnOrigPrefix
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the prefix used to compute a IP Multimedia Routing (IMRN) for call origination by concatenating it with the terminating number. This is only used when the value of the imrnSource parameter value is "usePrefix".

parameter.name: imrnTermSource
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether the IP Multimedia Routing (IMRN) is used for call termination with the imrnPrefix added to the called party with routing number or temporary number dynamically allocated from IMRN pool.

parameter.name: imrnTermPrefix
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the prefix used to compute a IP Multimedia Routing (IMRN) for call termination by concatenating it with the terminating number. This is only used when the value of the imrnSource parameter value is "usePrefix".

parameter.name: triggerCSRNRoutingWhenNotReachable
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether a timeout or error response results in Circuit-Switched Domain Routing Number (CSRN) routing when alerting the Packet Switched (PS) network location.

parameter.name: csrnRoutingTimerInMilliseconds
parameter.description: This parameter determines the timer value to use before triggering the Circuit-Switched Domain Routing Number (CSRN) routing when alerting a Packet Switched (PS) network location. Only applicable when the value for the triggerCSRNRoutingWhenNotReachable parameter is set to "true".

parameter.name: avoidRegistrationStateHSSQuery
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether Home Subscriber Server (HSS) queries to get the IMSUserState are allowed to fetch the registration status when performing Terminating Access Domain Selection (T-ADS).

parameter.name: inhibitDiversionForCSRNRouting
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether a Diversion header with the diversion-inhibited parameter is added to the SIP INVITE of a Circuit-Switched Domain Routing Number (CSRN) termination.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) the service centralization continuity-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: ThirdPartyVoiceMailSupport
context.description: This level is used to manage Third Party Voice Mail Support-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Third Party Voice Mail Support-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Third Party Voice Mail Support-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: overrideAltCallerIdForVMRetrieval
parameter.description: This parameter enables the Execution Server to override alternate caller ID for voice mail retrieval.

context.name: VoiceMessageSummaryUpdate
context.description: This level allows the Application Server to send a Message-Summary status to a device after processing a REGISTER. This is useful in cases such as when supporting devices lose their MWI (message waiting indicator) status after a reboot.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Message Summary Update attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Message Summary Update attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: sendSavedAndUrgentMWIOnNotification
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether counters are inserted into message summaries. When set to "true", Old, New-Urgent, and Old-Urgent counters are inserted into the voice-message line of the simple-message-summary body.

parameter.name: sendMessageSummaryUpdateOnRegister
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether a send message is sent upon registration. When set to "true", an update is applied to the MWI summary notification when the device is registered.

parameter.name: minTimeBetweenMWIOnRegisterInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minimum delay for subsequent message-summary notification after device registration. This delay allows BroadWorks to avoid sending the message-summary each time a device tries to register to the Execution Server.

context.name: VoiceMessaging
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Voice Messaging-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Voice Messaging-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Voice Messaging-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: mwiDelay
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the delay (in seconds) to apply to message waiting indicators sent after a voice mail is sent. To disable the delay, set the parameter value to "0" to disable the delay.

context.name: VoiceMessagingGroup
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Voice Messaging-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: Use this command the Voice Messaging-related attributes, such as the system default hold period, minimum and maximum length of messages, and so on. The Voice Messaging service answers a user's phone and records incoming messages from callers.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Voice Messaging-related attributes, such as the system default hold period and minimum and maximum length of messages.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: minNumberOfThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minimum number of Voice Messaging threads.

parameter.name: maxNumberOfThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of Voice Messaging threads.

parameter.name: maxMessageLength
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the length of an incoming message (in minutes).

parameter.name: maxMailboxLength
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the total length of all messages that can be left in a user's mailbox (in minutes).

parameter.name: doesMessageAge
parameter.description: This parameter enables message aging. When this parameter value is set to "false", messages are not deleted. When this parameter value is set to "true", messages are deleted after the hold period.

parameter.name: holdPeriod
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of days saved messages remain on the Execution Server before being marked for deletion.

parameter.name: realDeleteForImap
parameter.description: This parameter enables the Execution Server to expunge a user's Internet Message Access Protocol (IMAP) mailbox after a Voice Mail Retrieval (VMR) call. A VMR call is one where a user listens to their messages through the portal. With this option messages are actually deleted rather than just marked for deletion. When this parameter set to "false", voice mails that are deleted during the VMR call are only marked for deletion in the user's e-mail account on the mail server.

parameter.name: defaultDeliveryFromAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the e-mail address that voice mail messages are sent from. This e-mail address is always used in the ''From'' field of the e-mail sent to the user. If the e-mail address of the caller is available, it is added to the ''Reply-To'' field.

parameter.name: defaultNotificationFromAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the e-mail address that voice message notification e-mails are sent from. This e-mail address is always used in the ''From'' field of an e-mail sent to a user. If the e-mail address of the caller is available, it is added to the ''Reply-To'' field.

parameter.name: useShortSubjectLine
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether a short subject line is included for the voice mail notification.

parameter.name: useDnInMailBody
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether the directory number (DN) is included in the e-mail body of the message for the voice mail notification.

parameter.name: networkWideMessaging
parameter.description: This parameter allows users to compose, forward, and reply to users hosted on a different Execution Server when the value is set to "true".

parameter.name: useExternalRouting
parameter.description: This parameter enables external routing. When this parameter value is set to "true", an active voice portal call is routed to an external voice device (that is, text-to-speech device).

parameter.name: defaultExternalRoutingAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Directory Number (DN)/Uniform Resource Locator (URL) of the external device.

parameter.name: supportDNSSRVForMailServerAccess
parameter.description: This parameter enables the support of Service Locator (SRV) Domain Name Server (DNS) record types by the mail server.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) Voice Messaging-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: CustomVoicePortalMenus
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the general attributes for Custom Voice Portal menu.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the general attributes for Custom Voice Portal menu.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify general attributes for Custom Voice Portal menu.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
