parameter.name: exitVoicePortal
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the menu key to exit the Voice Portal.

parameter.name: repeatMenu
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the menu key to repeat the current menu.

parameter.name: autoAttendantConfig
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the menu key to access the Auto Attendant's Greetings configuration menu.

parameter.name: hoteling
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the menu key to access the Hoteling's configuration menu.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) the menu keys for the Voice Portal Main Voice Portal menu.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: MailServer
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Voice Messaging Mail Server attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Voice Messaging Mail Server attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Voice Messaging Mail Server attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to modify.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the host name of the server to which voice mails are sent and then retrieved by the user.

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the protocol. When this parameter value is set to "POP3", the Execution Server uses the POP3 protocol to connect to the mail server. When this parameter set to "IMAP", the Execution Server uses the Internet Message Access Protocol (IMAP) protocol to connect to the mail server.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) Voice Messaging Mail Server attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: VoicePortal
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Voice Portal-related attributes.

context.name: ExtendedScope
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the extended scope Voice Portal-related attributes.

context.name: DNs
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the list of extended scope Voice Portals DNs.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the list of extended scope Voice Portals DNs.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a DN to the list of extended scope Voice Portals DNs.

parameter.name: dn
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a SIP-URI of an Extended Scope Voice Portal that can be used to allow access to any user in the system through FAC code dialing. The DN must be in E.164 format.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove a DN from the list of extended scope Voice Portals DNs.

parameter.name: dn
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a SIP-URI of an Extended Scope Voice Portal that can be used to allow access to any user in the system through FAC code dialing. The DN must be in E.164 format.

context.name: PublicIdentities
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the list of extended scope Voice Portals Public Identities.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the list of extended scope Voice Portals Public Identities.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a URI to the list of extended scope Voice Portals Public Identities.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a SIP-URI of an Extended Scope Voice Portal that can be used to allow access to any user in the system through FAC code dialing.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove a URI from the list of extended scope Voice Portals Public Identities.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a SIP-URI of an Extended Scope Voice Portal that can be used to allow access to any user in the system through FAC code dialing.

context.name: XSDiagnostic
context.description: This level is used to perform diagnostics tasks on the Execution Server.

context.name: DNS
context.description: This level is used to view, reload, and clear entries from BroadWorks DNS client cache.

command.name: clearAllCache
command.description: This command is used to clear all entries from the BroadWorks DNS client cache.

command.name: clearCache
command.description: This command is used to clear an individual entry from the BroadWorks DNS client cache. If recordType omitted, all address records (both A and AAAA) matching the network address are cleared.

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: The networks address identifying the entry in the DNS cache to be cleared.

parameter.name: recordType
parameter.description: The type of record to be cleared. The supported types include: NAPTR (Naming Authority Pointer), SRV (Service), A (IPv4 address), AAAA (IPv6 address), and PTR (pointer). If omitted, all address records (both A and AAAA) matching the network address are cleared.

command.name: lookup
command.description: This command is used to perform a name lookup using the BroadWorks DNS client. If recordType is not specified, address records are looked up using target system preference (i.e. "A" and/or "AAAA" records).

parameter.name: netAddress
parameter.description: The network address to be looked up.

parameter.name: recordType
parameter.description: The type of record to be looked up. The supported types include: NAPTR (Naming Authority Pointer), SRV (Service), A (IPv4 address), AAAA (IPv6 address), and PTR (pointer). If omitted, the default value is A and/or AAAA depending on system configuration.

command.name: reload
command.description: This command is used to reload static entries into the BroadWorks DNS client.

context.name: Diag
context.description: This level is used to manage sessions associated with DNs/users or devices.

command.name: audit
command.description: The audit command is used to audit a particular session.

parameter.name: sessionKey
parameter.description: The session key.

command.name: auditAll
command.description: The auditAll command is used to audit all sessions associated with a given DN or user.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Audit command filtering criteria.

parameter.name: userId
parameter.description: The userId command followed by the authentication user ID name of a subscriber to monitor.

parameter.name: phone
parameter.description: The phone number command, followed by the directory number of the subscriber to monitor.

command.name: dbNotif
command.description: This command is used to force database change notifications.

parameter.name: schema
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the schema.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.description: Specifies the operation.

parameter.name: resync
parameter.description: This parameter forces a refresh of all keys for the recovery of the database connection.

parameter.name: notify
parameter.description: This parameter executes a database change notification for an unspecified operation on a key.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the key. It is typically the name of the database table.

parameter.name: insert
parameter.description: This parameter executes a database change notification for an insertion.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the key. It is typically the name of the database table.

parameter.name: hint
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a hint. It is typically the unique index value of the row.

parameter.name: update
parameter.description: This parameter executes a database change notification for an update.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the key. It is typically the name of the database table.

parameter.name: hint
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a hint. It is typically the unique index value of the row.

parameter.name: delete
parameter.description: This parameter executes a database change notification for a deletion.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the key. It is typically the name of the database table.

parameter.name: hint
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a hint. It is typically the unique index value of the row.

command.name: dump
command.description: The dump command is used to dump the details of a particular session, or all sessions for a given DN or userID.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Dump command filtering criteria.

parameter.name: userId
parameter.description: The userId command followed by the authentication user ID name of a subscriber to monitor.

parameter.name: phone
parameter.description: The phone number command, followed by the directory number of the subscriber to monitor.

parameter.name: sessionKey
parameter.description: Unique session identifier. See the following example for details.

parameter.name: trunkGroup
parameter.description: Trunk group to monitor.

parameter.name: svcProviderId
parameter.description: Service provider ID to monitor.

parameter.name: groupId
parameter.description: The ID of the group.

parameter.name: trunkGroupName
parameter.description: Name of the trunk group to monitor.

parameter.name: option
parameter.description: Additional dump options.

command.name: heap
command.description: The heap command is used to view data associated with the Java Heap.

parameter.name: mainOption
parameter.description: Specifies how much information is shown.

command.name: kill
command.description: The kill command is used to kill a particular session.

parameter.name: sessionKey
parameter.description: The session to be killed.

command.name: killAll
command.description: The command is used to kill all sessions associated with a given DN or user. Consider using release instead of the kill all command.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Kill session command filtering criteria.

parameter.name: userId
parameter.description: The user ID.

parameter.name: phone
parameter.description: The phone number command, followed by the directory number of the subscriber to monitor.

command.name: list
command.description: The list command is used to view all the sessions associated with the given DN or userId; or simply all the sessions of the server when used without arguments.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: List command filtering criteria.

parameter.name: userId
parameter.description: The user ID.

parameter.name: phone
parameter.description: The phone number command, followed by the directory number of the subscriber to monitor.

command.name: pingDevice
command.description: The pingDevice command is used to perform an application layer ping using a user ID or phone.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: PingDevice command filtering criteria.

parameter.name: userId
parameter.description: The user ID.

parameter.name: phone
parameter.description: The phone number command, followed by the directory number of the subscriber to monitor.

command.name: release
command.description: The release command is used to release a particular call. Use this command instead of the kill or killAll commands whenever possible. The call ID's format is "SessionKey:n" where n is a number.

parameter.name: callId
parameter.description: The ID of the call to release.

context.name: Diameter
context.description: This level exposes Diameter-related tools that allow * Viewing complete Peer and Realm Routing Tables, including dynamic entries * Deleting Peer and Realm Routing Tables dynamic entries * Viewing extensive peer connection states * Test routing

command.name: fetchRoutes
command.description: This command is used to troubleshoot the Diameter routing configuration according to the current Peer Table/Realm Routing Table configuration and application. This commands displays the potential next hop(s) and final destination of an ACR (given a CCF), a CCR (given an OCS) or a Sh request. Only reachable next hops are displayed. Warning: using this command might cause the stack to create dynamic Peer and/or Realm Routing Table entries.

parameter.name: instance
parameter.description: The process for which the routing configuration is fetched.

parameter.name: applicationId
parameter.description: The application for which the routing configuration is fetched.

parameter.name: Rf
parameter.description: Fetch routes for the Rf applicationId.

parameter.name: ccf
parameter.description: A CCF, as it would be received in P-CFA header.

parameter.name: realm
parameter.description: Realm name.

parameter.name: Ro
parameter.description: Fetch routes for the Ro applicationId.

parameter.name: ocs
parameter.description: An OCS, as it would be received in P-CFA header.

parameter.name: realm
parameter.description: Realm name.

parameter.name: Sh
parameter.description: Fetch routes for the Sh applicationId.

parameter.name: realm
parameter.description: Realm name.

context.name: Peers
context.description: This level is used to view and delete entries from the Peer Table.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to display live Peer Table information. Both static and dynamic entries are displayed along with connection status.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a dynamic Peer Table entry.

parameter.name: instance
parameter.description: The process for which the Peer Table live information is displayed.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: The internal id of the peer, as displayed in the "Id" column from the "get" command.

context.name: Realms
context.description: This level is used to view and delete entries from the Realm Routing Table.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to display live Realm Routing information. Both static and dynamic entries are displayed.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a dynamic Realm Routing Table entry along with all associated Routing Peers. Static Realm Routing Table entries are deleted using the delete command under the XS_CLI/Interface/Diameter/Realms context.

parameter.name: instance
parameter.description: The process for which the Realm Routing Table entry will be deleted.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: The internal id of the realm, as displayed in the "Id" column from the "get" command.

context.name: RoutingPeers
context.description: This level is used to view Peers associated to a Realm Routing Table entry.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to display all Routing Peers associated to either a static or dynamic Realm Routing Table entry. For dynamic Realm Routing Table entries, the priority and weight were obtained from a DNS SRV lookup.

context.name: OverloadControls
context.description: This level is used to manage overload control-related attributes.

context.name: CallpUtil
context.description: This level is used to manage the call processing (CallP) overload related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the current overload zone value for CallP.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to manually set the current overload zone for CallP.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: currentZone
parameter.description: The current overload zone for call processing.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear the callP queues.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: Neighbors
context.description: This level is used to view Neighbor entries.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view a neighbor list sorted by traffic rate.

parameter.name: count
parameter.description: The maximum number of neighbors to display.

command.name: detail
command.description: This command is used to get traffic, state and capability information for a given neighbor.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: The neighbor IP address.

context.name: NonCallpUtil
context.description: This level is used to manage the non-call processing overload related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the current overload zone value for NonCallP.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to manually set the current overload zone for NonCallP.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: currentZone
parameter.description: The current overload zone for non-call processing.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear the NonCallP queues.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: QueueStats
context.description: Queues statistics can be viewed or modified at this level. Queues statistical data show information about the Execution Server's internal system queues. Queue statistics are intended for gathering performance data for testing and troubleshooting.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to get the internal queues statistics.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to configure the internal queues statistics.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: sampleIntervalSeconds
parameter.description: Sets sampling interval to specified period in seconds. Information is output to the debug log (if logging is enabled).

parameter.name: counts
parameter.description: When set to "reset", resets the queue statistics data to zero. When set to "sampleOff", turns off sampling (if samplingInterval is set).
